original: bug rdol du gyur pa dang / sha zad pa ni bug rdol du gyur ba dang sha zad pa ste /
analyzed: bug rdol du gyur pa dang / sha zad pa ni bug rdol du gyur ba dang sha zad pa ste /
translated: A tear or a hole is a tear or a hole in the seat.

original: de gnyis la ni sbyar bas glan bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la ni sbyar bas glan bar bya'o //
translated: A tear or a hole in the seat is to be repaired by sewing it together.

original: gal te bug rdol du gyur te bar skabs bar skabs su bug rdo la byung bar gyur tam sha zad par gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bug rdol du gyur te bar skabs bar skabs su bug rdo la byung bar gyur tam sha zad par gyur te /
translated: If a tear or a hole occurs in the middle of the seat, or if the seat becomes thin and worn,

original: srab mor gyur na de'i tshe stan bug rdol @228a * //
analyzed: srab mor gyur na de'i tshe stan bug rdol @228a * //
translated: then the seat is to be repaired by sewing it together.

original: du gyur tam sha zad par gyur na de la sbyar ba zhes bya ba rim gcig gis glan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du gyur tam sha zad par gyur na de la sbyar ba zhes bya ba rim gcig gis glan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the seat is torn or worn, then it is to be repaired by sewing it together.

original: bcos dka' ba nyid yin na sbyin no zhes bya ba la /🔽bcos dka' ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcos dka' ba nyid yin na sbyin no zhes bya ba la / bcos dka' ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: If it is difficult to repair, then it is to be given away.

original: dka' bas phyir bcos par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: dka' bas phyir bcos par mi nus pa ste /
translated: Difficult to repair means that it cannot be repaired because of difficulty.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do ;
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do ;
translated: The nature of that is just that.

original: / bcos dka' ba nyid de la ni gnang ba sbyin no //
analyzed: / bcos dka' ba nyid de la ni gnang ba sbyin no //
translated: A difficult repair is to be given permission.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te sngar bstan pa'i bcos pa'i thabs kyis phyir bcos par mi nus pa yin na de'i tshe stan gzhan bya ba'i phyir gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sngar bstan pa'i bcos pa'i thabs kyis phyir bcos par mi nus pa yin na de'i tshe stan gzhan bya ba'i phyir gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If one is unable to repair it by the previously explained method of repair, then at that time permission to make another seat should be given.

original: 'di ltar lag gi bla'i phyir gsungs pa ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gi phyir yin gyi gzhan la yang nye bar sbyar du rung ba'i phyir spyir mdor bris so //
analyzed: 'di ltar lag gi bla'i phyir gsungs pa ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gi phyir yin gyi gzhan la yang nye bar sbyar du rung ba'i phyir spyir mdor bris so //
translated: This is stated for the sake of the frame story, but since it is suitable to apply to others, it is written in the sutra in general.

original: ci zhig byas na lo drug tu bcad pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas na lo drug tu bcad pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done that becomes a downfall requiring forfeiture after six years?

original: de'i phyir gnang ba ma thob pa gzhan yod pa'am rang dgar btang bas lo drug ma lon par stan byas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnang ba ma thob pa gzhan yod pa'am rang dgar btang bas lo drug ma lon par stan byas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If one makes a seat without obtaining permission, or if one gives up the rule, and the seat is made before six years have passed.”

original: dge slong gang gis stan bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun las gnang ba ma thob ba de ni gnang ba ma thob pa ste des so //
analyzed: dge slong gang gis stan bya ba'i phyir dge 'dun las gnang ba ma thob ba de ni gnang ba ma thob pa ste des so //
translated: If a monk makes a seat without obtaining permission from the saṅgha to make a seat, then he has not obtained permission.

original: gzhan yod pa'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yod pa'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If another exists” means

original: stan gzhan yod pa'o //
analyzed: stan gzhan yod pa'o //
translated: if another seat exists.

original: rang dgar btang bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang dgar btang bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one gives up the rule” means

original: rang gi mos pas yongs su btang ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mos pas yongs su btang ba'o //
translated: It is relinquished through one’s own volition.

original: lo drug ma lon par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lo drug ma lon par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not having completed six years” means

original: gang gis stan gzhan byas nas sam rang dgar btang nas lo drug ma lon pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis stan gzhan byas nas sam rang dgar btang nas lo drug ma lon pa ste /
translated: that one has not completed six years, having made another seat or having relinquished it at will.

original: de'i tshe'o // stan byas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe'o // stan byas pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “When one has made a seat” means

original: de'i tshe stan zin par byas pa nyid na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe stan zin par byas pa nyid na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that when one has made a seat at that time, it becomes a downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te dge slong la rang gi stan yod dam /
analyzed: gal te dge slong la rang gi stan yod dam /
translated: If a monk has his own seat,🔽or if he makes another seat at will, and if he has not completed six years, and if he has not obtained permission from the saṅgha, it becomes a downfall.

original: 'on te rang dgar de yongs su gtong bar byed cing lo drug kyang ma lon la dge 'dun las gnang ba yang ma thob pa'i bar du stan gzhan byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on te rang dgar de yongs su gtong bar byed cing lo drug kyang ma lon la dge 'dun las gnang ba yang ma thob pa'i bar du stan gzhan byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: blings pa'i stan gyi ltung ba'i dbang du byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: blings pa'i stan gyi ltung ba'i dbang du byas pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as being in the context of the downfall of a hidden seat.

original: brtsams pa nyid na rtsom na zin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtsams pa nyid na rtsom na zin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “When one has begun, it is as if one has finished” means🔽that when one has begun, it is as if one has finished.

original: brtsams pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtsams pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “At the very outset” means

original: stan dang po brtsams pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: stan dang po brtsams pa nyid na'o //
translated: at the very beginning of the project.

original: rtsom na zhes bya ba ni /🔽brtsams pa de nyid dang lhan cig tu'am /
analyzed: rtsom na zhes bya ba ni / brtsams pa de nyid dang lhan cig tu'am /
translated: “If he begins” means🔽if he begins the second mat at the same time as the first or

original: phyis stan gzhan rtsom na'o //
analyzed: phyis stan gzhan rtsom na'o //
translated: afterward.

original: zin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It is as if it were finished” means

original: snga ma shos byas zin nas cig shos rtsom pa dang 'dra ste @228b nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma shos byas zin nas cig shos rtsom pa dang 'dra ste @228b nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: that it is as if he had finished the first and then begun the second. It is a minor infraction.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te dge slong gis stan rtsom par byed cing brtsams pa de nyid dang lhan cig tu'am phyis stan gnyis pa rtsom par byed na ji ltar snga ma shos zin nas gzhan rtsom pa na nyes byas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du stan brtsams nas lhan cig tu'am
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gal te dge slong gis stan rtsom par byed cing brtsams pa de nyid dang lhan cig tu'am phyis stan gnyis pa rtsom par byed na ji ltar snga ma shos zin nas gzhan rtsom pa na nyes byas su 'gyur ba de bzhin du stan brtsams nas lhan cig tu'am
translated: This is the teaching:

original: phyis gnyis pa yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis gnyis pa yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk begins a mat and then begins a second mat at the same time or afterward, then just as it is a minor infraction when he finishes the first and then begins the second, so it is a minor infraction when he begins the second mat at the same time as or🔽afterward.🔽“It is not the case that there is no offense when it is completed” means

original: mthar thug na sbyor ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthar thug na sbyor ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that

original: stan phyis brtsams pa shos sngar mthar thug ste zin par gyur na yang sbyor ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: stan phyis brtsams pa shos sngar mthar thug ste zin par gyur na yang sbyor ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: If the last one is completed first, then the preparatory act does not become a downfall.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyes byas su 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyes byas su 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: It is only a wrong doing that is a downfall of a preparatory act.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te dge slong gis sngar stan gcig rtsom par byed cing phyis gnyis pa rtsom par byed la phyis brtsams pa shos sngar zin par byed na de'i tshe dngos gzhi'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te de'i tshe na gnyis pa zin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis sngar stan gcig rtsom par byed cing phyis gnyis pa rtsom par byed la phyis brtsams pa shos sngar zin par byed na de'i tshe dngos gzhi'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te de'i tshe na gnyis pa zin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a monk first prepares one mat and later prepares a second, but if he completes the first one first, then it does not become a downfall of the actual basis because at that time the second one is not completed.

original: phyi ma shos rtsom pa'i dus nyid na sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyes byas nyid du ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma shos rtsom pa'i dus nyid na sbyor ba'i ltung ba nyes byas nyid du ni 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of preparing the second one, it is only a wrong doing that is a downfall of a preparatory act.

original: 'di ltar gang kho na las sbyor ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba de kho na las dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba de ltar ni rig par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang kho na las sbyor ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba de kho na las dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba de ltar ni rig par mi bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that it is not so that the actual basis is a downfall in the same way that the preparatory act is a downfall.

original: stan gnyis pa zin pa'i gnas skabs la dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan gnyis pa zin pa'i gnas skabs la dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the state of sitting on a second seat, it becomes a downfall of the main part.

original: rab tu byung ba gzhan gyi ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gzhan gyi ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For another who is fully ordained, it is different.

original: sngon dang phyis rab tu byung ba gnyis ni tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: sngon dang phyis rab tu byung ba gnyis ni tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: The two, who are fully ordained earlier and later, are different.

original: rgyun tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that they are different streams.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽dge slong gis rab tu byung ba snga ma'i tshe stan rtsom par byed dam /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / dge slong gis rab tu byung ba snga ma'i tshe stan rtsom par byed dam /
translated: This is taught.

original: zin par byed cing de nas rab tu byung ba phyi ma'i tshe stan gzhan rtsom mam byed na /
analyzed: zin par byed cing de nas rab tu byung ba phyi ma'i tshe stan gzhan rtsom mam byed na /
translated: If a fully ordained monk, in the time of being fully ordained earlier, either begins or completes a seat, and then in the time of being fully ordained later, either begins or completes another seat,

original: dus yongs su rdzogs pa'i sngon rol yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: dus yongs su rdzogs pa'i sngon rol yin du zin kyang /
translated: even if the time is not complete,

original: de lta mod kyi nyes pa med de rab tu byung ba gzhan ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi nyes pa med de rab tu byung ba gzhan ni tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nevertheless there is no fault, because another who is fully ordained is different.

original: khyim pa'i gnas skabs bzhin te /
analyzed: khyim pa'i gnas skabs bzhin te /
translated: It is like the state of being a layperson.

original: ji ltar khyim pas stan rtsom ma byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khyim pas stan rtsom ma byed kyang rung ste /
translated: Just as a layperson, whether or not he has begun a seat,

original: phyis rab tu 'byung zhing stan gzhan rtsom pa'am byed na de la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phyis rab tu 'byung zhing stan gzhan rtsom pa'am byed na de la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Later, if he goes forth and makes or has another make a mat, he does not commit an offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis lo drug gi mdun rol du stan bgyid cing /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis lo drug gi mdun rol du stan bgyid cing /
translated: Here, in some texts, a question is asked: “Can a monk make a mat before six years have passed?

original: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
analyzed: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
translated: And is there no offense?”

original: yod de lo drug gi mdun rol du babs shing de yang bsnyen par rdzogs nas stan gzhan byed pa la ltung ba med pa @229a * //
analyzed: yod de lo drug gi mdun rol du babs shing de yang bsnyen par rdzogs nas stan gzhan byed pa la ltung ba med pa @229a * //
translated: “Yes, if he makes a mat before six years have passed, but only after he has been fully ordained, and if he makes another mat, there is no offense.🔽And if he makes a mat after six years have passed, there is no offense.”

original: yin no // stan brtsams te babs pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yin no // stan brtsams te babs pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /🔽// / bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to / // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: The prohibition on keeping a mat for six years has been explained.

original: ci zhig byas na mtho gang gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas na mtho gang gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense for a mat that is a hand-span too big?

original: de'i phyir gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa'i gding ba gsar pa spyod na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa'i gding ba gsar pa spyod na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one uses a new sitting mat that is more comfortable than the old one by the breadth of a sugata.”

original: gding ba gsar pa gang la gding ba rnying ba las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa de ni gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa ste /
analyzed: gding ba gsar pa gang la gding ba rnying ba las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa de ni gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa ste /
translated: A new sitting mat is one that is more comfortable than the old sitting mat by the breadth of a sugata.

original: khyad par de lta bu can gyi gding ba gsar pa so sor gding ba spyod na spyod pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par de lta bu can gyi gding ba gsar pa so sor gding ba spyod na spyod pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one uses a new sitting mat that has this distinction, then one commits an abandoning offense.

original: sar pa zhes bya ba ni gsar du byas pas sar pa dang / gsar du rnyed pas sar pa ste /
analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni gsar du byas pas sar pa dang / gsar du rnyed pas sar pa ste /
translated: New means new in the sense of newly made, or new in the sense of newly acquired.

original: de las 'dir ni gsar du byas pas sar pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: de las 'dir ni gsar du byas pas sar pa bzung ngo //
translated: Here, new is taken to mean newly made.

original: de'i phyir gal te gding ba gsar du byas pa zhig ga las rnyed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te gding ba gsar du byas pa zhig ga las rnyed kyang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, if one uses a new sitting mat, regardless of where it was obtained,

original: dge slong des de la yang rang gi gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis glan par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des de la yang rang gi gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis glan par bya'o //
translated: That monk should also add a handspan of the Sugata to his own old sitting mat.

original: ci gding ba rnying pa med na yang bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa'i gding ba gsar pa spyod pa la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag gam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci gding ba rnying pa med na yang bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa'i gding ba gsar pa spyod pa la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag gam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: If there is no old sitting mat, is there a downfall in using a new sitting mat that is not added to by a handspan of the Sugata? No, there is not.🔽Therefore it says,

original: gal te yod na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te yod na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “If there is one.”

original: gal te gding ba rnying pa yod na des de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gding ba rnying pa yod na des de ltar bya'o //
translated: If there is an old sitting mat, one should act in that way.

original: ci gal te ril gyis yod na yang de'i phyir ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci gal te ril gyis yod na yang de'i phyir ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If there is only a little of it, does that mean there is a downfall?🔽Therefore it says,

original: de'i phyir de tsam na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de tsam na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Even if it is that much.”

original: gal te bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam zhig yod na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam zhig yod na yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even if there is only a handspan of the Sugata, that is what it means.

original: ci gal te sra ba de tsam zhig yod na'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci gal te sra ba de tsam zhig yod na'am zhe na /
translated: If it is that much, but it is not solid, is there a downfall?🔽Therefore it says,

original: de'i phyir bcos par nus na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcos par nus na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “If it can be repaired.”

original: gal te bcos par nus na ste /
analyzed: gal te bcos par nus na ste /
translated: If it can be repaired,

original: gal te bcos su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽mthud cing sbyar du rung bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te bcos su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mthud cing sbyar du rung bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: if it is suitable to be repaired, is what is meant.🔽Also, if it is suitable to be sewn together,

original: dam dum mthud cing sbyar du rung na nges kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dam dum mthud cing sbyar du rung na nges kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: if it is suitable to be sewn together tightly, then it is also suitable to be repaired, is what is meant.

original: de lta bu med na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu med na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it is not like that, there is no offense, is what is meant.

original: mtho gang gi spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: mtho gang gi spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The measure of a cubit has been explained.

original: // / ci zhig byas na bal thogs pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na bal thogs pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done to incur the offense of carrying wool?

original: de'i phyir khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las 'das @229b par lug gi bal khyer na'o yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las 'das @229b par lug gi bal khyer na'o yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If one carries wool more than three yojanas without being accompanied, or even if accompanied.

original: khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las 'das par lug gi bal khyer na rgyang grags kyi mthar phyin na spang ba'o //
analyzed: khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las 'das par lug gi bal khyer na rgyang grags kyi mthar phyin na spang ba'o //
translated: ” If one carries wool more than three yojanas without being accompanied, then if one goes to the end of a krośa, there is an offense.

original: rgyang grags phyed du phyin na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyang grags phyed du phyin na nyes byas so //
translated: If one goes half a krośa, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: khyer ba yod bzhin du bdag nyid kyis khyer na ni rtsom pa'i dus kho na ni nyes byas gzhan gcig go //
analyzed: khyer ba yod bzhin du bdag nyid kyis khyer na ni rtsom pa'i dus kho na ni nyes byas gzhan gcig go //
translated: If one carries it oneself while it is being carried, then at the time of beginning, there is one offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyang grags phyed du phyin na nyes byas gzhan gcig go //
analyzed: rgyang grags phyed du phyin na nyes byas gzhan gcig go //
translated: If one goes half a krośa, there is another offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyang grags kyi mthar phyin na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi mthar phyin na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one goes the full krośa, there is a pāyattika offense.

original: 'gro ba ni gnyis su gsungs te ltung ba dang bcas pa dang / ltung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni gnyis su gsungs te ltung ba dang bcas pa dang / ltung ba med pa'o //
translated: Going is said to be of two types: with a downfall and without a downfall.

original: de la ltung ba dang bcas pa ni bal thogs pa dang dge slong ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba dang / dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang / skyes pa med par bud med dang lam du 'gro ba dang / rkun ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la ltung ba dang bcas pa ni bal thogs pa dang dge slong ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba dang / dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang / skyes pa med par bud med dang lam du 'gro ba dang / rkun ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'o //
translated: In that regard, going with a downfall is carrying wool, going on the road with a fully ordained nun, going in a boat with a fully ordained nun, going on the road with a woman without a man, and going on the road with a thief.

original: ltung ba med pa ni yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang khrus byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang khrus byed pa'o //
translated: Going without a downfall is eating again, eating in a group, and bathing.

original: de la ltung ba med pa ni dpag tshad phyed phyed do zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la ltung ba med pa ni dpag tshad phyed phyed do zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: In that regard, going without a downfall is half a krośa, as will be explained below.

original: ltung ba dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ltung ba dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that there is a downfall,

original: lam du 'gro ba ni rgyang grags kyi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba ni rgyang grags kyi bdag nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “Walking on the road is the measure of a krośa.”

original: lam du 'gro ba ni lam du zhugs te 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba ni lam du zhugs te 'gro ba'o //
translated: Walking on the road is walking on a road.

original: 'gro ba de ni rgyang grags kyi bdag nyid de rgyang grags kyi mthar phyin na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba de ni rgyang grags kyi bdag nyid de rgyang grags kyi mthar phyin na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That walking is the measure of a krośa. If one goes to the end of a krośa, there is a downfall. This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: bal thogs pa la sogs pa lam du 'gro ba'i rgyu las kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba dag la ni rgyang grags kyi tshad tsam du song na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bal thogs pa la sogs pa lam du 'gro ba'i rgyu las kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba dag la ni rgyang grags kyi tshad tsam du song na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who carry wool and so on, who are on the road, and who have a downfall from the cause of going on the road, if they go the measure of a krośa, there is a root downfall.

original: phyed du na sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyed du na sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Half of that is preparation”

original: rgyang grags kyi phyed kyi bdag nyid du son na sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi phyed kyi bdag nyid du son na sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: means that if one goes the measure of half a krośa, there is preparation.

original: de tsam du son na sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de tsam du son na sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If one goes that much, the preparation is complete.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rgyang grags phyed du song na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rgyang grags phyed du song na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the text says that if one goes half a krośa, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rgyang grags su son na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyang grags su son na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one goes a furlong, there is an offense entailing confession.

original: rdzu 'phrul las gzhan pas nam mkha' la 'gro na nyes byas so zhes bya ba la /🔽rdzu 'phrul las gzhan pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul las gzhan pas nam mkha' la 'gro na nyes byas so zhes bya ba la / rdzu 'phrul las gzhan pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one goes through the sky by means other than supernormal power, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rdzu 'phrul las gzhan pa gsang sngags la sogs pa thabs gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul las gzhan pa gsang sngags la sogs pa thabs gzhan gyis te /
translated: “By means other than supernormal power” means by other means such as mantra.

original: des nam mkha' la 'gro na nyes byas so //
analyzed: des nam mkha' la 'gro na nyes byas so //
translated: If one goes through the sky by those means, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one goes by supernormal power, there is no offense.

original: sprul pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sprul pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Also by emanation” means

original: kyang ngo @230a * //
analyzed: kyang ngo @230a * //
translated: also by emanation.

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “also” is added to the verse because it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sprul pa yang rdzu 'phrul gyis byas pa yin pas des 'gro na yang nyes pa med do snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sprul pa yang rdzu 'phrul gyis byas pa yin pas des 'gro na yang nyes pa med do snyam pa bsal ba'i phyir nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since emanation is also created by supernormal power, if one goes by that, there is no offense.

original: de ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi dbang du byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi dbang du byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is done in consideration of the physical expression.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis nam mkha' las bal 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis nam mkha' las bal 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: “Venerable, what if a monk takes wool from the sky?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If he takes it with magical power, there is no offense.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi khyer na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi khyer na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If he takes it in another way, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis sprul pa rung ba bgyis pas 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis sprul pa rung ba bgyis pas 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Venerable, what if a monk takes what is suitable for a magical creation?

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽zhva dang lham sgrog gu can dang / stod kor nang tshangs can dang / rgya cang dang / lcag po dang / shur bu phre'u la sogs pa'i don du de tsam dag la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no // zhva dang lham sgrog gu can dang / stod kor nang tshangs can dang / rgya cang dang / lcag po dang / shur bu phre'u la sogs pa'i don du de tsam dag la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct.”🔽There is no offense for the sake of boots, shoes with straps, upper garments with linings, buttons, belts, and so on.

original: zhva la sogs pa'i tshad ldang ba tsam zhva la sogs pa'i ched du khyer ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhva la sogs pa'i tshad ldang ba tsam zhva la sogs pa'i ched du khyer ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no offense if one takes just enough for boots and so on for the purpose of boots and so on.

original: rgyang grags dang dpag tshad kyi tshad rdul phra rab la sogs pa las bsgyur te bsgre ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyang grags dang dpag tshad kyi tshad rdul phra rab la sogs pa las bsgyur te bsgre ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The following verse is stated to illustrate the measure of a krosa and yojana in terms of atoms and so on.

original: rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu dang / lcags dang / ri bong dang / lug dang / glang dang ; nyi zer gyi rdul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang / nas dang / sor rnams ni snga ma drug la phyi ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu dang / lcags dang / ri bong dang / lug dang / glang dang ; nyi zer gyi rdul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang / nas dang / sor rnams ni snga ma drug la phyi ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The atom, molecule, water, iron, rabbit, sheep, elephant, sunbeam, louse, nit, barley grain, and finger joint are the next six.

original: rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu dang lcags dang ri bong dang / lug dang glang dang nyi zer ni de dag nyid de so sor phye nas phyis rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra dang sbyar te drug la phyi ma gcig go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu dang lcags dang ri bong dang / lug dang glang dang nyi zer ni de dag nyid de so sor phye nas phyis rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra dang sbyar te drug la phyi ma gcig go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The atom paramāṇu, molecule anu, water, iron, rabbit, sheep, elephant, and sunbeam are just that. After distinguishing them, the term “atom” is applied to them. The next six are applied to the six, one after another.

original: rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chu la sogs pa man chad dang so sor sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdul zhes bya ba'i sgra ni chu la sogs pa man chad dang so sor sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The term “atom” is applied to water and so on, one after another.

original: chu rdul dang / lcags rdul dang / ri bong rdul dang / lug rdul dang / glang rdul dang / nyi zer gyi rdul zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chu rdul dang / lcags rdul dang / ri bong rdul dang / lug rdul dang / glang rdul dang / nyi zer gyi rdul zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The terms “water particle,” “iron particle,” “rabbit particle,” “sheep particle,” “cow particle,” and “sunlight particle” are applied to these.

original: de bzhin du sro ma dang shig dang nas dang sor yang de dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sro ma dang shig dang nas dang sor yang de dag nyid yin te /
translated: Similarly, the terms “sesame seed,” “louse egg,” “barley seed,” and “finger width” are also applied to these.

original: rdul phra rab la sogs pa sor gyi mthar thug pa de rnams ni snga ma drug la phyi ma gcig tu bsgyur cing bsgre'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la sogs pa sor gyi mthar thug pa de rnams ni snga ma drug la phyi ma gcig tu bsgyur cing bsgre'o //
translated: The number of particles, from the most subtle to the size of a finger, is calculated by multiplying the previous number by six.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: rdul phra rab drug la rdul phra mo gcig go //
analyzed: rdul phra rab drug la rdul phra mo gcig go //
translated: Six subtle particles make one fine particle.

original: rdul phra mo drug la chu rdul gcig go //🔽chu rdul drug la lcags rdul gcig @230b go ;
analyzed: rdul phra mo drug la chu rdul gcig go // chu rdul drug la lcags rdul gcig @230b go ;
translated: Six fine particles make one water particle.🔽Six water particles make one iron particle.

original: / lcags rdul drug la ri bong rdul gcig go //🔽ri bong rdul drug la lug rdul gcig go //
analyzed: / lcags rdul drug la ri bong rdul gcig go // ri bong rdul drug la lug rdul gcig go //
translated: Six iron particles make one rabbit particle.🔽Six rabbit particles make one sheep particle.

original: lug rdul drug la glang rdul gcig go //🔽glang rdul drug la nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go //
analyzed: lug rdul drug la glang rdul gcig go // glang rdul drug la nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go //
translated: Six sheep particles make one cow particle.🔽Six cow particles make one sunlight particle.

original: nyi zer gyi rdul drug la sro ma gcig go //
analyzed: nyi zer gyi rdul drug la sro ma gcig go //
translated: Six sunlight particles make one sesame seed.

original: sro ma drug la shig gcig go //
analyzed: sro ma drug la shig gcig go //
translated: Six sesame seeds make one louse egg.

original: shig drug la nas gcig go //🔽nas drug la sor gcig go //
analyzed: shig drug la nas gcig go // nas drug la sor gcig go //
translated: Six lice eggs is one barley seed.🔽Six barley seeds is one finger width.

original: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo //
analyzed: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo //
translated: Four or six finger widths is one cubit.

original: khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do //
analyzed: khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do //
translated: Four and a half cubits is one human armspan.

original: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
analyzed: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
translated: Four cubits is one bow-length.

original: de lnga brgyal rgyang grags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lnga brgyal rgyang grags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Five hundred of those is one krosa.

original: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo zhes bya ba ni sor bzhi phrag drug la khru gang ste /
analyzed: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo zhes bya ba ni sor bzhi phrag drug la khru gang ste /
translated: Four or six finger widths is one cubit means that six finger widths is one cubit.

original: sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la khru gang du brtsi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la khru gang du brtsi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that twenty-four finger widths is one cubit.

original: mi gang la srid du khru phyed dang bzhi yod pa de dag ni khru phyed dang bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: mi gang la srid du khru phyed dang bzhi yod pa de dag ni khru phyed dang bzhi pa ste /
translated: Four and a half cubits is one human armspan means that four and a half cubits is one human armspan.

original: de ni khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid ces bya'o //🔽khru bzhi la gzhu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni khru phyed dang bzhi la mi'i srid ces bya'o // khru bzhi la gzhu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that four and a half cubits is one human armspan.🔽Four cubits is one bow-length means that four cubits is one bow-length.

original: gzhu gang la khru bzhi'i tshad yod pa de ni khru bzhi pa'i gzhu'o //
analyzed: gzhu gang la khru bzhi'i tshad yod pa de ni khru bzhi pa'i gzhu'o //
translated: The meaning is that four cubits is one bow-length.

original: de lnga brgya la rgyang grags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lnga brgya la rgyang grags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Five hundred of those is one krosa.

original: gzhu de lnga brgya la rgyang grags gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhu de lnga brgya la rgyang grags gcig ces bya'o //
translated: Five hundred of these are one krośa.

original: rgyang grags brgyad la ni dpag tshad gcig go //
analyzed: rgyang grags brgyad la ni dpag tshad gcig go //
translated: Eight of these are one yojana.

original: nas 'bru drug glos gshibs pa la sor gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nas 'bru drug glos gshibs pa la sor gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Six barley grains placed end to end equal one barley grain placed across.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nas drug la sor mo'i tshigs gcig go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nas drug la sor mo'i tshigs gcig go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says that six barley grains placed end to end equal one joint of a finger.

original: dgon pas 'dul ba la tha snyad btags pa'i phyir 'dir de'i tshad kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgon pas 'dul ba la tha snyad btags pa'i phyir 'dir de'i tshad kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The measure of a monastery is stated here because the term “monastery” is used in the scriptures in an extended sense.

original: dgon pa'i dang po ni de'i mtha'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgon pa'i dang po ni de'i mtha'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The first of the monasteries is its boundary.

original: dgon pa'i dang po ni rgyang grags de'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dgon pa'i dang po ni rgyang grags de'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first of the monasteries is its boundary.

original: de phan chad ni dgon pa yin par ma smras kyang grub po //
analyzed: de phan chad ni dgon pa yin par ma smras kyang grub po //
translated: Beyond that, it is a monastery even if it is not called a monastery.

original: lus kyis khur mi bskur ro zhes bya ba la /🔽lus kyi khur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyis khur mi bskur ro zhes bya ba la / lus kyi khur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not carry a load on the body.🔽A load on the body

original: phrag rdang gi khur la bya ste /
analyzed: phrag rdang gi khur la bya ste /
translated: means a load on the shoulder.

original: phrag rdang gis khur bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phrag rdang gis khur bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not carry a load on the shoulder.

original: glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang mgo bo dag gis mi bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang mgo bo dag gis mi bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not carry a load on the chest, back, waist, or head.

original: glo la sogs pas khur gang yang bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: glo la sogs pas khur gang yang bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not carry any load on the chest and so on.

original: 'dir thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not suspect that this is not the common practice.

original: khur bskur ba'i skabs 'dir dge slong dang dge slong ma'i bslab pa'i gzhi thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: khur bskur ba'i skabs 'dir dge slong dang dge slong ma'i bslab pa'i gzhi thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not suspect that this is not the common practice of the training precepts for monks and nuns in the context of carrying a load.

original: 'di ltar thun mong nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar thun mong nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the common practice.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: @231a * // dge slong dag 'ba' zhig gis lus kyi khur la sogs pa bskur bar mi bya bar ma zad kyi dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: @231a * // dge slong dag 'ba' zhig gis lus kyi khur la sogs pa bskur bar mi bya bar ma zad kyi dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: Not only should monks not carry a load on the body and so on, but nuns also should not carry it.

original: khur phyed las lhag par bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khur phyed las lhag par bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not carry a load greater than half one’s own weight.

original: mi'i khur gyi phyed gang yin pa de las lhag pa'i khur dge slong gis bskur bar mi bya'o ;
analyzed: mi'i khur gyi phyed gang yin pa de las lhag pa'i khur dge slong gis bskur bar mi bya'o ;
translated: A monk should not carry a load greater than half a human load.

original: /'dir gzhung ni mi'i khur gcig gang yin pa de dge slong gnyis kyis khur bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: /'dir gzhung ni mi'i khur gcig gang yin pa de dge slong gnyis kyis khur bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here states that “whatever is one man’s load should be carried by two monks.”

original: bal thogs pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: bal thogs pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The prohibition against carrying wool has been explained.

original: // / bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: The prohibition against having wool washed will now be explained.🔽The rule on having wool washed was blessed in the past. If a monk asks someone to wash, dye, or comb his old wool, or to make it into felt,

original: de ni sngar 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying pa 'khrur gzhug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' zhig bsgo bas 'khur bcug gam /
analyzed: de ni sngar 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying pa 'khrur gzhug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' zhig bsgo bas 'khur bcug gam /
translated: or if he asks someone to wash, dye, or comb his old wool, or to make it into felt,

original: 'tshed du bcug gam /
analyzed: 'tshed du bcug gam /
translated: and then has it carried, or has it cooked, or has it combed, he commits an offense.

original: 'chag tu bcug pa nyid na'o zhes smos pa nyid dang rnam pa 'dra ba kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chag tu bcug pa nyid na'o zhes smos pa nyid dang rnam pa 'dra ba kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in the same way as the rule on having wool washed.

original: 'dir bye brag 'ga' tsam yod pa gang yin pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag 'ga' tsam yod pa gang yin pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: I will now explain the few differences that exist.

original: chos gos rnying pa'i gnas su lug gi bal dag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos rnying pa'i gnas su lug gi bal dag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Old wool” means wool that is not suitable for making robes or blankets.

original: sngar 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying pa 'khrur gzhug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' zhig ces smos pa'i gnas su 'dir lug gi bal dag ces bya bar gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying pa 'khrur gzhug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' zhig ces smos pa'i gnas su 'dir lug gi bal dag ces bya bar gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In the section on the downfall of making others do dyeing, the word “old” refers to one’s own old robes and rugs that are suitable for dyeing.

original: 'chag pa rmel ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'chag pa rmel ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To weave” means to have wool woven.

original: 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su 'chag pa zhes smos pa'i gnas su 'dir rmel ba zhes brjod par bya ste /🔽'khrur bcug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su 'khrur 'jug gam /🔽'tshed du 'jug gam /
analyzed: 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su 'chag pa zhes smos pa'i gnas su 'dir rmel ba zhes brjod par bya ste / 'khrur bcug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su 'khrur 'jug gam / 'tshed du 'jug gam /
translated: In the section on the downfall of making others do dyeing, the word “weave” is used.

original: 'chag tu bcug pa dag na'o zhes smos pa de 'dir ni 'khrur bcug gam /🔽'tshed du bcug gam /
analyzed: 'chag tu bcug pa dag na'o zhes smos pa de 'dir ni 'khrur bcug gam / 'tshed du bcug gam /
translated: In the section on the downfall of making others do dyeing, the words “to have it dyed, to have it spun, or to have it woven” are used.

original: rmel du bcug pa dag na'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rmel du bcug pa dag na'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, the words “to have it dyed, to have it spun, or to have it woven” are used.

original: bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of having wool woven has been explained.

original: // / ci zhig byas na gser dngul la reg pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na gser dngul la reg pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall of handling gold and silver?

original: de'i phyir rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “if one appropriates it as one’s own.”

original: padma r'a ga la sogs pa bdag gir byas shing dang du len na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las rkang pa'i drung na mo'i ro myong ngam //
analyzed: padma r'a ga la sogs pa bdag gir byas shing dang du len na spang ba'i ltung byed do // 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las rkang pa'i drung na mo'i ro myong ngam //
translated: If one appropriates and accepts a precious substance such as a ruby, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'thob pa'i gnas nas le sbram gyi rdzas 'dug pa bdag gir byed na spang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i gnas nas le sbram gyi rdzas 'dug pa bdag gir byed na spang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, some texts say: “If one tastes a woman’s mouth, or if one appropriates a precious substance from a place where it is obtained, there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gnas @231b skabs gang la bdag gir byed pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnas @231b skabs gang la bdag gir byed pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In what situation is the appropriation completed?

original: de'i phyir lcogs pa nyid na de rdzogs so zhes bya ba smras te /🔽bdag gir bya ba'i dngos po rin po che la sogs pa lcogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lcogs pa nyid na de rdzogs so zhes bya ba smras te / bdag gir bya ba'i dngos po rin po che la sogs pa lcogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “It is completed when one is able to take possession of it.”

original: thob par nus pa nyid dang lag tu 'ong bar nus pa nyid na bdag gir bya ba de yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: thob par nus pa nyid dang lag tu 'ong bar nus pa nyid na bdag gir bya ba de yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: The appropriation of a precious substance, etc., is completed when one is able to take possession of it, when one is able to obtain it and bring it into one’s possession.

original: de bas pha zad na ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas pha zad na ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Beyond that, it is said: “Half of it is completed.”

original: lcogs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs pas pa zad na 'dug na ni bdag gir bya ba'i phyed nyid de nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lcogs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs pas pa zad na 'dug na ni bdag gir bya ba'i phyed nyid de nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one takes possession of it when it is in a place where one is allowed to be, then it is half of the basis of the offense, and it is said that one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: bdag gir bya ba'i dngos po rin po che la sogs pa lag tu thob par rung ba nyid yin la de bdag gir byed na ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba'i dngos po rin po che la sogs pa lag tu thob par rung ba nyid yin la de bdag gir byed na ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If one takes possession of a thing that is one’s own, such as a precious substance that is suitable to be held in one’s hand, then it is the basis of the offense.

original: mi rung ba nyid la bdag gir byed na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi rung ba nyid la bdag gir byed na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one takes possession of something that is not suitable to be one’s own, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de yang thob pa'i gnas zhes bya ba las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang thob pa'i gnas zhes bya ba las rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood from the statement, “The basis of taking possession.”

original: thob pa'i gnas nas sa le sbram gyi rdzas 'dug pa bdag gir byad na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa'i gnas nas sa le sbram gyi rdzas 'dug pa bdag gir byad na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, “If one takes possession of a substance of refined gold that is in a place where it is allowed to be taken, then it is the basis of the offense.”

original: ci 'dir bdag gir byed pa zhes bya ba gcig pu rjes su sgrub na spang ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dir bdag gir byed pa zhes bya ba gcig pu rjes su sgrub na spang ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If one takes possession of it alone, does this become the basis of the offense?

original: de'i phyir rang gi rung bar ma byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rung bar ma byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If one does not make it one’s own, it is also the basis of the offense.”

original: rung ba ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not making it one’s own” means

original: dngos po gang la 'og nas 'byung ba'i rung bar byas pa zhes bya ba de ma byas pa de ni rung bar ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la 'og nas 'byung ba'i rung bar byas pa zhes bya ba de ma byas pa de ni rung bar ma byas pa ste /
translated: That which is not made suitable, as will be explained below, is not made suitable.

original: rin po che la sogs pa'i dngos po rung bar ma byas pa de la 'og nas 'byung ba'i rig pa dang / reg tu bcug na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rin po che la sogs pa'i dngos po rung bar ma byas pa de la 'og nas 'byung ba'i rig pa dang / reg tu bcug na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: That which is not made suitable, such as jewels, etc., is connected with the phrase, “if one touches it, etc.”

original: de bas na rin po che la sogs pa rung bar ma byas pa ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rin po che la sogs pa rung bar ma byas pa ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one touches jewels, etc., that are not made suitable, one is the agent of a downfall.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas rung bar byas pa ni bzung yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas rung bar byas pa ni bzung yang nyes pa med do //
translated: But if they are made suitable by the rite that will be explained below, there is no offense in touching them.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi rin po che la reg pa ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu bstan pas lhag ma rang gi ni spang ba'i cho gar mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi rin po che la reg pa ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu bstan pas lhag ma rang gi ni spang ba'i cho gar mdzad pa yin te /
translated: Since it is taught that touching another’s jewels is a downfall, the rite for relinquishing the remainder, one’s own jewels, is performed.

original: gzhan gyi la spang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi la spang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no relinquishment of one’s own jewels.

original: 'di ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo las rang gi zhes ma smos mod gyi 'on kyang shugs kyis na de yin par mngon no //
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo las rang gi zhes ma smos mod gyi 'on kyang shugs kyis na de yin par mngon no //
translated: Although the Sūtra on the Foundation of Mindfulness does not say “one’s own,” it is clear that this is the meaning.

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni yang dge slong rang gi rin po che'am /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni yang dge slong rang gi rin po che'am /
translated: Thus the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: rin po cher smos pa rang gi lag gis len tam len du bcug na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa rang gi lag gis len tam len du bcug na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If a fully ordained monk himself takes a precious substance or one considered precious, or he causes it to be taken, then he commits a downfall.”

original: ci zhig byas na ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas na ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall?

original: de'i phyir reg gam reg tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir reg gam reg tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The treatise declares: “If he touches it or causes it to be touched.”

original: reg gam zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus kyis so //
analyzed: reg gam zhes bya ba ni rang gi lus kyis so //
translated: “Touch” means with one’s own body.

original: reg tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba ni @232a * //
analyzed: reg tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba ni @232a * //
translated: “Causes to be touched” means🔽through another.🔽If one causes it to be done by words or by a letter, etc.,

original: gzhan no // tshig gis kyang byed la spring yig la sogs pas kyang byed na de dag las 'dir reg pa gang yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan no // tshig gis kyang byed la spring yig la sogs pas kyang byed na de dag las 'dir reg pa gang yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: what is the meaning of “touch” here?

original: de'i phyir gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The treatise declares: “By any means.”

original: rnam pa gang yang rung bas 'di nas long la 'dir chug cig ces bya ba lta bu dmigs kyis ma smras par phyogs gcig par reg na yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung bas 'di nas long la 'dir chug cig ces bya ba lta bu dmigs kyis ma smras par phyogs gcig par reg na yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one causes it to be done by any means, such as “Take it from here and put it there,” then one commits a downfall even if one touches it in a partial manner without specifying the object.

original: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is copper that can be used as a coin, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dong tse dang pa na la sogs pa'i ming du byas shing mtshan byas pa'i zangs ma gang yin pa de ni snyad gdags su rung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dong tse dang pa na la sogs pa'i ming du byas shing mtshan byas pa'i zangs ma gang yin pa de ni snyad gdags su rung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is copper that has been made into a coin, and has been marked with a name such as “penny” or “paṇa,” is called “that which can be used as a coin.”

original: de la rang gis reg gam ;
analyzed: de la rang gis reg gam ;
translated: If one touches it oneself,

original: gzhan reg tu bcug na nyes byas so //🔽gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan reg tu bcug na nyes byas so // gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or if one makes another touch it, it is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽There is no offense if it is not a coin that can be used as a coin.

original: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma mtshan byas pa las gzhan pa'i zangs ma la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma mtshan byas pa las gzhan pa'i zangs ma la'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is not copper that has been made into a coin and marked with a name.

original: zha nye dang khro chu dang ro nye dang lcags dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zha nye dang khro chu dang ro nye dang lcags dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also the same for tin, lead, and iron.

original: zha nye la sogs pa ni rin po che ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zha nye la sogs pa ni rin po che ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that tin and so forth are not precious substances.

original: de dag la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de dag la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one touches them or makes another touch them.

original: dge tshul gnyis kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge tshul gnyis kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also the same for the two novices.

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis gyis rin po che la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis gyis rin po che la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung ba med do //
translated: If a novice monk or novice nun touches it or causes it to be touched, there is no offense.

original: rang gi rung ba ma byas pa yang ngo zhes smras na rung ba gang ma yin pa'i rung ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: rang gi rung ba ma byas pa yang ngo zhes smras na rung ba gang ma yin pa'i rung ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: If it is not made allowable by oneself, what is that allowable which is not allowable?

original: de'i phyir sbyin bdag bdag po nyid du mos su gzhug pa dang / zhal ta byed pa bdag po nyid du khas lan du gzhug pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba dag yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin bdag bdag po nyid du mos su gzhug pa dang / zhal ta byed pa bdag po nyid du khas lan du gzhug pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba dag yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that there are three types of allowable: that which is made allowable by the donor, that which is made allowable by the owner, and that which is made allowable by consecration.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na chos gos gyi rin dag rnyed pa na blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya bar ngas rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa de ni rung ba dang po yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na chos gos gyi rin dag rnyed pa na blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya bar ngas rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa de ni rung ba dang po yin no //
translated: Monks, therefore, if you obtain the price of robes, you should accept it. Having accepted it, you should keep it with confidence in that donor. I allow this. This is the first allowable.

original: de bzhin du dge slong rnams kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gang cung zad ji snyed pa de thams cad sbyin bdag spro bar bya zhing de'i ming gis bcad bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de ni rung ba gnyis pa yin no
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong rnams kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po gang cung zad ji snyed pa de thams cad sbyin bdag spro bar bya zhing de'i ming gis bcad bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa de ni rung ba gnyis pa yin no
translated: This is the second suitable.

original: // rung ba gsum pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: // rung ba gsum pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The third suitable should be known as the consecrated.

original: de ltar yang dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa'i mdo las dge slong rnams kyis chos gos kyi rin gar rnyed par gyur la sbyin bdag med par @232b gyur nas dge slong dag 'gyod bar gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa'i mdo las dge slong rnams kyis chos gos kyi rin gar rnyed par gyur la sbyin bdag med par @232b gyur nas dge slong dag 'gyod bar gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the Sutra Requested by the Son of a Brahmin, monks obtained the price of Dharma robes but there was no donor.🔽The monks were regretful and did not accept it.

original: mi len pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mi len pa'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the monks requested the Bhagavan about this, the Bhagavan said,

original: blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang dge slong gi mdun du 'greng ste 'di skad ces /
analyzed: blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang dge slong gi mdun du 'greng ste 'di skad ces /
translated: “Accept it. Having accepted it, stand in front of the monk and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /🔽bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya bas dngos po rung bam lags pa 'di rnyed de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol / bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bya bas dngos po rung bam lags pa 'di rnyed de /
translated: Venerable ones, please give your attention!🔽I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, have obtained this unsuitable object.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, will consecrate this unsuitable object.🔽With this unsuitable object, I will obtain a suitable object.

original: dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis dngos po rung ba bsgrub par bgyi'o zhes de skad lan gnyis lan gsum du brjod par bya zhing 'gyod par yang mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis dngos po rung ba bsgrub par bgyi'o zhes de skad lan gnyis lan gsum du brjod par bya zhing 'gyod par yang mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one should say it twice or three times, and should not regret it.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rung ba ma yin pa rung bar byas pa la reg gam reg tu bcug na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rung ba ma yin pa rung bar byas pa la reg gam reg tu bcug na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, if one touches or causes to touch an unsuitable object that has been made suitable, there is no offense.

original: de la bdag nyid kyis bdag gir yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid kyis bdag gir yang mi bya ste /
translated: In that case, one should not make it one's own.

original: de'i phyir sbyin bdag la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin bdag la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should keep it with confidence in the donor.

original: gang la bdag nyid kyis bdag gir byed pa yod pa de la ni rang gis kyang reg par mi bya la /
analyzed: gang la bdag nyid kyis bdag gir byed pa yod pa de la ni rang gis kyang reg par mi bya la /
translated: In that case, if one makes it one's own, one should not touch it oneself.

original: gzhan yang reg tu gzhug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang reg tu gzhug par mi bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one should not cause another to touch it.

original: de la rung bar bya ba gsum char mi 'chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rung bar bya ba gsum char mi 'chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three kinds of suitability are not acknowledged in that case.

original: 'di ltar bdag gir byed pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rung ba nyid byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gir byed pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir rung ba nyid byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: In this way, suitability is made by one who appropriates it, because it is connected with that.

original: de ltar na byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags nyid las kyang 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de ltar na byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags nyid las kyang 'di skad ces /
translated: Thus, in the very mantra of consecration, it says,

original: bdag gis dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis rung ba bsgrub par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis rung ba bsgrub par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “I will make this unsuitable thing suitable.”

original: dngos po rung ba la bdag gir bya'i mi rung ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rung ba la bdag gir bya'i mi rung ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: One should appropriate a suitable thing, not an unsuitable one.

original: rung ba brjod pa'i phyir reg na ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rung ba brjod pa'i phyir reg na ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And one should not fall into the offense by merely touching it, because it is said to be suitable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan gyi rdzas la ni rung ba rnam pa gsum ma bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan gyi rdzas la ni rung ba rnam pa gsum ma bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One did not teach the three kinds of suitability for the property of another.

original: des na de la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one touches it or causes another to touch it, there is only a minor offense.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, this meaning of the words occurs here.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba spang ba'i phyir rung ba gsum las rung ba gang yang rung bas rung bar byed na de'i tshe dngos po rung ba ma yin pa la dgos pa'i dbang gis reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba spang ba'i phyir rung ba gsum las rung ba gang yang rung bas rung bar byed na de'i tshe dngos po rung ba ma yin pa la dgos pa'i dbang gis reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro
translated: If one makes it suitable by any of the three types of suitability in order to abandon personal ownership, then at that time, one does not commit an offense by touching or causing another to touch an unsuitable object due to the power of necessity.

original: // ji ste rung ba gsum yang byed bzhin du rdzas de la bdag nyid kyis bdag gir byed pa dang rjes su 'brel na ni /
analyzed: // ji ste rung ba gsum yang byed bzhin du rdzas de la bdag nyid kyis bdag gir byed pa dang rjes su 'brel na ni /
translated: If one makes it one’s own property by oneself while also making it suitable by any of the three types of suitability,

original: de lta na yang thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur @233a * //🔽ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur @233a * // ba kho na yin no //
translated: then in that case, one definitely commits an offense in all cases.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i don bdog pa'i rkyen las gzhan pa la mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i don bdog pa'i rkyen las gzhan pa la mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does not confess to another who is not endowed with the Dharma the fact that one possesses an object that is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Endowed with the Dharma means

original: chos las mi 'bral ba ste /
analyzed: chos las mi 'bral ba ste /
translated: not separated from the Dharma.

original: rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos dang sman la sogs pa yo byad dag go //
analyzed: rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos dang sman la sogs pa yo byad dag go //
translated: It refers to one’s own requisite of a begging bowl, robes, medicine, and so on.

original: de ni chos dang ldan pa yang yin la don yang yin pas chos dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni chos dang ldan pa yang yin la don yang yin pas chos dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: It is a Dharma-possessing object, and it is an object, thus it is a Dharma-possessing object.

original: de ni chos dang ldan pa'i don kyang yin la /
analyzed: de ni chos dang ldan pa'i don kyang yin la /
translated: It is a Dharma-possessing object,

original: mi bdog pa yang yin pas chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa'o //
analyzed: mi bdog pa yang yin pas chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa'o //
translated: and it is not possessed, thus it is a Dharma-possessing object not possessed.

original: de'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The condition for that is

original: de bsgrub pa'i rdzas gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i rdzas gang yin pa ste /
translated: whatever substance accomplishes that.

original: rdzas ci tsam gyis chos dang ldan pa'i don te 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas ci tsam gyis chos dang ldan pa'i don te 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By however much substance the Dharma-possessing object is accomplished.

original: rdzas de la ni rung ba de dag 'chags so //
analyzed: rdzas de la ni rung ba de dag 'chags so //
translated: Those that are suitable for that substance are created.🔽From that condition, other than that,

original: rkyen de las gzhan pa la zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa'i don bdog go //
analyzed: rkyen de las gzhan pa la zhes bya ba ni chos dang ldan pa'i don bdog go //
translated: means a Dharma-possessing object is possessed.

original: de'i rkyen du mi dgos pa'i rdzas gzhan la ste /
analyzed: de'i rkyen du mi dgos pa'i rdzas gzhan la ste /
translated: From another substance that is not necessary as a condition for that,

original: de la ni byin gyis brlab pa de dag mi 'chags so //
analyzed: de la ni byin gyis brlab pa de dag mi 'chags so //
translated: those blessings are not created in that.

original: de'i phyir chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa'i rkyen las gzhan pa la mi 'chags so zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa'i rkyen las gzhan pa la mi 'chags so zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that from a condition of a Dharma-possessing object not possessed, other than that, they are not created.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te chos dang ldan pa'i don bdog pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: gal te chos dang ldan pa'i don bdog pa kho na yin nam /
translated: If the object is only that which is in accordance with the Dharma,

original: yang na chos dang ldan pa'i don lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa de dag gi rkyen du gyur pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de yang bdog la /
analyzed: yang na chos dang ldan pa'i don lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa de dag gi rkyen du gyur pa'i rdzas gang yin pa de yang bdog la /
translated: then the object in accordance with the Dharma is the substance that is a condition for those such as the alms bowl and Dharma robes.

original: chos kyi don gyi rkyen ma yin par byin gyis rlob par byed na de'i tshe rung ba de dag mi 'chags so //
analyzed: chos kyi don gyi rkyen ma yin par byin gyis rlob par byed na de'i tshe rung ba de dag mi 'chags so //
translated: If one blesses that which is not a condition for the object of the Dharma, then at that time those that are suitable are not relinquished.

original: de lta bas na chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen las gzhan pa la gal te rung ba gsum byed du zin kyang dge slong des de la reg gam reg tu bcug na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i rkyen las gzhan pa la gal te rung ba gsum byed du zin kyang dge slong des de la reg gam reg tu bcug na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the three suitable actions are performed in relation to that which is other than the condition called in accordance with the Dharma, then if that monk touches it or causes it to be touched, it becomes a downfall that requires confession.

original: rkyen zhes smos pa'i lung ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen zhes smos pa'i lung ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is the scriptural passage that should be known as the condition:

original: chos gos kyi rin dag rnyed pa na sbyin bdag la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos kyi rin dag rnyed pa na sbyin bdag la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “When one obtains the price of Dharma robes, one should keep them with confidence in the benefactor.”

original: chos gos la sogs pa'i ched du sems par byed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'i rin te /🔽de dag gis chos gos la sogs pa sems par byed /
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa'i ched du sems par byed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa'i rin te / de dag gis chos gos la sogs pa sems par byed /
translated: The price of robes, etc. is the thought of robes, etc.🔽They are the price of robes, etc. because they are the thought of robes, etc.

original: sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are the means of acquiring robes, etc.

original: bdag po ring ba nyid yin na yang nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag po ring ba nyid yin na yang nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if the owner is far away, there is no fault.

original: bdag po sbyin bdag gam zhal ta byed pa ring ba nyid yin te yul thag ring ba nyid du song zhing yul gyis bskal pa nyid yin na yang rung ba dag la nyes pa med do //🔽bdag nyid kyi @233b don du bza' ba byed du gzhug tu rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag po sbyin bdag gam zhal ta byed pa ring ba nyid yin te yul thag ring ba nyid du song zhing yul gyis bskal pa nyid yin na yang rung ba dag la nyes pa med do // bdag nyid kyi @233b don du bza' ba byed du gzhug tu rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if the owner, the donor or the manager, is far away, in a distant country, or even if he is separated from the country, there is no fault.🔽It is proper to have food prepared for oneself.

original: bdag nyid kyi don du zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyi phyir zan sbyor du gzhug tu rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don du zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyi phyir zan sbyor du gzhug tu rung ngo //
translated: It is proper to have food prepared for oneself, for one’s own sake, for one’s own benefit.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te dge slong gis rang la mkho ba'i phyir lus 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du zong des bza' btung sbyor du bcug na yang de lto 'dun che bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis rang la mkho ba'i phyir lus 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du zong des bza' btung sbyor du bcug na yang de lto 'dun che bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If a monk, for the sake of his own livelihood, should prepare food and drink with that merchandise, he would not be one who is excessively greedy for the stomach.

original: 'di ltar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the proper course.

original: phran tshegs dag las kyang de nyid dang por byas nas las byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa dag 'dir btus so //
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las kyang de nyid dang por byas nas las byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa dag 'dir btus so //
translated: The Ksudraka Collection also says the same thing, up to: “He should do the work first.”

original: lam brgyags ni rin po che man chad las so zhes 'go nas 'byung ba 'ba' zhig phran tshegs su ma gtogs te ;
analyzed: lam brgyags ni rin po che man chad las so zhes 'go nas 'byung ba 'ba' zhig phran tshegs su ma gtogs te ;
translated: The Ksudraka Collection does not include the passage from the Vinaya that says: “One should take a karṣa-pana for the sake of provisions, etc.”

original: gzhung de ni rnam par 'byed pa dag las snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽de byed pa la dbul ba'i phyir k'a ra sh'a pa na blang bar yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhung de ni rnam par 'byed pa dag las snang ba'i phyir ro // de byed pa la dbul ba'i phyir k'a ra sh'a pa na blang bar yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: This passage appears in the Vibhanga.🔽“One should take a karṣa-pana for the sake of making it, i.e., for the sake of making food, for the sake of a person who is poor, etc.”

original: de byed pa la zhes bya ba ni bza' ba byed pa la ste byen po la sogs pa'i gang zag pa'o //
analyzed: de byed pa la zhes bya ba ni bza' ba byed pa la ste byen po la sogs pa'i gang zag pa'o //
translated: “For the sake of making it” means for the sake of making food.

original: dbul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For the sake of a person who is poor” means

original: bza' ba byed du gzhug pa'i don du rin du dbul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bza' ba byed du gzhug pa'i don du rin du dbul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are offered as a price for the purpose of having someone do work.

original: de'i phyir k'a ra sh'a pa na blang ba yang rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir k'a ra sh'a pa na blang ba yang rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is also suitable to accept a karṣāpana.

original: de'i phyir k'a ra sh'a pa na blang pa la sogs pa yang rung ba med par ni blang bar mi bya'o //
