analyzed: de'i phyir k'a ra sh'a pa na blang pa la sogs pa yang rung ba med par ni blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to accept a karṣāpana and so on without a purpose.

original: de ltar yang yon bdag la yid brtan te k'a ra sh'a pa na blangs nas ci 'dod par longs spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang yon bdag la yid brtan te k'a ra sh'a pa na blangs nas ci 'dod par longs spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that if you trust the donor, you may accept a karṣāpana and enjoy it as you wish.

original: sbyin bdag la yid brtan te zhes bya ba'i tshig las thams cad du yang rung ba byas te blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la yid brtan te zhes bya ba'i tshig las thams cad du yang rung ba byas te blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “if you trust the donor” means that you should accept it after making it suitable for any use.

original: rung ba med par bdag nyid la sogs pa'i dgos pa'i dbang kho nas ni blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba med par bdag nyid la sogs pa'i dgos pa'i dbang kho nas ni blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: But you should not accept it just for your own needs, without making it suitable for any use.

original: lam brgyags ni rin po che man chad las so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam brgyags ni rin po che man chad las so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Provisions are from precious things down to grass.

original: lam brgyags ni rin po che man chad rin po che'i mthar thug pa las bskur du rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam brgyags ni rin po che man chad rin po che'i mthar thug pa las bskur du rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The provisions for the road are suitable to be sent from precious things up to the ultimate precious things. This is the meaning of the text.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis lam brgyags ji lta bu mi shes nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis lam brgyags ji lta bu mi shes nas /
translated: Here, the monks did not know what the provisions for the road were,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: so the Blessed One said:

original: dge slong gi lam brgyags ni bza' ba lnga dang bza' bar smos pa lnga dang rin ba cher smos pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi lam brgyags ni bza' ba lnga dang bza' bar smos pa lnga dang rin ba cher smos pa lnga'o //
translated: “Monks, the provisions for the road are the five foods, the five foods that are mentioned, and the five precious things that are mentioned.

original: bza' ba lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bza' ba lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five foods?

original: 'bras chan dang zan dron dang sha dang nya sha dang snum khur ro //
analyzed: 'bras chan dang zan dron dang sha dang nya sha dang snum khur ro //
translated: Cooked grain, roasted grain, meat, fish, and oil.

original: bza' bar smos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bza' bar smos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five foods that are mentioned?

original: ci tshe dang khre rgod dang rgya sran dang bra rgod dang khre'o //
analyzed: ci tshe dang khre rgod dang rgya sran dang bra rgod dang khre'o //
translated: Wheat, barley, beans, lentils, and peas.

original: rin po che lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rin po che lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five precious things?

original: gser dang dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel dang / mu tig go //🔽rin @234a * //
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel dang / mu tig go // rin @234a * //
translated: Gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, and pearls.

original: po cher smos pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: po cher smos pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five precious things that are mentioned?

original: zha nye dang / zangs dang / ro nye dang / khro chu dang lcags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zha nye dang / zangs dang / ro nye dang / khro chu dang lcags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: tin, copper, lead, and iron.

original: me'i don du me shel nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: me'i don du me shel nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “For the sake of fire, a fire crystal should be kept.”

original: dge slong gis me'i don du rin po che me shel bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis me'i don du rin po che me shel bcang bar bya ste /
translated: A monk should keep a precious fire crystal for the sake of fire.

original: 'di yang chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa yin no //
translated: This is a necessary thing for one who is righteous.

original: de ma sbas par gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni me shel de ma sbas ma bsrungs par gzhag par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma sbas par gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni me shel de ma sbas ma bsrungs par gzhag par mi bya ba'o //
translated: “It should not be left uncovered.” It should not be left uncovered and unguarded.

original: ma byin par len pa la bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should not be shown to thieves.”

original: me shel de rkun po la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: me shel de rkun po la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be shown to thieves.

original: de'i 'bras bu phyung nas de la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu phyung nas de la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having produced its fruit, it should be given to them.”

original: me shel de'i 'bras bu me zhes bya ba de phyung nas rkun po de la me sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: me shel de'i 'bras bu me zhes bya ba de phyung nas rkun po de la me sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having produced its fruit, which is called “fire,” it should be given to the thieves.

original: chu'i don du chu shel yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu'i don du chu shel yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The same goes for a water crystal for the sake of water.”

original: dge slong gis chu'i don du chu shel yang nye bar gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis chu'i don du chu shel yang nye bar gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: A monk should also keep a water-purifying crystal for the purpose of water.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “also” is for the purpose of connecting with the next verse.

original: bsrung ba'i chog 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i chog 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the procedure for protection.

original: bsrung ba'i chog sba ba'i rnam pa ni de ma sbas bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa me shel sba ba'i cho ga sngar bstan pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i chog sba ba'i rnam pa ni de ma sbas bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa me shel sba ba'i cho ga sngar bstan pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The form of the procedure for protection is like the previously taught procedure for protecting the fire-crystal, etc.,

original: yo byad rjes su gnang bar rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yo byad rjes su gnang bar rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The permission to use articles is not to mix the share of using precious things.

original: rgya la sogs pa'i 'tshog chas ni yo byad de /
analyzed: rgya la sogs pa'i 'tshog chas ni yo byad de /
translated: Articles are the equipment of a monk, such as a knife, etc.

original: de ni rjes su gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rjes su gnang ba yin no //
translated: That is the permission.

original: de rjes su gnang ba'i khongs su rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre ba gzhug par mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de rjes su gnang ba'i khongs su rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre ba gzhug par mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: The share of using precious things is not to be included in that permission.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal sogs pa'i yo byad 'chad bar rjes su gnang mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal sogs pa'i yo byad 'chad bar rjes su gnang mod kyi /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat permitted the use of ornaments such as rings, etc.

original: 'on kyang dge slong gis rin po che las byas pa'i rgya la sogs pa bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dge slong gis rin po che las byas pa'i rgya la sogs pa bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: However, a bhikṣu should not possess a ring made of precious substances.

original: rgya la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba'i rdzas ni nges par gsungs pas ni de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: rgya la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba'i rdzas ni nges par gsungs pas ni de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: The substances permitted for rings, etc. are definitely stated, and therefore this sūtra was composed.

original: de ltar yang phran tshegs dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang phran tshegs dag las bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thus, in the Ksudraka Collection, the Bhagavat said:

original: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis rgya bcang ba dang / dge slong dag gis khab dang sman phor dang / phul ba'i btung phor bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis rgya bcang ba dang / dge slong dag gis khab dang sman phor dang / phul ba'i btung phor bcang bar rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: Therefore, bhikṣus, you should possess a ring, and bhikṣus, you should possess a needle, a medicine case, and a begging bowl.

original: dge slong gis gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel las byas pa'i rgya bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel las byas pa'i rgya bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: A bhikṣu should not possess a ring made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, or crystal.

original: gleng gzhi dag las @234b kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis dud pa'i sman gce'u bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / zhus pa ji lta bu zhig bcang bar bgyi /
analyzed: gleng gzhi dag las @234b kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis dud pa'i sman gce'u bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / zhus pa ji lta bu zhig bcang bar bgyi /
translated: Also, in the nidana, the Blessed One said, “One should carry a medicine bag.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: “What kind should one carry?”

original: nye ba 'khor rin po che las byas pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rin po che las byas pa ma gtogs so //
translated: “Upali, one made of precious materials, except gold and silver.”🔽“One should carry a medicine case, a medicine spoon, a medicine bowl, a medicine cup, a medicine knife, an eye medicine case, a medicine jar, a medicine stand, a medicine bag, and a medicine belt.”

original: snar blugs pa'i spyad dang / phul ba'i btung phor dang / khab dang khab ral dang ; mig sman gyi gab tshe dang / sman phor dang / rkang rten dang / khre'u dang / sman gyi nal ze bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: snar blugs pa'i spyad dang / phul ba'i btung phor dang / khab dang khab ral dang ; mig sman gyi gab tshe dang / sman phor dang / rkang rten dang / khre'u dang / sman gyi nal ze bcang bar bya'o //
translated: “One should carry a chain made of iron rings.”🔽“What kind should one carry?”🔽“Upali, one made of precious materials, except gold and silver.”🔽“What kind should one carry?”🔽“Upali, one made of precious materials, except gold and silver.”🔽“What kind should one carry?”🔽“Upali, one made of precious materials, except gold and silver.”

translated: One should not accept a begging bowl made of tin, copper, bronze, or wood.🔽The term “begging bowl” is applied to each of the metals individually.

original: ra gan gyi lhung bzed bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ra gan gyi lhung bzed bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the phrase “a begging bowl made of tin” means a begging bowl that is made entirely of tin.

original: de dag bdag gir byas pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: de dag bdag gir byas pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Whether one makes such a bowl oneself or has another make it,

original: gal te yongs su spyad dgos par gyur na sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te yongs su spyad dgos par gyur na sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: if it becomes necessary to use it, one may use it as a medicine container.

original: de dag bdag gir byas pa'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag bdag gir byas pa'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Whether one makes such a bowl oneself or has another make it means

original: ra gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed de dag bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshe bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: ra gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed de dag bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sngon rol bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshe bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: that one makes a begging bowl of tin, etc., oneself prior to the time of higher ordination, or has another make it for oneself.

original: gzhan yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it becomes necessary to use it means

original: bdag gir ma byas pa gzhan dang 'brel ba dag go //
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas pa gzhan dang 'brel ba dag go //
translated: that one does not make it oneself or have another make it for oneself, but one obtains it from another person who has no connection with it.🔽If it becomes necessary to use it means

original: gal te yongs su spyad dgos par gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te yongs su spyad dgos par gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that one uses it as a medicine container.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen cig byung bar gyur na'o ;
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen cig byung bar gyur na'o ;
translated: If such a condition should arise.

original: / sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the bowl of medicine means

original: de lta bu'i rkyen byung nar gnas sogs pa'i lhung bzed bdag gir byas pa dang ma byas pa de dag sman phor du bsngos te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen byung nar gnas sogs pa'i lhung bzed bdag gir byas pa dang ma byas pa de dag sman phor du bsngos te /
translated: that if such a condition arises, one should dedicate to the bowl of medicine the begging bowls that one has taken up and those that one has not taken up.

original: de dag gis bza' ba dang btung ba dag kyang yongs su longs spyad par bya'i /
analyzed: de dag gis bza' ba dang btung ba dag kyang yongs su longs spyad par bya'i /
translated: One should enjoy the food and drink in them.

original: ra gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed thams cad kyis thams cad du spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ra gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed thams cad kyis thams cad du spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that all begging bowls of brass and so on are to be rejected in all circumstances.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i lhung bzed dang 'dra bar bsod snyoms la sogs pa la bskur bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i lhung bzed dang 'dra bar bsod snyoms la sogs pa la bskur bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not reject alms-food and so on as if they were an unconsecrated begging bowl.

original: mdo snga ma shos kyi lung ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mdo snga ma shos kyi lung ni 'di yin te /
translated: The first sūtra passage is this:

original: nye bar ma bzhag pa dag ni nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs @235a * //
analyzed: nye bar ma bzhag pa dag ni nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs @235a * //
translated: One should not set up as established that which is not set up.

original: pa'o ; / mdo phyi ma shos kyi lung ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: pa'o ; / mdo phyi ma shos kyi lung ni 'di yin te /
translated: The second sūtra passage is this:🔽The bodhisattva should not eat alms-food

original: nye bar gzhag pa dag ni sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pa dag ni sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha said: “The medicine should be used in a bowl.”

original: lhung bzed kyi zhar la 'di brjod de /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi zhar la 'di brjod de /
translated: This is a discussion of the bowl.

original: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni gnyis te /
translated: Two kinds of bowls are suitable for consecration:

original: lcags las byas pa dang sa las byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lcags las byas pa dang sa las byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: one made of iron and the other made of clay.

original: lhung bzed byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: Two kinds of bowls are suitable for consecration:

original: lcags las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: lcags las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa'o //
translated: one made of iron and the other made of clay.

original: rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes 'di ltar bstan pa'i rin po che gang yin pa bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes 'di ltar bstan pa'i rin po che gang yin pa bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: If one owns a precious bowl, it is suitable for consecration.🔽The precious bowl is one of the seven precious articles of royalty.

original: nor bu dang / mu tig dang ; bee d'urya dang / man shel dkar po dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / gser dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / dmar po dang / g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa ni rin po che'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig dang ; bee d'urya dang / man shel dkar po dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / gser dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / dmar po dang / g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa ni rin po che'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The seven precious articles of royalty are the precious wheel, the precious jewel, the precious queen, the precious minister, the precious elephant, the precious horse, and the precious general.🔽The precious bowl is one of these seven.

original: nor bu zhes smos pas ni chu shel dang / me shel dang / shel dag 'phangs so //🔽nor bur gyur pa'i khab long yang 'phangs te /🔽rdo bar gyur ba'i khab long ni rin po che dag ma yin te /
analyzed: nor bu zhes smos pas ni chu shel dang / me shel dang / shel dag 'phangs so // nor bur gyur pa'i khab long yang 'phangs te / rdo bar gyur ba'i khab long ni rin po che dag ma yin te /
translated: The word “jewel” excludes water crystal, fire crystal, and crystal.🔽The word “jewel” excludes the magnet,🔽because the magnet is a stone and not a jewel.

original: de la rin po che nyid med pa'i phyir ro //🔽dngul zhes bya ba ni dngul skya'o //
analyzed: de la rin po che nyid med pa'i phyir ro // dngul zhes bya ba ni dngul skya'o //
translated: It is not a jewel because it does not have the nature of a jewel.🔽Silver is silver ore.

original: gser zhes bya ba nis le sbram mo //
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba nis le sbram mo //
translated: Gold is pure gold.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo las de gnyis 'ba' zhig smos te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo las de gnyis 'ba' zhig smos te /
translated: The Sūtra on the One Who Has Attained Separation mentions only those two,🔽saying, “If a bhikṣu with his own hand takes gold and silver or causes another to take it, he commits a serious offense.”

original: yang dge slong gang rang gi lag gis gser dang dngul len tam len du 'jug na zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni dpe tsam yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang rang gi lag gis gser dang dngul len tam len du 'jug na zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni dpe tsam yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: But you should understand that this is just an example,

original: rnam par 'byed pa gzhan las nor bu la sogs pa dag len tam len du bcug na yang spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa gzhan las nor bu la sogs pa dag len tam len du bcug na yang spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because other analyses say that if you take a jewel, etc., or cause another to take it, you commit an offense of wrongdoing.

original: de ltar yang nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya la sogs pa len na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya la sogs pa len na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, if one takes a jewel, a pearl, a lapis lazuli, and so on, there is an offense of a downfall.

original: rin po che ma yin pa zangs ma la sogs pa las snyad gdags su rung ba'i mngon mtshan can dag len pa ni nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che ma yin pa zangs ma la sogs pa las snyad gdags su rung ba'i mngon mtshan can dag len pa ni nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: If one takes something that is not a jewel, such as copper, and so on, that is suitable for a sign, one should understand that there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sogs ba zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: sogs ba zhes smos pas ni /
translated: The phrase “and so on”

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung la sogs pa dag bsdu'o //🔽snyad gdags su mi rung ba la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung la sogs pa dag bsdu'o // snyad gdags su mi rung ba la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: includes the relics of the Buddha, and so on.🔽“If it is not suitable for a sign, there is only blameworthiness.”

original: snyad gdags su mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snyad gdags su mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not suitable for a sign”

original: nyo tshong byar mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: nyo tshong byar mi rung ba ste /
translated: means not suitable for buying and selling.

original: nor bu la sogs pa'i don snyad gdags su mi rung ba nyo tshong byar mi rung ba de len tam /
analyzed: nor bu la sogs pa'i don snyad gdags su mi rung ba nyo tshong byar mi rung ba de len tam /
translated: If one takes something that is not suitable for a sign, such as a jewel, and so on, that is not suitable for buying and selling,

original: len du bcug na de gnyi ga la ltung ba na smad pa nyid de /
analyzed: len du bcug na de gnyi ga la ltung ba na smad pa nyid de /
translated: or if one causes it to be taken, there is an offense of blameworthiness for both of them.

original: @235b nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @235b nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “only” is that there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te nor bu la sogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig gis me la sogs pa nyams par byas par gyur nas de nyo tshong byar mi nus pa gang yin pa de len tam /
analyzed: gal te nor bu la sogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' zhig gis me la sogs pa nyams par byas par gyur nas de nyo tshong byar mi nus pa gang yin pa de len tam /
translated: If one takes or causes another to take a gem or other object whose value has been impaired by fire or some other cause, and which is therefore not worth the price paid for it,

original: len du bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: len du bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dper na padma r'a ga la sogs pa rin po che nyid du ma gyur pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na padma r'a ga la sogs pa rin po che nyid du ma gyur pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like a ruby or other gem that is not a gem.

original: de nyid bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa zhes bya ba la yang 'dra bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa zhes bya ba la yang 'dra bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the same is true of the next training precept, which is called “the practice of one who is conspicuous,”

original: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “The same is true of the next.”

original: de la yang snyad gdags su mi rung ba la ni na smad do zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la yang snyad gdags su mi rung ba la ni na smad do zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
translated: In that case, if it is not suitable to be used, it is called “the practice of one who is conspicuous.”

original: snyad gdags su mi rung ba zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: snyad gdags su mi rung ba zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand what is called “not suitable to be used”?

original: de'i phyir de ni gas pa dang / chag pa dang / dum bu dang / tshig pa dang / sngon ma spyang pa dang / ma byas pa dang / mtshan dang mi ldan pa dang / bcos pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gas pa dang / chag pa dang / dum bu dang / tshig pa dang / sngon ma spyang pa dang / ma byas pa dang / mtshan dang mi ldan pa dang / bcos pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be cracked, chipped, scratched, burned, unpolished, not well made, not well finished, and repaired.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Therefore” means

original: snyad gdags su mi rung ba'o ;
analyzed: snyad gdags su mi rung ba'o ;
translated: it is not suitable to be used.

original: / gas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / gas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Cracked” means

original: ser ga byung ba ste /
analyzed: ser ga byung ba ste /
translated: it has a crack,

original: 'byar kyang rung ma 'byar kyang rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byar kyang rung ma 'byar kyang rung ba'o //
translated: whether it is joined or not.

original: chag pa zhes bya ba ni bu ga byung ba'o //
analyzed: chag pa zhes bya ba ni bu ga byung ba'o //
translated: “ Chipped” means it has a hole.

original: dum bu zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig med pa'o //
analyzed: dum bu zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig med pa'o //
translated: “ Scratched” means it is not complete in one place.

original: tshig pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshig pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Burned” means

original: rin po che de me dang phrad pas rin po che ma yin pa nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: rin po che de me dang phrad pas rin po che ma yin pa nyid du gyur te /
translated: it is no longer a precious gem because it has come in contact with fire.

original: nyo tshong byar mi rung bar gyur pa gang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyo tshong byar mi rung bar gyur pa gang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is no longer suitable for buying and selling.🔽“ Unpolished” means it is not well polished.🔽“ Not well made” means it is not well fashioned.🔽“ Not well finished” means it is not well finished.

original: pa na ni mngon mtshan can lhag ma yod pa tsam du nyams pa yin gyi /🔽thams cad kyi thams cad du thal bar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa na ni mngon mtshan can lhag ma yod pa tsam du nyams pa yin gyi /🔽thams cad kyi thams cad du thal bar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “ Repaired” means it is a remainder of what was previously.

original: de len pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de len pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no offense in accepting it.

original: sngon ma spyad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon ma spyad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not previously used” means

original: sngon nyo tshong byas pa tsam yang mi dran pa'i mngon mtshan gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sngon nyo tshong byas pa tsam yang mi dran pa'i mngon mtshan gang yin pa ste /
translated: any sign that one does not remember having used in buying and selling.

original: mngon mtshan can gang la nyo tshong byas pa'i dus kyang 'jig rten na mi grag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gang la nyo tshong byas pa'i dus kyang 'jig rten na mi grag pa'o //
translated: It is a sign that is not known in the world to be used in buying and selling.

original: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not made” means

original: mngon mtshan can gang la mtshan du ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gang la mtshan du ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: a sign that has not been made.

original: mtshan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not marked” means

original: drud pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas mtshan dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: drud pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas mtshan dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: a sign that has been destroyed by the fault of being dragged and so on.

original: bcos pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcos pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Manufactured” means

original: sa dang rtsva dang rdo ba la sogs pa dag las nor bu dang / dong tse dang / mngon mtshan can dang / rgyan dang / 'gro na bu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang rtsva dang rdo ba la sogs pa dag las nor bu dang / dong tse dang / mngon mtshan can dang / rgyan dang / 'gro na bu la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa byas pa'o //
translated: a sign that has been made from earth, grass, stone, and so on, in the form of a jewel, a coin, a sign, an ornament, a walking stick, and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis gser gyi phreng ba la reg na spang ba'i ltung byed do //🔽dge @236a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis gser gyi phreng ba la reg na spang ba'i ltung byed do // dge @236a * //
translated: If a fully ordained monk touches a golden garland, he commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: slong gis sog ma'i phreng ba la reg na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: slong gis sog ma'i phreng ba la reg na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a fully ordained monk touches a straw garland, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gser dang dngul la reg pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: gser dang dngul la reg pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The relinquishment of touching gold and silver has been explained.

original: // / da ni mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the relinquishment of conduct that is a sign of the lack of shame will be explained.

original: gang la ltung ba 'di 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: gang la ltung ba 'di 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: With regard to the question, “For whom does this downfall occur?”

original: de'i phyir rnyed pa 'dod pa la ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /🔽khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis rnyed pa bsgrub cing 'dod pa dang bsdu ba gang yin pa de ni rnyed pa 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnyed pa 'dod pa la ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te / khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis rnyed pa bsgrub cing 'dod pa dang bsdu ba gang yin pa de ni rnyed pa 'dod pa ste /
translated: it is said, “The downfall occurs for one who desires gain.”🔽The desire for gain is the desire to obtain and to gather gain through the desire for profit.

original: rnyed pa 'dod pa'i ltung ba 'byin pa po de la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pa'i ltung ba 'byin pa po de la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This downfall is posited for one who commits a downfall through the desire for gain.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni skyed phyin na rnyed pa yin gyi thob pa tsam gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni skyed phyin na rnyed pa yin gyi thob pa tsam gyis ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, it is the act of generating that is the offense, not merely the acquisition.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: skyed 'dod pas skyed phyin pa la mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skyed 'dod pas skyed phyin pa la mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: The offense of engaging in conduct with a sign occurs when one wishes to generate and one generates.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyi don du rnyed pa 'dod pa nyid yin na ni sbyor ba la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyi don du rnyed pa 'dod pa nyid yin na ni sbyor ba la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one desires to acquire for oneself, then there is an offense of wrong conduct in the preparatory action.

original: gzhan gyi don du na ni dngos gzhi'i gnas la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du na ni dngos gzhi'i gnas la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If it is for the sake of another, then there is an offense in the actual basis.

original: sbyor ba la nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba la nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is a minor offense in the preparatory action.

original: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How does a downfall in the actual basis occur?

original: de'i phyir pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid yin na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid yin na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The actual basis is when the other person is a layperson and not a relative.”

original: pha rol po gang dang lhan cig tu mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa 'di byed pa de gal te khyim pa nyid dang nye du ma yin na /
analyzed: pha rol po gang dang lhan cig tu mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa 'di byed pa de gal te khyim pa nyid dang nye du ma yin na /
translated: If the other person with whom one engages in this conduct with a sign is a layperson and not a relative,

original: pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid kyi yul las de'i tshe dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid kyi yul las de'i tshe dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, it is a downfall by the root downfall that applies to the domain of a layperson who is not a relative.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las nye du dang lhan cig spyod na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las nye du dang lhan cig spyod na nyes byas so //
translated: Here the text of the Questions of Subāhu Sūtra says, “If one engages in sexual activity with a relative, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: des nye du ma yin pa rnams dang spyod na dngos gzhi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des nye du ma yin pa rnams dang spyod na dngos gzhi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one engages in sexual activity with those who are not relatives, it is a root downfall.”

original: mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa gang la dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa gang la dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the root downfall that applies to engaging in sexual activity with someone who has obvious signs of being a novice?

original: de'i phyir skyed phyin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyed phyin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If one causes emission.”

original: gang gi tshe skyed phyin pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyed phyin pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one causes emission, it is a root downfall.

original: skyed med na ni sbyor ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: skyed med na ni sbyor ba tsam du zad do //
translated: If one does not cause emission, it is merely preparation.

original: 'dir gzhung ni skyed phyin na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni skyed phyin na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text of the Questions of Subāhu Sūtra says, “If one causes emission, it is a root downfall.”

original: bshags pa'i dus na yang skyed nyid spang bar 'os pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: bshags pa'i dus na yang skyed nyid spang bar 'os pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Even at the time of confession, it is appropriate to abandon emission itself.

original: rtsa bar gyur pa'i rdzas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsa bar gyur pa'i rdzas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not appropriate to abandon the substance that is the basis.

original: gal te rtsa ba bas sngon nam phyis skyed thob pa de la 'di rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gal te rtsa ba bas sngon nam phyis skyed thob pa de la 'di rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If the basis is obtained earlier or later than the generation, it is established in that.

original: gang gi tshe skyed dang rtsa ba gnyis dus gcig tu @236b byung na de'i tshe cha gang la ltung ba 'byin pa po'i gang zag skyed du gyur pa nyid du lhag par chags pa skye ba de'i tshe de nyid spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyed dang rtsa ba gnyis dus gcig tu @236b byung na de'i tshe cha gang la ltung ba 'byin pa po'i gang zag skyed du gyur pa nyid du lhag par chags pa skye ba de'i tshe de nyid spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: When the generation and the basis occur at the same time, then at that time, the person who commits the downfall is attached to the generation itself. At that time, that very [basis] is to be abandoned.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rnyed pa bdag gir mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rnyed pa bdag gir mi byed pa de srid du nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the text says, As long as one does not take possession of the gain, it is a minor offense.

original: rnyed pa bdag gir byed na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa bdag gir byed na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one takes possession of the gain, it becomes a downfall of abandoning the training.

original: da ni mtshan nyid 'dra bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mtshan nyid 'dra bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show the similarity of characteristics,

original: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The same applies to the lower ones as well.

original: 'di'i 'og mar gyur pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi nyo tshong byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rnyed pa 'dod pa kho na la ltung ba 'byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'og mar gyur pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi nyo tshong byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rnyed pa 'dod pa kho na la ltung ba 'byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Also, in the lower training precept called “buying and selling,” a downfall occurs only for one who desires gain.🔽Moreover, if the other person is a layperson, if he is not a relative, and if the goods are valuable, there is a root downfall.

original: de la yang pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / skyed phyin na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la yang pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang / nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / skyed phyin na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the goods are valuable, there is a root downfall.🔽If one says, “When the goods are valuable,”🔽then the goods are valuable when they are obtained from a merchant, etc.,

original: de nyid spang bar 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid spang bar 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: and when they are obtained from one who desires profit.🔽Therefore, in this downfall of engaging in trade, from where are the goods valuable?

original: skyed phyin na'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: skyed phyin na'o zhes smras na /
translated: If one says, “When the goods are valuable,”

original: skyed phyin pa ni tshong pa la sogs pa las kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: skyed phyin pa ni tshong pa la sogs pa las kyang 'byung la /
translated: then the goods are valuable when they are obtained from a merchant, etc.,

original: khe spogs 'dod pa nyid las kyang 'byung na /
analyzed: khe spogs 'dod pa nyid las kyang 'byung na /
translated: and when they are obtained from one who desires profit.

original: de'i phyir mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba 'di la skyed ga las phyin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba 'di la skyed ga las phyin na /
translated: Therefore, in this downfall of engaging in trade, from where are the goods valuable?🔽If one says, “When the goods are valuable,”🔽then the goods are valuable when they are obtained from a merchant, etc.,

original: dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir pa na'am /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir pa na'am /
translated: and when they are obtained from one who desires profit.

original: rin po ches spyod pa las so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rin po ches spyod pa las so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, in this downfall of engaging in trade, from where are the goods valuable?

original: pa na dang rin po che dag gis rnyed pa'i don du skyed bkye zhing spyod pa gang yin pa de las skyed gang phyin pa de la mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa na dang rin po che dag gis rnyed pa'i don du skyed bkye zhing spyod pa gang yin pa de las skyed gang phyin pa de la mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk generates interest in and engages in the activity of precious gems for the purpose of acquiring profit, then he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for the effort involved in generating interest.

original: gal te dge slong gis mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i phyir rin po che la sogs pa la reg gam reg tu 'jug na de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i phyir rin po che la sogs pa la reg gam reg tu 'jug na de lta na ni /
translated: If a monk touches precious gems and so on for the purpose of acquiring profit, or if he causes another to touch them, then he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: reg gam reg tu 'jug pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed snga mas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: reg gam reg tu 'jug pa las byung ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed snga mas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: However, this is subsumed by the former downfall that occurs in the context of the offense entailing confession that is incurred by touching or causing another to touch.

original: 'dir gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not subsumed by the present rule.

original: dge slong gang gis nyo tshong byas nas skyed par byed pa dang / gang gis nyo tshong ma byas par sngar thob pa la sogs pa dag skyed par byed pa de gnyi ga la yang rnyed pa grub na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gang gis nyo tshong byas nas skyed par byed pa dang / gang gis nyo tshong ma byas par sngar thob pa la sogs pa dag skyed par byed pa de gnyi ga la yang rnyed pa grub na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk generates interest in precious gems and so on for the purpose of acquiring profit, and if he either purchases them or obtains them in some other way, then he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: gal te rnyed pa ma grub na ni de'i tshe sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnyed pa ma grub na ni de'i tshe sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: If the acquisition is not established, then it is an offense of wrong conduct called “preparation.”

original: 'di la nyo tshong ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la nyo tshong ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because buying and selling are not branches of this.

original: de lta bas na nyo tshong ma byas par snga ma bskyed pa tsam kho na las rnyed pa grub na yang der gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyo tshong ma byas par snga ma bskyed pa tsam kho na las rnyed pa grub na yang der gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the acquisition is established merely by generating the former without buying and selling, then there is an offense belonging to that.

original: sbyor ba la ni gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In preparation, there is only one.

original: skyed grub pa bas mdun rol du dge slong gis rnyed pa bsgrub pa'i @237a * //
analyzed: skyed grub pa bas mdun rol du dge slong gis rnyed pa bsgrub pa'i @237a * //
translated: If a monk searches in advance of establishing the acquisition,

original: phyir btsal ba gang chud zad byed na btsal ba de thams cad ni gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyir btsal ba gang chud zad byed na btsal ba de thams cad ni gcig pa nyid do //
translated: then all that searching is only one.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rnyed pa sgrub par mi byed kyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rnyed pa sgrub par mi byed kyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
translated: Thus, the text here states: “As long as one does not establish the acquisition, it is wrong conduct.

original: rnyed pa grub na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa grub na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the acquisition is established, it is a downfall of abandonment.”

original: kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
translated: If one searches for the acquisition of a monastery or

original: dge bsnyen dag yod na bsko bas dkon mchog gi don du bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge bsnyen dag yod na bsko bas dkon mchog gi don du bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are temple attendants or lay vow holders, they should be appointed to cultivate them for the sake of the Three Jewels.

original: kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba pa'am /
translated: If there are temple attendants or

original: dge bsnyen dag yod na de gnyis bsko bas dkon mchog gsum gyi ched du pa na dang / rin po che la sogs pa dag bskyed pa'i ched du skyed dgye bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dag yod na de gnyis bsko bas dkon mchog gsum gyi ched du pa na dang / rin po che la sogs pa dag bskyed pa'i ched du skyed dgye bar bya'o //
translated: lay vow holders, they should be appointed to cultivate them for the sake of the Three Jewels and for the sake of cultivating precious substances such as gold.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gtsug lag khang gang na gtsug lag khang dang 'brel ba'i mi kun dga' rab ba'am /🔽dge bsnyen dag yod na der dge slong dag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gtsug lag khang gang na gtsug lag khang dang 'brel ba'i mi kun dga' rab ba'am / dge bsnyen dag yod na der dge slong dag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi don du rin po che la sogs pa de dag nyid bskyed pa'i ched du de gnyis bsko zhing skyed dgye bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi don du rin po che la sogs pa de dag nyid bskyed pa'i ched du de gnyis bsko zhing skyed dgye bar bya'o //
translated: If there are temple attendants or lay vow holders in a monastery, the monks should appoint them to cultivate precious substances such as gold for the sake of the Three Jewels.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las 'di lta ste /
translated: Here the text states:

original: yangs pa can gyi tshong pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi tshong pa rnams kyis /
translated: The merchants of Vaishali🔽said to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten yang byed du bcug / gtsang khang byur bu yang byed du bcug nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mchod rten yang byed du bcug / gtsang khang byur bu yang byed du bcug nas /
translated: He also had the Blessed One’s stūpa and the temple built.

original: dge slong rnams la mchod rten dang gtsang khang byur bu de dag zhig ral du mi 'gyur ba'i yo byad rjes su gtad pa na dge slong dag 'gyod cing len par mi byed nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la mchod rten dang gtsang khang byur bu de dag zhig ral du mi 'gyur ba'i yo byad rjes su gtad pa na dge slong dag 'gyod cing len par mi byed nas /
translated: When he gave the monks the property necessary to prevent the stūpa and temple from falling into disrepair, the monks were reluctant and did not accept it.

original: skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /🔽kun dga' ra ba'am /
analyzed: skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba / kun dga' ra ba'am /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about this situation, and the Blessed One said,🔽“The property of a monastery

original: dge bsnyen dag gis mchod rten zhig ral du mi 'gyur ba'i yo byad blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen dag gis mchod rten zhig ral du mi 'gyur ba'i yo byad blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang bskyed par bya ste /
translated: or the property of a temple should be accepted by the lay followers. Having accepted it, they should increase it.

original: de las rnyed pa ji tsam 'byung ba des mchod rten la mchod par bya bar ngas rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las rnyed pa ji tsam 'byung ba des mchod rten la mchod par bya bar ngas rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: I allow you to use whatever is obtained from that property to make offerings to the stūpa.”

original: gta' nyi rir blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gta' nyi rir blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should be accepted as a pledge” means

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dkor chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gta' nyi rir blangs nas de bskyed du gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dkor chung mi za bar bya ba'i phyir gta' nyi rir blangs nas de bskyed du gtang bar bya'o //
translated: In order to not eat the small wealth of the Buddha, etc., one should take it as a pledge and let it increase.

original: ji ltar bskyed du gtang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bskyed du gtang bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should it be let increase?

original: de'i phyir dpang po dang lo dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan dang / dge skos dang / len pa po dang / rdzas dang skyed rnams dpang rgyar bris nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpang po dang lo dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan dang / dge skos dang / len pa po dang / rdzas dang skyed rnams dpang rgyar bris nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “having written down the witness, the year, the month, the day, the elder of the Saṅgha, the monk in charge of practical affairs, the receiver, the substance, and the interest, as the witness.”

original: dpang po dang / lo dang zla ba la sogs pa skyed kyi mthar thug pa dag dbang @237b rgyar bris nas phyis rdzas de sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dpang po dang / lo dang zla ba la sogs pa skyed kyi mthar thug pa dag dbang @237b rgyar bris nas phyis rdzas de sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having written down the witness, the year, the month, etc., up to the end of the interest, later the substance should be given.

original: rgyus shes pas de gzhan la yang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyus shes pas de gzhan la yang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: By knowing the reason, one should understand it for others.

original: rgyus shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyus shes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for “knowing the reason,”

original: dge slong gang gis gta' dang bu lon la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i mtha' de shes shing rdzas de tsam zhig gang zag len pa po che ge mo zhig la gtad de des dus che ge mo zhig na skyed 'di tsam zhig dang bcas te 'bul bar shes pa
analyzed: dge slong gang gis gta' dang bu lon la sogs pa'i 'byung ba'i mtha' de shes shing rdzas de tsam zhig gang zag len pa po che ge mo zhig la gtad de des dus che ge mo zhig na skyed 'di tsam zhig dang bcas te 'bul bar shes pa
translated: A monk who knows the source of a pledge, debt, and so on, and who knows that he has entrusted that much property to a certain person, and that he will offer it with that much interest at a certain time,

original: ste / de ni rgyus shes pa zhes bya ste des so //
analyzed: ste / de ni rgyus shes pa zhes bya ste des so //
translated: that is called “knowing the cause.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni gta' dang bu lon bda' ba'i rgyus de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gta' dang bu lon bda' ba'i rgyus de'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the cause of the pledge, debt, and so on.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ And others” means

original: gang gis byung ba'i mtha' de'i rgyus mi shes pa'i dge slong gzhan dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: gang gis byung ba'i mtha' de'i rgyus mi shes pa'i dge slong gzhan dag la yang ngo //
translated: other monks who do not know the cause of the source.

original: khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Should understand” means

original: dge slong rgyus shes pa des byung ba'i mtha' de dge slong rgyus mi shes pa gzhan dag la skabs su bab pa na thams cad bsnyad cing khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong rgyus shes pa des byung ba'i mtha' de dge slong rgyus mi shes pa gzhan dag la skabs su bab pa na thams cad bsnyad cing khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: that when the occasion arises, the monk who knows the cause should explain everything to other monks who do not know the cause and make them understand.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis dge slong glo bur du lhags pa dag la gang zag che ge mo zhig las zla ba re re zhing 'di tsam zhig mnod do zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis dge slong glo bur du lhags pa dag la gang zag che ge mo zhig las zla ba re re zhing 'di tsam zhig mnod do zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the treatise is stating that resident monks should tell visiting monks, “From such and such a person, I receive this much every month.”

original: mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gyis spyod pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The avoidance of ostentatious behavior has been explained.

original: // / da ni nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the avoidance of trade should be explained.

original: sngar bstan ma thag pa'i bslab pa'i gzhir skyed phyin na dngos gzhi'o zhes smras na gang gis yin pa ma bstan pas /
analyzed: sngar bstan ma thag pa'i bslab pa'i gzhir skyed phyin na dngos gzhi'o zhes smras na gang gis yin pa ma bstan pas /
translated: If it is said that when the basis of training is generated, it is the actual basis, then it is not taught by whom.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said by another.

original: spyod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to the term “behavior.”

original: pa na dang rin po che dag las gzhan pa gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa dag las skyed phyin na ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa na dang rin po che dag las gzhan pa gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa'i spyod pa dag las skyed phyin na ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: When the basis of training is generated in the behavior of measuring and so on, other than goods and precious things, this downfall occurs.

original: yang na gzhan gyis so zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i kha spogs 'dod pa las gzhan pa nyo tshong gi spyod pa las skyed phyin na ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyis so zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i kha spogs 'dod pa las gzhan pa nyo tshong gi spyod pa las skyed phyin na ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or from another, means that if one generates it from a different activity than the one intended, such as buying and selling, this downfall occurs.

original: de lta bas na spang ba 'di gsum gyi yul la bye brag ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na spang ba 'di gsum gyi yul la bye brag ni 'di yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the objects of these three downfalls should be understood as follows.

original: dang po ni rin po che la sogs pa la rig pa las so //
analyzed: dang po ni rin po che la sogs pa la rig pa las so //
translated: The first is from the knowledge of precious substances and so forth.

original: gnyis pa ni khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis pa na dang rin po che la sogs pa spyod pa las so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis pa na dang rin po che la sogs pa spyod pa las so //
translated: The second is from the activity of buying and selling precious substances and so forth, with the desire for profit.

original: gsum pa ni gang yang rung bas rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshang la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gang yang rung bas rnyed pa 'dod cing nyo tshang la sogs pas spyod pa las skyed phyin na'o //
translated: The third is from generating it through any of these, with the desire for gain, through the activity of buying and selling and so forth.

original: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi phyir dge 'dun gyi 'bras rin gyis nyo ba la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi phyir dge 'dun gyi 'bras rin gyis nyo ba la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should give the price of the rice for the sake of the Saṅgha’s food.

original: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi phyir zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi 'tsho @238a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi phyir zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi 'tsho @238a * //
translated: For the sake of the Saṅgha’s food means for the Saṅgha’s livelihood.

original: ba'i phyir / dge 'dun gyi 'bras ma drus pa rin gyis nyo 'dod pa'i gang zag la sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: ba'i phyir / dge 'dun gyi 'bras ma drus pa rin gyis nyo 'dod pa'i gang zag la sbyin par bya ste /
translated: One should give to a person who wishes to buy unthreshed grain belonging to the community for its value.

original: nyor phyin yang de la nyo tshong gi nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyor phyin yang de la nyo tshong gi nyes pa med do //
translated: Even though he buys it, there is no fault of buying and selling for him.

original: 'bras zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'bras zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The word “grain” is just an illustration.

original: til dang mon sran sde'u la sogs pa 'bru thams cad dang ras bal la sogs pa rdzas thams cad la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: til dang mon sran sde'u la sogs pa 'bru thams cad dang ras bal la sogs pa rdzas thams cad la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that all grains such as sesame and lentils, and all substances such as cotton, are the same.

original: gal te de nyid kyi na theb dang bcas par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi na theb dang bcas par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is the same day, it should be given with the share.

original: dge 'dun mnga' ba'i 'bras la sogs pa las gal te de nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi phyir nyo bar byed na de la theb dang bcas par bskyed de /
analyzed: dge 'dun mnga' ba'i 'bras la sogs pa las gal te de nyid kyi dge 'dun gyi bshos kyi phyir nyo bar byed na de la theb dang bcas par bskyed de /
translated: If the community buys grain, etc. belonging to the community for the sake of the community’s food on the same day, it should be given with the share.

original: sbyin par bya'i rin thang bsnyams te sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par bya'i rin thang bsnyams te sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: It should be given by adding the value, it should not be given by equalizing the value.

original: zad na dge 'dun gyis nyo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zad na dge 'dun gyis nyo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is exhausted, the community should buy it.

original: dge 'dun gyi 'bras la sogs pa zad na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'bras la sogs pa zad na /
translated: If the community’s grain, etc. is exhausted,

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang 'bras la sogs pa gzhan las nyo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang 'bras la sogs pa gzhan las nyo bar bya ba'o //
translated: The Saṅgha should also buy rice, etc., from others.🔽And new ones, too.

original: sar pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis 'bras la sogs pa 'bru sar ba yang nyo bar bya'o /🔽// / bam bo nyi shu pa /
analyzed: sar pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis 'bras la sogs pa 'bru sar ba yang nyo bar bya'o / // / bam bo nyi shu pa /
translated: The Saṅgha should buy new rice, etc., grains.

original: gal te srog chags med na rnying ba btsong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te srog chags med na rnying ba btsong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are no living beings in old ones, they should be sold.

original: 'bras la sogs pa rnying pa dag la gal te srog chags med na rnying pa de btsongs nas sar pa nyo bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa rnying pa dag la gal te srog chags med na rnying pa de btsongs nas sar pa nyo bar bya'o //
translated: If there are no living beings in old rice, etc., that old rice should be sold and new rice bought.

original: rin thang mi gdab bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rin thang mi gdab bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not haggle over the price.

original: rdzas 'di'i rin thang 'di tsam mo zhes de rang gis gdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khyim pa'i nyo tshong dag tu lag gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzas 'di'i rin thang 'di tsam mo zhes de rang gis gdab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // khyim pa'i nyo tshong dag tu lag gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not say, “The price of this article is just this much,” and haggle over it oneself.🔽One should not engage in a householder’s buying and selling.

original: khyim pa'i nyo tshong byed pa dag gi nang du dge slong gis lag gzhug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: khyim pa'i nyo tshong byed pa dag gi nang du dge slong gis lag gzhug par mi bya ste /
translated: A monk should not engage in a householder’s buying and selling.

original: dge slong des de dag tu gtogs 'dod dang bar tshangs mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong des de dag tu gtogs 'dod dang bar tshangs mi bya ba'o //
translated: The monk should not act as an intermediary in the sale of those things.

original: rang gi chos gos la sogs pa dag ji ltar nyo bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi chos gos la sogs pa dag ji ltar nyo bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should he buy his own robes, etc.?

original: de'i phyir khyim pa nyor gzhug go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyim pa nyor gzhug go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “He should have a layman buy them.”

original: chos gos la sogs pa dag khyim pa nyor gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa dag khyim pa nyor gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should have a layman buy his robes, etc.

original: gal te khyim pa med na de'i tshe sus nyo bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyim pa med na de'i tshe sus nyo bar bya zhe na /
translated: If there is no layman, then who should buy them?

original: de'i phyir med na lan gsum gyi bar du tshig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir med na lan gsum gyi bar du tshig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If there is no layman, he should speak up to three times.”

original: gal te khyim pa med na de'i tshe dge slong des rang gi rdzas de'i rin thang nges par gcad par bya zhing lan gsum gyi bar du dri ba'i tshig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te khyim pa med na de'i tshe dge slong des rang gi rdzas de'i rin thang nges par gcad par bya zhing lan gsum gyi bar du dri ba'i tshig brjod par bya ste /
translated: If there is no layman, then the monk should determine the value of his own goods and speak up to three times.

original: rin 'di tsam gyis byin cig ces lan gsum brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rin 'di tsam gyis byin cig ces lan gsum brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he should say, “Give this much for the price,” up to three times.

original: zong la rtsig pa ni gzhan gyi don du yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: zong la rtsig pa ni gzhan gyi don du yang mi bya ste /
translated: He should not act as an intermediary even for the sake of others.

original: dkon mchog gsum ni ma @238b gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni ma @238b gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: except for the Three Jewels.

original: zong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Goods means

original: ka ka ni dang ba r'a ta ka la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ka ka ni dang ba r'a ta ka la sogs pa'o //
translated: kaṭhina, bārī, taka, and so on.

original: rtseg pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtseg pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To haggle means

original: nyo bar byed pa'i tshe na cung zad cung zad bskyed pa dang 'tshong bar byed pa'i tshe na cung zad cung zad 'bri bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyo bar byed pa'i tshe na cung zad cung zad bskyed pa dang 'tshong bar byed pa'i tshe na cung zad cung zad 'bri bar byed pa ste /
translated: to increase the price a little when buying and to decrease the price a little when selling.

original: de ni zong la rtseg pa byed pa yin par grags so //
analyzed: de ni zong la rtseg pa byed pa yin par grags so //
translated: This is known as haggling over goods.

original: de'i phyir de ni gzhan gyi don du yang mi bya na rang gi don du lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gzhan gyi don du yang mi bya na rang gi don du lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Therefore, if it should not be done for the sake of others, what need is there to speak of doing it for one’s own sake?

original: de ltar na spyir btang ba byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar na spyir btang ba byas nas /
translated: Having made this general statement,

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the exceptions,

original: dkon mchog gsum ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “except for the Three Jewels.”

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi don du ni zong la brtseg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi don du ni zong la brtseg par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should haggle over goods for the sake of the Three Jewels.

original: gta' gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gta' gzhug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not pawn.

original: gta' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gta' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To pawn means

original: gal te de kho na lta bu ma yin na ngas k'ara sh'a pa na lnga sbyin par bya'o zhes yal zug 'khras pa ma thub ste yal ba na zhva la sogs pa'i rdzas de'i gtar 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: gal te de kho na lta bu ma yin na ngas k'ara sh'a pa na lnga sbyin par bya'o zhes yal zug 'khras pa ma thub ste yal ba na zhva la sogs pa'i rdzas de'i gtar 'jog pa ste /
translated: If it is not like that, I will give you five kārṣāpaṇas.

original: de lta bu'i gta' gzhug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gta' gzhug par mi bya'o //
translated: If he is unable to endure the pain and releases the bowl, etc., he should not deposit it as security.

original: 'dir gzhung ni drug sde dag yal zug 'khra zhing lhung bzed la sogs pa gtar 'jud nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni drug sde dag yal zug 'khra zhing lhung bzed la sogs pa gtar 'jud nas /
translated: Here the text is: The group of six monks, enduring the pain, deposited bowls, etc., as security.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: dge slong gi yal zug 'khra zhing gta' gzhug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi yal zug 'khra zhing gta' gzhug par mi bya'o //
translated: “Monks should not endure the pain and deposit things as security.

original: dge slong yal zug 'khra zhing gta' 'jud na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong yal zug 'khra zhing gta' 'jud na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk endures the pain and deposits things as security, he becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: dge 'dun gyi sbyin par bya'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sbyin par bya'o zhes smras na /
translated: If he says, “It should be given to the Saṅgha,”

original: de la ji ltar sbyin par bya /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sbyin par bya /
translated: how should it be given?

original: sus rjes su sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sus rjes su sbyin par bya zhe na /
translated: By whom should it be given?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyis rdzas de spogs pa la dge 'dun gyi las byed pa las gtad do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyis rdzas de spogs pa la dge 'dun gyi las byed pa las gtad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the Saṅgha should give the goods to the Saṅgha through the Saṅgha’s legal procedure.

original: dge 'dun gyis dbyig la sogs pa'i rdzas de nyo ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes spogs byed cing 'bad pa'i dge slong spogs pa la gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis dbyig la sogs pa'i rdzas de nyo ba la sogs pa'i spyod pas dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa bsgrub par bya'o zhes spogs byed cing 'bad pa'i dge slong spogs pa la gtad par bya'o //
translated: The Saṅgha should make the monk who is engaged in commerce the manager of the Saṅgha’s wealth, such as gold, etc., and he should be diligent in the commerce of buying and selling in order to obtain the Saṅgha’s wealth.

original: ci dge 'dun gyis rang gi dbyig la sogs pa spogs ba la gtad par bya'am zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci dge 'dun gyis rang gi dbyig la sogs pa spogs ba la gtad par bya'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Should the Saṅgha itself engage in commerce with its own gold, etc.?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi las byed pa la gtad do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun gyi las byed pa la gtad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “he is appointed to the Saṅgha’s work.”

original: dge 'dun gyi las byed pa zhes bya ba dam gzhag pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi las byed pa zhes bya ba dam gzhag pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: The Saṅgha’s work is the work of the Saṅgha, such as the recitation of the Prātimokṣa.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽dge 'dun mnga' bdag tu gyur pas dge 'dun gyi las byed pa la dge slong spogs pa 'di la dbyig la sogs pa phog shig ces bka' stsal bar bya zhing /🔽dam gzhag pa la sogs pa des dge slong spogs pa @239a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / dge 'dun mnga' bdag tu gyur pas dge 'dun gyi las byed pa la dge slong spogs pa 'di la dbyig la sogs pa phog shig ces bka' stsal bar bya zhing / dam gzhag pa la sogs pa des dge slong spogs pa @239a * //
translated: This is taught.🔽The Saṅgha is the master, so the Saṅgha should say to the monk who is engaged in commerce, “Give this gold, etc. to the monk who is engaged in commerce.”

original: de la dbyig la sogs pa gtad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dbyig la sogs pa gtad par bya ste /
translated: The monk who is engaged in commerce should give the gold, etc. to the monk who is engaged in commerce.

original: dge slong spogs pa des chos bzhin tshul bzhin du dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong spogs pa des chos bzhin tshul bzhin du dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: That monk who is a trader should make the acquisition of the Saṅgha’s property in accordance with the Dharma, in accordance with the rules.

original: 'di man chad ni dge slong spogs pa de'i bya ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni dge slong spogs pa de'i bya ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: From here on is the statement of the duties of that monk who is a trader.

original: rgan rabs rgan rabs dag la ma zhus par dge 'dun gyi don du brtson par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgan rabs rgan rabs dag la ma zhus par dge 'dun gyi don du brtson par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not strive for the sake of the Saṅgha without first asking the elders.

original: dge slong spogs pa des dge slong rgan rabs rgan rabs dag la ma zhus par dge 'dun gyi don du brtson par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong spogs pa des dge slong rgan rabs rgan rabs dag la ma zhus par dge 'dun gyi don du brtson par mi bya ba'o //
translated: That monk who is a trader should not strive for the sake of the Saṅgha without first asking the elder monks.

original: de'i tshig yi ge bri ba'i dam gzhag la nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshig yi ge bri ba'i dam gzhag la nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should be diligent in the written pledge of the words of that loan of gold and so on, and of the repayment.

original: dge slong spogs pa des dbyig la sogs pa mnos ba dang / bsab pa de'i tshig yi ge bri ba'i dam gzhag la nan tan bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong spogs pa des dbyig la sogs pa mnos ba dang / bsab pa de'i tshig yi ge bri ba'i dam gzhag la nan tan bya ba'o //
translated: That monk who is a trader should be diligent in the written pledge of the words of that loan of gold and so on, and of the repayment.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gang gi tshe dge slong spogs pa des dge 'dun gyi las byed pa las dbyig la sogs pa mnos pa de'i tshe de ma thag kho nar tshig yi ger bri bar bya ste /🔽dus che ge mo zhig gi tshe dge 'dun dang dge 'dun gyi las byed pa che ge mo dang / zhal ta byed pa che ge mos bdag la rdzas 'di tsam zhig gtad pa las bdag gis dus che ge mo'i tshe rdzas des dngos po 'di lta bu zhig rin thang 'di tsam gyis nyos nas yang dus che ge mo'i tshe dngos po de nyid rin thang 'di
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge slong spogs pa des dge 'dun gyi las byed pa las dbyig la sogs pa mnos pa de'i tshe de ma thag kho nar tshig yi ger bri bar bya ste / dus che ge mo zhig gi tshe dge 'dun dang dge 'dun gyi las byed pa che ge mo dang / zhal ta byed pa che ge mos bdag la rdzas 'di tsam zhig gtad pa las bdag gis dus che ge mo'i tshe rdzas des dngos po 'di lta bu zhig rin thang 'di tsam gyis nyos nas yang dus che ge mo'i tshe dngos po de nyid rin thang 'di
translated: When a monk who is a trader receives gold and so on from the saṃgha or a worker for the saṃgha, he should immediately write the following words and letters:🔽At such and such a time, the saṃgha or a worker for the saṃgha or a benefactor gave me this much substance. At such and such a time, I bought this much substance for this much value.

original: tsam zhig tu btsongs te /
analyzed: tsam zhig tu btsongs te /
translated: Again, at such and such a time, I sold that very substance for this much value.

original: de las skyed 'di tsam zhig byung nas /
analyzed: de las skyed 'di tsam zhig byung nas /
translated: From that, this much interest arose.🔽And that was used at such and such a time for the saṃgha’s work.

original: de yang de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi las mang che ge mo zhig tu spyad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig yi ger bri ba'i dam gzhag la dge slong des nan tan bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe dge 'dun gyi las mang che ge mo zhig tu spyad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig yi ger bri ba'i dam gzhag la dge slong des nan tan bya'o //
translated: The monk should make an effort to write words and letters that are a pledge such as this.

original: de dag thams cad ni gzhan gyi phyar ka'i skabs bsal ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis dran par bya ba'i phyir dang ; 'gyed ba mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni gzhan gyi phyar ka'i skabs bsal ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis dran par bya ba'i phyir dang ; 'gyed ba mi bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: All of these are for the purpose of clearing away the criticism of others, for the purpose of remembering oneself, and for the purpose of not generating disputes.

original: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: nyo tshong byed pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The prohibition of buying and selling has been explained.

original: // / da ni lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the prohibition of carrying should be stated.

original: de'i phyir lhung bzed kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lhung bzed kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “of the alms-bowl.”

original: byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be applied as “of the unblessed.”

original: sngar 'chang ba'i spang ba'i skabs su zhag bcur gos 'chang bar gtogs pa'i rnam pa bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sngar 'chang ba'i spang ba'i skabs su zhag bcur gos 'chang bar gtogs pa'i rnam pa bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The form of carrying the robe for ten days, which was taught in the section on the prohibition of carrying above, should be applied here as well.

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: skya ba dang dkar ba dang che ba rnams ni rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Gray, white, and large ones are not suitable.

original: lhung bzed skya ba dang / dkar ba dang che ba rnams ni rung ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lhung bzed skya ba dang / dkar ba dang che ba rnams ni rung ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Gray, white, and large begging bowls are not suitable.

original: rung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pas de 'chang na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rung ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pas de 'chang na nyes byas so //
translated: Since they are not suitable, they are not to be consecrated. If he keeps them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma tshos pa yang chung du nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma tshos pa yang chung du nyid yin no zhes bya ba la / rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyags pa'i phyir /
translated: Unbaked ones are also small.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: Since it is not suitable, the word “also” is stated to follow the statement “it is not suitable.”

original: ji ltar lhung bzed chung dus lhung bzed kyi bya ba byed mi nus pa de bzhin du lhung bzed ma tshos pa yang don de dang 'dra bas chung du nyid cas smos te /
