analyzed: ji ltar lhung bzed chung dus lhung bzed kyi bya ba byed mi nus pa de bzhin du lhung bzed ma tshos pa yang don de dang 'dra bas chung du nyid cas smos te /
translated: Just as a small begging bowl cannot perform the function of a begging bowl, so also a begging bowl that is not baked is similar to that.

original: lhung bzed nag por gyur kyang ma tshos na chung du nyid kyang rung ba ma yin pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhung bzed nag por gyur kyang ma tshos na chung du nyid kyang rung ba ma yin pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be small. Even if a begging bowl becomes black, if it is not baked, it is not suitable. This is the meaning of the passage.🔽Here, the text of those two sūtras states:

original: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las lhung bzed ma tshos ba 'chang na nyes @240a * //
analyzed: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las lhung bzed ma tshos ba 'chang na nyes @240a * //
translated: If one keeps a begging bowl that is not baked, one commits an offense.

original: byas so // de bzhin du lhung bzed skya bo dang / lhung bzed dkar po dang / lhung bzed chen po 'chang na nyes byas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byas so // de bzhin du lhung bzed skya bo dang / lhung bzed dkar po dang / lhung bzed chen po 'chang na nyes byas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Similarly, if one keeps a grey begging bowl, a white begging bowl, or a large begging bowl, one commits an offense.

original: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las lhung bzed chung du 'chang ba la lhung ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ba de ni sman phor du yongs su spyad pa'i bsam pas 'chang na de la lhung ba med par gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las lhung bzed chung du 'chang ba la lhung ba med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs ba de ni sman phor du yongs su spyad pa'i bsam pas 'chang na de la lhung ba med par gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: This means that if one possesses a small begging bowl with the intention of using it as a medicine container, there is no offense.

original: 'dir ni lhung bzed 'chang ba'i gnas skabs dang / lhung bzed med pa'i gnas skabs su de dag lhung bzed kyi don du 'chang ba nyid na nyes byas su gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni lhung bzed 'chang ba'i gnas skabs dang / lhung bzed med pa'i gnas skabs su de dag lhung bzed kyi don du 'chang ba nyid na nyes byas su gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But here, it is said that if one possesses a small begging bowl in place of a begging bowl or in place of a begging bowl that is lost, then one commits an offense.

original: lhung bzed chung du gcig la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed chung du gcig la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense for possessing one small begging bowl.

original: lhung bzed chung du gcig lhag par 'chang ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed chung du gcig lhag par 'chang ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that there is no offense for possessing one additional small begging bowl.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du lhung bzed chung dus ljongs rgyur 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du lhung bzed chung dus ljongs rgyur 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: One should travel in the countryside with a small begging bowl because it is dangerous.

original: gal te 'cha' bar mi bya na lhung bzed chung dus ji ltar 'gro bar bya zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'cha' bar mi bya na lhung bzed chung dus ji ltar 'gro bar bya zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: If he does not make a new one, how will he go forth with a small almsbowl?”

original: lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The prohibition against possessing an almsbowl has been explained.

original: // / da ni lhung bzed lhag pa tshol ba'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni lhung bzed lhag pa tshol ba'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the prohibition against seeking an extra almsbowl should be stated.

original: tshol ba de yang chags pa'i dbang las 'byung bas de'i phyir spyir 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshol ba de yang chags pa'i dbang las 'byung bas de'i phyir spyir 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since that seeking arises from the power of attachment, therefore it should be stated in general:

original: ha cang chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ha cang chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Do not be excessively attached.”

original: dge slong gis dngos po thams cad la ha cang chags par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis dngos po thams cad la ha cang chags par mi bya ba ste /
translated: A monk should not be excessively attached to any object.

original: chags pa'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni gnas mal gyi gzhir nye dga'i skabs su gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni gnas mal gyi gzhir nye dga'i skabs su gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because of attachment, the text here states the case of bedding and seats in the chapter on the rainy season retreat.

original: yo byad la ha cang lhag par chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad la dge slong gis ha cang lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni ha cang zhen par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: yo byad la ha cang lhag par chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad la dge slong gis ha cang lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni ha cang zhen par mi bya ba ste /
translated: “Do not be excessively attached to requisites” means that a monk should not be excessively attached to requisites such as almsbowls. “Excessively attached” means excessively clinging.

original: 'dir zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir zhen par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not be attached to it.

original: gang la zhen pa de bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang la zhen pa de bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of “one should not keep it” is that one should not keep that to which one is attached.

original: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Attachment” means

original: lhag par chags pa ste /
analyzed: lhag par chags pa ste /
translated: excessive attachment.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la lhag par chags pa 'byung ba de bcang par mi bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po gang la lhag par chags pa 'byung ba de bcang par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not keep an object such as a begging bowl to which excessive attachment arises.

original: yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should completely abandon it.

original: mdo de gnyis ni gos kyi gzhi las 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo de gnyis ni gos kyi gzhi las 'byung ste /
translated: These two sūtras are found in the chapter on robes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis yo byad la ha cang lhag par chags pa bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis yo byad la ha cang lhag par chags pa bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: The text here says, “Therefore, a monk should not generate excessive attachment to requisites.

original: dngos po gang la ha cang lhag par chags pa 'byung ba de @240b yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la ha cang lhag par chags pa 'byung ba de @240b yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: One should completely abandon an object to which excessive attachment arises.

original: yongs su mi spong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mi spong na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not completely abandon it, one becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: lhung bzed kyang med na bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyang med na bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not have a begging bowl, one should beg for one.

original: slong ba dgag pa'o gnas 'byung ba bzlog pa'i phyir tshig 'di byas te /
analyzed: slong ba dgag pa'o gnas 'byung ba bzlog pa'i phyir tshig 'di byas te /
translated: The verse was composed to prevent the arising of a basis for begging.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po med na lhung bzed kyang bslang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po med na lhung bzed kyang bslang bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not have a begging bowl, etc., one should beg for a begging bowl.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos gos la sogs pa yang med na bslang bar bya ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos gos la sogs pa yang med na bslang bar bya ba bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes robes, etc.

original: dngos po gang yod na lhung bzed tshol ba las 'byung ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gang yod na lhung bzed tshol ba las 'byung ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one has any possessions, what is the sin of seeking a begging bowl?

original: de'i phyir de yod pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yod pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “if one has it.”

original: tshol bar byed pa de la lhung bzed de yod pa nyid de bdog pa nyid yin na ltung ba 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshol bar byed pa de la lhung bzed de yod pa nyid de bdog pa nyid yin na ltung ba 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: If one has that begging bowl, if one possesses it, then this sin arises.

original: ji lta bu zhig yod pa nyid na /🔽de'i phyir lhan pa bzhi man chad nas de dag rung zhing yongs su spyad bzod pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig yod pa nyid na / de'i phyir lhan pa bzhi man chad nas de dag rung zhing yongs su spyad bzod pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What kind of possession is it?🔽Therefore, it is said: “if it is suitable and acceptable, even if it is more than four patches.”

original: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas de dag rung zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas de dag rung zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If it is suitable and acceptable, even if it is more than four patches” means

original: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas glan zin pa nas de dag glan du rung ba ste /
analyzed: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas glan zin pa nas de dag glan du rung ba ste /
translated: If he seeks another alms bowl when he has one that is suitable to be repaired with four patches or more,

original: lhung bzed skyon med pa tshun chad lhan pa bzhi man chad nas glan pa dang / lhan pa bzhi glan du rung ba'i bar gyi lhung bzed gang yin pa de yongs su longs spyad par bzod pa'i lhung bzed kyang yin pa de yod pa nyid na lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na /🔽de la de las byung ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed skyon med pa tshun chad lhan pa bzhi man chad nas glan pa dang / lhan pa bzhi glan du rung ba'i bar gyi lhung bzed gang yin pa de yongs su longs spyad par bzod pa'i lhung bzed kyang yin pa de yod pa nyid na lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na / de la de las byung ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then he commits an offense entailing confession for each bowl.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows:

original: lhung bzed skyon med pa yongs su longs spyad par bzod pas snyi ba nyid la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba gang yin pa de dang lhan pa gcig gam /🔽gnyis sam / gsum mam /🔽bzhis glan zin pa gang dag yin pa dang / lhan pa gcig gam /
analyzed: lhung bzed skyon med pa yongs su longs spyad par bzod pas snyi ba nyid la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral ba gang yin pa de dang lhan pa gcig gam / gnyis sam / gsum mam / bzhis glan zin pa gang dag yin pa dang / lhan pa gcig gam /
translated: A monk should use an alms bowl that is suitable to be used until it breaks, that is, one that is free of the faults of being too thin, and so on.🔽If he has one that has been repaired with one, two, three, or four patches,

original: gnyis sam / gsum mam /
analyzed: gnyis sam / gsum mam /
translated: or one that is suitable to be repaired with one, two, three, or four patches,🔽and he seeks another alms bowl,🔽then he commits an offense entailing confession for each bowl.

original: bzhis glan du rung zhing byed du gzhag nus pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi nang nas lhung bzed yongs su longs spyad par bzod pa gang yang rung ba zhig yod cing bdog bzhin du lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na /
analyzed: bzhis glan du rung zhing byed du gzhag nus pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi nang nas lhung bzed yongs su longs spyad par bzod pa gang yang rung ba zhig yod cing bdog bzhin du lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na /
translated: If one has any of those that are suitable to be used for four years and that can be kept, and if one seeks another almsbowl while one has and is using a bowl that is suitable to be used for four years,

original: de la de las byung ba kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de las byung ba kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is an offense for that.

original: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now this should be stated:

original: lhung bzed de yod pa nyid na ci zhig ltag par spyad na kha na tho ba ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed de yod pa nyid na ci zhig ltag par spyad na kha na tho ba ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one has that almsbowl, what is the offense if one uses it for a long time?

original: de'i phyir khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslang bas yongs su btsal na'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te yongs su @241a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslang bas yongs su btsal na'o zhes bya ba smras te / khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te yongs su @241a * //
translated: Therefore it is said: “if one seeks it from a layperson who is not a relative.”

original: btsal na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btsal na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: if one seeks it from a layperson who is not a relative.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gang las lhung bzed yongs su tshol bar byed pa de gal te khyim pa yang yin la nye du ma yin pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gang las lhung bzed yongs su tshol bar byed pa de gal te khyim pa yang yin la nye du ma yin pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: If the one from whom one seeks a begging bowl is a layperson who is not a relative,

original: de las ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bslang bas lhung bzed btsal te thob na de las byung ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bslang bas lhung bzed btsal te thob na de las byung ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if one seeks a begging bowl through verbal informative form from that person and obtains it, then one commits an offense that arises from that.

original: de nyid bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan la yang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan la yang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this is similar for other bases of training,

original: de gnyis ni 'og ma gnyis la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'og ma gnyis la yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the text says, “These two are also for the other two.”

original: 'di'i 'og ma bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag la yang nye du ma yin pa dang / khyim pa nyid ces bya ba 'di gnyis rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di'i 'og ma bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag la yang nye du ma yin pa dang / khyim pa nyid ces bya ba 'di gnyis rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this is that these two, “not a relative” and “a layperson,” should be understood to apply to the two remaining bases of training.

original: 'og ma gnyis la yang ngo zhes spyir bstan pa de'i bye brag spyir bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'og ma gnyis la yang ngo zhes spyir bstan pa de'i bye brag spyir bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the specific cases of the general statement, “These two are also for the other two,”

original: thag pa dang sbyin pa dang gzhan dag la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thag pa dang sbyin pa dang gzhan dag la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the text says, “from a weaver, from a donor, and from others.”

original: thag pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan ni thag pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan dag ste /
analyzed: thag pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan ni thag pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan dag ste /
translated: and weavers, and donors, and others, and weavers, and donors, and others.

original: de dag nye du ma yin pa dang khyim pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag nye du ma yin pa dang khyim pa dag la'o //
translated: They are not relatives and are householders.

original: 'di ltar gtsug lag las gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtsug lag las gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: It is stated in the scriptures that it is also by other means.

original: 'on kyang gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras de gzung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras de gzung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: However, the term “others” should be understood to include those.

original: de ltar yang de las rin med par tshol bas pho nya la sogs ba gzhan la 'thag tu bcug na zhes gsungs pa de'i don gzhan zhes smos pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang de las rin med par tshol bas pho nya la sogs ba gzhan la 'thag tu bcug na zhes gsungs pa de'i don gzhan zhes smos pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it states in the scriptures, “If one requests a weaver to weave cloth without pay, then it is by means of a messenger and so on.” The meaning of “others” should be understood to include those included in the term “messenger” and so on.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: tha ga pa 'thag pa dang / sbyin par byed pa khyim bdag la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i pho nya la sogs pa nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / khyim pa nyid yin na ltung ba 'og ma gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha ga pa 'thag pa dang / sbyin par byed pa khyim bdag la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i pho nya la sogs pa nye du ma yin pa nyid dang / khyim pa nyid yin na ltung ba 'og ma gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the weaver is not a relative and is a householder, then the two lower downfalls occur.

original: nye du ma yin pa ltar nye du las ni skyed dang lhung bzed gnyis ma gtogs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa ltar nye du las ni skyed dang lhung bzed gnyis ma gtogs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: As with a nonrelative, there is no offense in taking from a relative except for the two of generating and alms.

original: nye du ma yin pa ltar zhes bya ba de ni nye du ma yin pa'i yul la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa ltar zhes bya ba de ni nye du ma yin pa'i yul la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: As with a nonrelative means that downfalls are posited in relation to a nonrelative object.

original: nye du ma yin pa la bsod pa slong ba la sogs pa'i kha nam thob gang yin pa de nye du las slong bar byed na kha na ma tho ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa la bsod pa slong ba la sogs pa'i kha nam thob gang yin pa de nye du las slong bar byed na kha na ma tho ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
translated: If one requests fine things from a relative, one should understand that there is no offense in requesting from a relative, except for the two of generating and alms.

original: don ni de yin no //🔽nye du las ni skyed dang lhung bzed gnyis ma gtogs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don ni de yin no // nye du las ni skyed dang lhung bzed gnyis ma gtogs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning.🔽As with a relative, there is no offense in taking from a relative except for the two of generating and alms.

original: nye du las kyang skyed kyi bslab pa'i gzhi la spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nye du las kyang skyed kyi bslab pa'i gzhi la spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: As with a relative, there is no offense in generating, except for the wish to deceive through the basis of training.

original: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang / nyo @241b tshong dag gi spyod pa dag las rnyed pa grub pa dang / lhung bzed tshol ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi la lhung bzed lhag par gyur pa'i nyes pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang / nyo @241b tshong dag gi spyod pa dag las rnyed pa grub pa dang / lhung bzed tshol ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi la lhung bzed lhag par gyur pa'i nyes pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: The fault of possessing an extra alms bowl occurs in the training rule of seeking an alms bowl, and the fault of acquiring a bowl through a conspicuous action or the action of buying and selling.

original: de las gzhan pa thams cad la ni ji ltar nye du ma yin pa las nyes par 'gyur ba ltar nye du las nyes pa med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa thams cad la ni ji ltar nye du ma yin pa las nyes par 'gyur ba ltar nye du las nyes pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: In all other cases, one should understand that there is no fault if the person is a relative, just as there is no fault if the person is not a relative.

original: de gnyis kyang na smad pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang na smad pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Both of these are reprehensible,

original: dngos gzhi'i ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but they do not constitute a downfall of the fundamental precepts.🔽The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:🔽If a weaver who is a relative sews robes for a monk who is a relative, there is no offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las tha ga pa nye dus chos gos 'thag na nye du yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang / gcer bu pa la bza' ba la sogs pa sbyin na nye du yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las tha ga pa nye dus chos gos 'thag na nye du yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang / gcer bu pa la bza' ba la sogs pa sbyin na nye du yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: If a naked ascetic who is a relative is given food, there is no offense.

original: zhu ba las kyang nye du las zas bsod pa blangs te rang za ba dang / gcer bu bal sbyin zhing sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa las dbral bar 'dod pas sbyin par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zhu ba las kyang nye du las zas bsod pa blangs te rang za ba dang / gcer bu bal sbyin zhing sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa las dbral bar 'dod pas sbyin par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: Also, if he takes good food from a relative who is begging, and eats it himself, or if he gives it to a naked ascetic, wishing to free him from the view of sin, there is no offense.

original: nye du yin na yang de bzhin no zhes gang gsungs pa de yin no //
analyzed: nye du yin na yang de bzhin no zhes gang gsungs pa de yin no //
translated: If it is a relative, it is as stated.

original: zhar las byung ba bstan nas khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslang bas yongs su btsal na'o zhes gang smras pa'i ltung ba de'i skabs su gtogs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhar las byung ba bstan nas khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslang bas yongs su btsal na'o zhes gang smras pa'i ltung ba de'i skabs su gtogs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the digression, in order to explain the topic that was interrupted, “having sought from a layperson who is not a relative, having been invited,” this should be stated.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed tshol ba tsam las nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed tshol ba tsam las nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct” means that merely seeking a begging bowl is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de las grub na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las grub na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If it is accomplished from that, it is the actual basis” means

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa de las bslang bas lhung bzed btsal te lhung bzed thob na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa de las bslang bas lhung bzed btsal te lhung bzed thob na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that if he seeks a begging bowl from that layperson who is not a relative, having been invited, and obtains a begging bowl, it becomes an actual basis offense.

original: med pa nyid las yod pa'i blo can la ni na smad do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa nyid las yod pa'i blo can la ni na smad do zhes bya ba la /
translated: But if he has the thought of having one, he is faulted.

original: med pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to the phrase “in regard to non-existence,”

original: lhung bzed snga ma byin gyis brlab tu rung ba shos med pa nyid la ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed snga ma byin gyis brlab tu rung ba shos med pa nyid la ste /
translated: it is not suitable to consecrate an old alms-bowl.

original: chag pa 'am stor ba la sogs pa'i nyes pas med par gyur pa la'o //🔽yod pa'i blo can la ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chag pa 'am stor ba la sogs pa'i nyes pas med par gyur pa la'o // yod pa'i blo can la ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not suitable to consecrate one that has been damaged, lost, or the like.🔽In regard to the phrase “if he has the thought of having one,”

original: yod pa'i blo dang bcas pa la ste /
analyzed: yod pa'i blo dang bcas pa la ste /
translated: he has the thought of having one.

original: bdag la lhung bzed gzhan yod do snyam pa'i blo gang la yod pa la'o //
analyzed: bdag la lhung bzed gzhan yod do snyam pa'i blo gang la yod pa la'o //
translated: He has the thought “I have another alms-bowl.”

original: na smad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: na smad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to the phrase “he is faulted,”

original: de ltar dge slong gang lhung bzed snga ma shos byin gyis brlab tu rung ba shos med bzhin du bdag la lhung bzed gzhan yod do snyam pa'i blo yod cing de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong gang lhung bzed snga ma shos byin gyis brlab tu rung ba shos med bzhin du bdag la lhung bzed gzhan yod do snyam pa'i blo yod cing de'i tshe /
translated: if a monk, in that way, does not have an old alms-bowl that is suitable to consecrate, but has the thought “I have another alms-bowl,” and at that time

original: gal te lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na de la ni dngos gzhi'i lhung ba na smad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na de la ni dngos gzhi'i lhung ba na smad par shes par bya ste /
translated: seeks another alms-bowl, he should be understood to have committed a root downfall.

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha @242a * //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha @242a * //
translated: This is the meaning of the last phrase.

original: tshig go // lhung bzed btsal ba rnyed pa'i dus na snga ma shos dge slong de la med pa'i phyir lhung bzed lhag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig go // lhung bzed btsal ba rnyed pa'i dus na snga ma shos dge slong de la med pa'i phyir lhung bzed lhag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the time comes to search for a begging bowl, the first monk does not have a second begging bowl, so he does not commit the offense of possessing a second begging bowl.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed ma chis bzhin du lhung bzed gzhan blangs par gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed ma chis bzhin du lhung bzed gzhan blangs par gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here is the text: “Can a monk take up another begging bowl without having the first one destroyed, and not commit an offense?🔽”

original: yod de gal te blangs pa dang / snga phyi med par lhung bzed chag bar gyur na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod de gal te blangs pa dang / snga phyi med par lhung bzed chag bar gyur na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha said, “Yes, if he takes it up and the first one is lost, there is no offense.”

original: 'dir spang ba med pa las dgongs nas ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir spang ba med pa las dgongs nas ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin pas /
translated: Here, intending that there is no offense when there is no offense, he said, “There is no offense.”

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas ni dang po nyid nas byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas ni dang po nyid nas byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the wrong action that arises from preparation is committed from the very beginning.

original: dngos gzhi'i dus na ni lhung bzed snga ma chud zos pa nyid kyi phyir nyes byas kho nar zad do //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i dus na ni lhung bzed snga ma chud zos pa nyid kyi phyir nyes byas kho nar zad do //
translated: At the time of the actual basis, it is only a minor offense because the former alms bowl has already been lost.

original: gal te tshol ba'i dus na yang lhung bzed de chud zos par gyur zin na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshol ba'i dus na yang lhung bzed de chud zos par gyur zin na ni /
translated: If at the time of seeking, the alms bowl has already been lost,

original: de'i tshe na sbyor ba'i ltung ba yang na smad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sbyor ba'i ltung ba yang na smad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, the downfall of preparation is only a minor offense.

original: rang gi yo byad dag gis so zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: rang gi yo byad dag gis so zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: With one’s own possessions.

original: lhung bzed yod du zin na yang gal te rang gi rin du gyur pa'i yo byad dag gis lhung bzed gzhan tshol lam nyo bar byed na da lta na yang ltung ba na smad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed yod du zin na yang gal te rang gi rin du gyur pa'i yo byad dag gis lhung bzed gzhan tshol lam nyo bar byed na da lta na yang ltung ba na smad par rig par bya ste /
translated: If one has an alms bowl, but seeks or buys another alms bowl with one’s own possessions, then even now one should understand that it is a downfall that is merely reprehensible,

original: bslang bas btsal ba dang thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslang bas btsal ba dang thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not sought or obtained through begging.

original: de dag yod pa nyid na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if they exist.

original: rang gi yo byad dag ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rang gi yo byad dag ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is connected with “with one’s own possessions.”

original: lhung bzed kyi rin du gyur pa rang gi yo byad dag yod cing bdog pa nyid na lhung bzed med kyang gal te lhung bzed rang gi yo byad dag gis nyo bar mi byed par 'di ltar lhung bzed de slong bar byed na de la yang ltung ba
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi rin du gyur pa rang gi yo byad dag yod cing bdog pa nyid na lhung bzed med kyang gal te lhung bzed rang gi yo byad dag gis nyo bar mi byed par 'di ltar lhung bzed de slong bar byed na de la yang ltung ba
translated: If one has one’s own articles to purchase a begging bowl, but does not purchase a begging bowl with one’s own articles, but instead begs for a begging bowl, then one commits an offense.

original: na smad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: na smad par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as a reprehensible offense.

original: slong ba'i tshe na ni sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas phra mor 'gyur la /
analyzed: slong ba'i tshe na ni sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas phra mor 'gyur la /
translated: When begging, one commits a minor offense called “preparation.”

original: thob na ni dngos gzhi zhes bya ba'i nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob na ni dngos gzhi zhes bya ba'i nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one obtains it, one commits a mere offense called “actual basis.”

original: chos gos la sogs pa dag la yang rigs pa 'di nyid rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa dag la yang rigs pa 'di nyid rig par bya'o //
translated: This principle should be understood for Dharma robes and so on.

original: bzang po 'dod pas brje na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pas brje na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one exchanges it, desiring a good one.

original: lhung bzed bzang po 'dod pa ni lhung bzed bzang po 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed bzang po 'dod pa ni lhung bzed bzang po 'dod pa ste /
translated: Desiring a good begging bowl is desiring a good begging bowl.

original: ae ma'o lhung bzed bzang po mdzes pa bdag gi lhung bzed du gyur cig snyam du de ltar zhugs pa'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni bzang po 'dod pa yin no //🔽bzang po 'dod pa des brje ba'i don du lhung bzed bcel zhing de sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: ae ma'o lhung bzed bzang po mdzes pa bdag gi lhung bzed du gyur cig snyam du de ltar zhugs pa'i 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni bzang po 'dod pa yin no // bzang po 'dod pa des brje ba'i don du lhung bzed bcel zhing de sngon du btang ste /
translated: The desire to obtain a good alms bowl, thinking Oh, may this good alms bowl be mine! is the desire for good quality.

original: rje bar byed na ltung ba na smad par shes par @242b bya'o ;
analyzed: rje bar byed na ltung ba na smad par shes par @242b bya'o ;
translated: If one who desires good quality exchanges one's alms bowl for the sake of a better one, and if one does so with the intention of exchanging it, then one commits an offense.

original: /'o na brje ba las len na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba der ltung ba med par ma gsungs sam zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na brje ba las len na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba der ltung ba med par ma gsungs sam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it said that there is no offense if one exchanges it?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang bzang po 'dod pa med par brje ba'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang bzang po 'dod pa med par brje ba'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is true, but that refers to an exchange without desire for good quality.

original: 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is how the offense is determined.

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te thob na ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te thob na ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If one receives an alms bowl from a layperson who is not a relative, it is a root downfall.

original: ma bslangs par rin la sogs pas btsal na nye du yin yang rung nye du ma yin yang rung khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba las thob na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma bslangs par rin la sogs pas btsal na nye du yin yang rung nye du ma yin yang rung khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba las thob na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one seeks a begging bowl by offering a price for it, even if it is from a relative, or even if it is from a layperson or a renunciate who is not a relative, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bdag po med pa'i lhung bzed btsal ba las grub pa gang yin pa de la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: bdag po med pa'i lhung bzed btsal ba las grub pa gang yin pa de la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one seeks a begging bowl that is not owned by anyone, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bzang po 'dod pas snga ma brjes nas grub pa gang yin pa de la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pas snga ma brjes nas grub pa gang yin pa de la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one seeks a begging bowl because one wants a better one, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba thams cad la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad la yang nyes byas so //
translated: In all cases, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bzang po 'dod pa nyid med par lhung bzed brje bas lhung bzed grub na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pa nyid med par lhung bzed brje bas lhung bzed grub na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If one seeks a begging bowl because one wants a better one, but one does not commit an offense when one obtains a begging bowl by exchanging one’s old one.

original: gang dag lhung bzed tshol ba las byung ba'i ltung ba thams cad bzang po 'dod pa nyid yan lag tu rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i bzang po 'dod pa nyid de la ni /
analyzed: gang dag lhung bzed tshol ba las byung ba'i ltung ba thams cad bzang po 'dod pa nyid yan lag tu rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i bzang po 'dod pa nyid de la ni /
translated: The root text states that all the downfalls that occur in the context of seeking a begging bowl are included in the category of “wanting a better one.”

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa nyid las lhung bzed lhag pa grub pa'i dngos gzhi la ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa nyid las lhung bzed lhag pa grub pa'i dngos gzhi la ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not a relative, and it is more than a begging bowl, then the actual basis is a downfall.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so //
translated: If it is a preparation, it is a minor offense.

original: yan lag gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba la ni dngos gzhi la nyes byas so //
analyzed: yan lag gang yang rung ba ma tshang ba la ni dngos gzhi la nyes byas so //
translated: If any of the branches are incomplete, then the actual basis is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas phra mo'o//
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas phra mo'o//
translated: If it is a preparation, it is a very minor offense.

original: yan lag tu ma tshang ba la ni dngos gzhi la nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: yan lag tu ma tshang ba la ni dngos gzhi la nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: If any of the branches are incomplete, then the actual basis is a very minor offense.

original: sbyor ba la ni shin tu phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni shin tu phra mo'o //
translated: If it is a preparation, it is a very minor offense.

original: gal te lhung bzed de nyid zhag bcu 'das par gyur na ni de la spang ba gzhan cig kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te lhung bzed de nyid zhag bcu 'das par gyur na ni de la spang ba gzhan cig kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that very begging bowl is kept for more than ten days, then another downfall is incurred.

original: bshags pa'i dus na yang ltung ba spang ba gnyis bshags par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bshags pa'i dus na yang ltung ba spang ba gnyis bshags par bya dgos so //
translated: When confessing, one must confess both downfalls.

original: da ni spang ba bshags pa'i sbyor ba gzhan dag las 'di'i bshags pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni spang ba bshags pa'i sbyor ba gzhan dag las 'di'i bshags pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the difference in the preparation for confession from other preparations, he says:

original: 'di ni dge 'dun la spang ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di ni dge 'dun la spang ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is a downfall that is confessed to the community.

original: lhung bzed lhag pa 'di ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag pa 'di ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “this extra alms bowl” is supplied.

original: chos gos la sogs pa spang ba'i rdzas gzhan ni gang zag la spang bar bya ste /🔽'di ltar lhung bzed 'brel ba med par ni dge 'dun kho na las 'thob kyi /
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa spang ba'i rdzas gzhan ni gang zag la spang bar bya ste / 'di ltar lhung bzed 'brel ba med par ni dge 'dun kho na las 'thob kyi /
translated: Other articles to be relinquished, such as Dharma robes, are relinquished to an individual.

original: gang zag las ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di ni dge 'dun kho na la spang bar bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag las ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di ni dge 'dun kho na la spang bar bstan to //
translated: Because an extra alms bowl is obtained only from the saṅgha, not from an individual, it is taught that it is relinquished to the saṅgha.

original: ci lhung bzed thams cad dge 'dun la spang bar bya ba yin nam zhe na /🔽ma yin te de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na mchog tu 'dod pa gcig @243a * //
analyzed: ci lhung bzed thams cad dge 'dun la spang bar bya ba yin nam zhe na / ma yin te de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na mchog tu 'dod pa gcig @243a * //
translated: Must all extra alms bowls be relinquished to the saṅgha?

original: go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, therefore the text says, “If there are many, the best is relinquished to the saṅgha.”

original: lhung bzed lhag pa du ma nyid yin na de dag gi nang nas lhung bzed mchog tu 'dod pa zhes bya ba mchog tu gdams pa gcig dge 'dun la spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag pa du ma nyid yin na de dag gi nang nas lhung bzed mchog tu 'dod pa zhes bya ba mchog tu gdams pa gcig dge 'dun la spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: If there are many extra alms bowls, then the best of them, that is, the one most highly valued, is relinquished to the saṅgha.

original: 'o na lhung bzed lhag ma gzhan ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lhung bzed lhag ma gzhan ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done with the other extra alms bowls?

original: de'i phyir gzhan ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the other should be abandoned in every way.

original: lhung bzed gzhan ni thams cad kyi thams cad kho nar spang bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: lhung bzed gzhan ni thams cad kyi thams cad kho nar spang bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: The other begging bowl should be abandoned in every way.

original: yang phyir blang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang phyir blang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It should not be taken up again.

original: 'o na su la spang bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na su la spang bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: To whom should it be abandoned?

original: de'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it should be abandoned to the one who is fully ordained.

original: rab tu byung ba 'di gang la yod pa de ni rab tu byung ba 'di pa ste de la'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba 'di gang la yod pa de ni rab tu byung ba 'di pa ste de la'o //
translated: The one who is fully ordained is the one who has that, i.e., it should be abandoned to him.

original: dge tshul la sogs pa gang zag thams cad la spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge tshul la sogs pa gang zag thams cad la spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it should be abandoned to all persons, such as novices.

original: 'dir gzhung ni lhung bzed lhag ma rnams ni dge slong rnams la go bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni lhung bzed lhag ma rnams ni dge slong rnams la go bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the treatise states that the remaining begging bowls should be understood by the monks.

original: dge slong zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: dge slong zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The term “monk” is merely an illustration.

original: chos 'di la rab tu byung ba thams cad kyang spyir bsdu'o //
analyzed: chos 'di la rab tu byung ba thams cad kyang spyir bsdu'o //
translated: All those who have gone forth in this Dharma are included in this.

original: lhung bzed lhag po tshol ba las byung ba'i lhung ba 'byin pa po'i dge slong di la lhung bzed gang sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag po tshol ba las byung ba'i lhung ba 'byin pa po'i dge slong di la lhung bzed gang sbyin par bya zhe na /
translated: To which monk who has committed a downfall should a spare begging bowl be given?

original: de'i phyir de la tha chad sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la tha chad sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The worst should be given to him.”

original: dge slong thams cad kyi lhung bzed gang dag yin pa de dag gi nang na lhung bzed tha chad gang yin pa thams cad kyi nang na ngan bsnyigs de ltung ba 'byin pa po de la sbyin par bya'i /
analyzed: dge slong thams cad kyi lhung bzed gang dag yin pa de dag gi nang na lhung bzed tha chad gang yin pa thams cad kyi nang na ngan bsnyigs de ltung ba 'byin pa po de la sbyin par bya'i /
translated: Among all the begging bowls of the monks, the worst begging bowl should be given to the monk who has committed the downfall.

original: spangs pa de dag nyi tshe'i nang na tha chad 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa de dag nyi tshe'i nang na tha chad 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: The worst is not just the worst of the discarded bowls.

original: tha chad ces bya ba ni dge 'dun thams cad kyi lhung bzed dag las tha chad gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: tha chad ces bya ba ni dge 'dun thams cad kyi lhung bzed dag las tha chad gang yin pa ste /
translated: The worst means the worst of all the begging bowls of the saṅgha.

original: de nyid dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa po de la sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa po de la sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: That very worst should be given to the monk who has committed the downfall.

original: thabs gang gis dge 'dun la tha chad de bsnyig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang gis dge 'dun la tha chad de bsnyig par bya zhe na /
translated: By what means should the worst begging bowl be given to the Saṅgha?

original: de'i phyir brim pas bsnyig par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brim pas bsnyig par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “it should be given by means of a distribution.”

original: spang pa'i lhung bzed de brim pas dge 'dun las lhung bzed tha chad de bsnyig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: spang pa'i lhung bzed de brim pas dge 'dun las lhung bzed tha chad de bsnyig par bya ba'o //
translated: That discarded begging bowl should be given to the Saṅgha by means of a distribution.

original: byed pa po ci lta bus brim pas dge 'dun las lhung bzed tha chad de bsnyig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po ci lta bus brim pas dge 'dun las lhung bzed tha chad de bsnyig par bya zhe na /
translated: By what kind of agent should the worst begging bowl be given to the Saṅgha by means of a distribution?

original: de'i phyir bskos pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bskos pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “by one who is appointed.”

original: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bskos pa'i dge slong gis so //
analyzed: gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis bskos pa'i dge slong gis so //
translated: By a monk who is appointed by means of a two-part rite.

original: dge slong bskos pa des lhung bzed bsnyigs @243b pa'i phyir 'drim pa na de'i kun du spyad bdag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong bskos pa des lhung bzed bsnyigs @243b pa'i phyir 'drim pa na de'i kun du spyad bdag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: When that appointed monk is distributing the begging bowls in order to discard them, in order to teach his conduct,

original: des sang de byed par 'gyur pa na tshogs pa'i dus su dge 'dun la 'jal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: des sang de byed par 'gyur pa na tshogs pa'i dus su dge 'dun la 'jal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said: “When he is going to do that tomorrow, he should announce it to the Saṅgha at the time of the assembly.”

original: bskos pa'i dge slong des sang zhes bya ba phyi de nyin par 'dri ma par de byed par 'gyur ba na des dgongs ka tshun chad dge 'dun nam tshogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba gang gi tshe dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag mchod pa la
analyzed: bskos pa'i dge slong des sang zhes bya ba phyi de nyin par 'dri ma par de byed par 'gyur ba na des dgongs ka tshun chad dge 'dun nam tshogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba gang gi tshe dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag mchod pa la
translated: The appointed monk should do that on the following day, saying “tomorrow.”🔽When the time has arrived for the Saṅgha or the group, that is, when the monks who have become the Saṅgha are gathered in one place for worship, etc.,

original: sogs pa la gnas gcig tu tshogs par gyur pa'i dus su dge slong rnams la 'jal bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa la gnas gcig tu tshogs par gyur pa'i dus su dge slong rnams la 'jal bar bya'o //
translated: he should announce to the monks.

original: ji skad 'jal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad 'jal bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should he announce?

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang lhung bzed 'brel pa med par 'drim par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang lhung bzed 'brel pa med par 'drim par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore he should say, “Venerables, tomorrow I will distribute the alms bowls without a connection.

original: khyed cag rang rang gi lhung bzed dag thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du gshegs par mdzod cig ces so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khyed cag rang rang gi lhung bzed dag thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du gshegs par mdzod cig ces so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: You should each take your own alms bowl and enter the Saṅgha.”

original: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun las thob pa'i lhung bzed tha chad kyi ming yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun las thob pa'i lhung bzed tha chad kyi ming yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Alms bowl without a connection” should be understood as the name for the lowest alms bowl obtained from the Saṅgha.

original: de yang aun na ha na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang aun na ha na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Unnata means “without a connection.”

original: 'di ltar na ha zhes bya ba ni ha na ban dha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar na ha zhes bya ba ni ha na ban dha zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, naha is hanabandhana,

original: 'brel ba yin no zhes skad kyi dbyings las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽aun zhes bya ba ni aud ga ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba yin no zhes skad kyi dbyings las 'byung ba'i phyir ro // aun zhes bya ba ni aud ga ta zhes bya ste /
translated: which means “a connection,” because it occurs in the verbal root dictionary.🔽Una means “without,” because it occurs in the verbal root dictionary.

original: med pa'i don yin pas lhung bzed de 'brel pa med pa'am /
analyzed: med pa'i don yin pas lhung bzed de 'brel pa med pa'am /
translated: That alms bowl is without a connection, or is disconnected, because it is not connected to the monks.

original: 'brel pa dang bral ba yin pas na de'i phyir de'i ming 'brel pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang bral ba yin pas na de'i phyir de'i ming 'brel pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, its name is “without a connection.”

original: de yang dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi yul la 'brel pa ni 'di gnyis kho nar zad de /
analyzed: de yang dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi yul la 'brel pa ni 'di gnyis kho nar zad de /
translated: Moreover, the connection of the monks to the alms bowl is limited to two things:

original: byin gyis brlabs pas bdag nyid kyis spyad ba dang / yongs su spang ba'i dus na yang rang dbang nyid du bstan par bya ba yin no /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pas bdag nyid kyis spyad ba dang / yongs su spang ba'i dus na yang rang dbang nyid du bstan par bya ba yin no /
translated: using it themselves through consecration, and relinquishing it when the time comes.

original: lhung bzed rnam pa de lta bu 'brel ba med pa 'brel pa las 'das pa 'brel ba dang bral ba de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su spang ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed rnam pa de lta bu 'brel ba med pa 'brel pa las 'das pa 'brel ba dang bral ba de ni byin gyis brlab pa'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / yongs su spang ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Such a bowl is unrelated, beyond relation, free of relation, because it is unrelated to the consecration of the bowl and because it is unrelated to the relinquishment of the bowl.

original: de ni lhung bzed kyang yin la 'brel ba med pa yang yin pas na lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lhung bzed kyang yin la 'brel ba med pa yang yin pas na lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a bowl and it is unrelated, thus it is called an unrelated bowl.

original: de ni bran gnam khol du phyung ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ni bran gnam khol du phyung ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like a slave who has been freed.

original: gnam khol du phyung ba yin pa'i phyir bran gyi las su yang mi bsko la bran yin pa'i phyir yongs su gtang bar yang mi nus mod kyi /
analyzed: gnam khol du phyung ba yin pa'i phyir bran gyi las su yang mi bsko la bran yin pa'i phyir yongs su gtang bar yang mi nus mod kyi /
translated: Because he has been freed, he is not appointed to the work of a slave, and because he is a slave, he cannot be released.

original: 'on kyang de la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sbyin par @244a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa sbyin par @244a * //
translated: Nevertheless, he must be given food, drink, and so on.🔽In the same way, this bowl is not to be consecrated,

original: bya dgos pa de bzhin du lhung bzed 'di yang byin gyis brlab par bya ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bya dgos pa de bzhin du lhung bzed 'di yang byin gyis brlab par bya ba yang ma yin la /
translated: and it is not to be relinquished.

original: yongs su spang bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yongs su spang bar bya ba yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is not to be completely abandoned.

original: 'on kyang de la kha bsgyur ba dang / bsreg pa dang / byi dor la sogs pa lhung bzed kyi nan tan yang bya dgos pas de'i phyir lhung bzed de ni bran gnam khol du phyung ba dang 'dra bas 'brel ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la kha bsgyur ba dang / bsreg pa dang / byi dor la sogs pa lhung bzed kyi nan tan yang bya dgos pas de'i phyir lhung bzed de ni bran gnam khol du phyung ba dang 'dra bas 'brel ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: However, one must still make an effort to clean the alms bowl, to polish it, to burn it, and so on. Therefore, that alms bowl is like a slave who is set free, so it is called “unrelated.”

original: 'khod pa'i don du nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'khod pa'i don du nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should make an effort for the sake of the assembly.

original: bskos pa'i dge slong des dge slong rnams 'khod pa'i don du stan gding ba la sogs pa dag gi nan tan bya ba'o //
analyzed: bskos pa'i dge slong des dge slong rnams 'khod pa'i don du stan gding ba la sogs pa dag gi nan tan bya ba'o //
translated: The appointed monk should make an effort to prepare seats and so on for the sake of the assembly of monks.

original: bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should begin praise and offer it.

original: lhung bzed kyi'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is connected to the alms bowl.

original: bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan bsngags pa'o //
translated: Praise means praising good qualities.

original: brtsam zhing zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa brtsam pa ste /
analyzed: brtsam zhing zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa brtsam pa ste /
translated: Begin means to start praising.

original: lhung bzed dbul ba gang la bsngags pa brtsam pa yod pa de ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed dbul ba gang la bsngags pa brtsam pa yod pa de ni /
translated: That which has praise begun is the offering of the alms bowl.

original: bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul ba ste /
analyzed: bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul ba ste /
translated: He should praise it and offer it.

original: dge slong bskos pa des dge slong rgan rims la lhung bzed 'bul ba'i tshe lhung bzed de'i bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong bskos pa des dge slong rgan rims la lhung bzed 'bul ba'i tshe lhung bzed de'i bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya'o //
translated: When the appointed monk offers the alms-bowl to the senior monk, he should praise the qualities of that alms-bowl and offer it.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: dge slong bskos pa des lhung bzed kyi yon tan bsngags pa dang por byas te /
analyzed: dge slong bskos pa des lhung bzed kyi yon tan bsngags pa dang por byas te /
translated: The appointed monk should first praise the qualities of the alms-bowl.

original: dge slong rnams kyi mdun du bzung zhing dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi mdun du bzung zhing dbul bar bya'o //
translated: He should hold it in front of the monks and offer it.

original: bsngags ba rnam pa ji lta bu zhig brjod pas she na /
analyzed: bsngags ba rnam pa ji lta bu zhig brjod pas she na /
translated: What kind of praise should be spoken?

original: de'i phyir gnas brtan lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba dbyibs legs pa longs spyad par bzod pa lags kyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas brtan lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba dbyibs legs pa longs spyad par bzod pa lags kyis /
translated: Therefore, he should say, Elder, this alms-bowl is very clear, well-shaped, and suitable for use.

original: gal te bzhed na snoms shig ces so zhes bya ba smras te /🔽gnas brtan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te bzhed na snoms shig ces so zhes bya ba smras te / gnas brtan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you wish, take it.

original: dge slong rgan rims rnams la bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong rgan rims rnams la bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: Elder is a term of address for senior monks.

original: lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This alms-bowl is very clear means

original: mdog la nag nog med cing shin tu mdzes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mdog la nag nog med cing shin tu mdzes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not discolored and is very beautiful.

original: dbyibs lags pa zhes bya ba ni tshad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs lags pa zhes bya ba ni tshad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Well-proportioned means it is the right size.

original: longs spyad par bzod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: longs spyad par bzod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Suitable for begging means

original: bu gu dang chag grum la sogs pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te bzhed na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu gu dang chag grum la sogs pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir ro // gal te bzhed na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is free of faults such as holes and cracks.🔽If he wishes means

original: gal te len par 'dod na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽snoms shig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te len par 'dod na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // snoms shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: if he desires to receive it.🔽Take it means

original: khyer cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyer cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: carry it.

original: ci lhung bzed thams cad la de skad brjod par bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci lhung bzed thams cad la de skad brjod par bya 'am zhe na /
translated: Should he say this to all who have a begging bowl?

original: de'i phyir yon tan ji lta ba @244b bzhin du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan ji lta ba @244b bzhin du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “In accordance with its good qualities.”

original: lhung bzed gang la yon tan gang dang gang dag yod pa de dang de dag la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed gang la yon tan gang dang gang dag yod pa de dang de dag la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Whatever good qualities a begging bowl has, to that extent it should be praised.

original: shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “very clear” and so on are mentioned in order to illustrate this.

original: 'dod na blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod na blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he wishes, he should take it.

original: dge slong rnams kyis kyang gal te 'dod na lhung bzed de blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis kyang gal te 'dod na lhung bzed de blang bar bya'i /
translated: If the monks wish, they should take that alms-bowl.

original: mi 'dod na ni mi blang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'dod na ni mi blang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If they do not wish, they should not take it.

original: bar du chod pas blangs pa bslang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bar du chod pas blangs pa bslang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is taken by one who is obstructed, it should not be taken.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan la sogs pa ches rgan pas kyang dge slong bskos pa des bdag nyid la bstabs pa'i tshe ma blangs nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan la sogs pa ches rgan pas kyang dge slong bskos pa des bdag nyid la bstabs pa'i tshe ma blangs nas /
translated: If the most senior monk of the saṃgha, the sthavira, and so on, does not take the alms-bowl that is offered to him by the appointed monk,

original: dge slong gcig gis bar du chod pa'i 'og ma dge slong gsum pas lhung bzed de blangs pa na kho bo 'dod do zhes blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis bar du chod pa'i 'og ma dge slong gsum pas lhung bzed de blangs pa na kho bo 'dod do zhes blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: and if the third monk below him, who is obstructed by one monk, takes that alms-bowl, he should not take it, saying, “I wish it.”

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni gal te gnas brtan gsum pas lhung bzed blangs pa na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan slong bar byed na brjod pa dang po la sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni gal te gnas brtan gsum pas lhung bzed blangs pa na dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan slong bar byed na brjod pa dang po la sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: In this way, if the third sthavira takes the alms-bowl, and the most senior monk of the saṃgha requests it, he should not give it to him on the first request.

original: brjod pa gnyis pa la yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa gnyis pa la yang sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not give it to him on the second request either.

original: brjod pa gsum pa la ni sbyin par bya ba ste /
analyzed: brjod pa gsum pa la ni sbyin par bya ba ste /
translated: In the third statement, the alms-food is given.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ni 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis ni 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The elder of the Saṅgha confesses the fault that is a misdeed that violates the Vinaya.

original: du mas bar du chod pa nyid la ni shin tu yang bslang bar mi bya ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //🔽slong ba yod na ni tshig gnyis la ni mi sbyin zhing 'og ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du mas bar du chod pa nyid la ni shin tu yang bslang bar mi bya ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o // slong ba yod na ni tshig gnyis la ni mi sbyin zhing 'og ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is an interruption by many, it should be known that it is not restored at all.🔽If there is a request, it is not given in the first two statements, but it is given in the latter.

original: bar du chod pas blangs pa na gong ma slong ba yod na tshig dang po dang gnyis pa gnyis la ni lhung bzed de mi sbyin no //
analyzed: bar du chod pas blangs pa na gong ma slong ba yod na tshig dang po dang gnyis pa gnyis la ni lhung bzed de mi sbyin no //
translated: If there is a request for the former, the alms-food is not given in the first two statements.

original: 'og ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum pa la lhung bzed de 'drim par byed pa'i dge slong gis sbyin par mi bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'og ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum pa la lhung bzed de 'drim par byed pa'i dge slong gis sbyin par mi bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not given in the latter means that the monk who is distributing the alms-food does not give it in the third statement.

original: ltung ba byung ba la spang bar mi bya ba nyid dang / byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid dag go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ltung ba byung ba la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa de spang bar mi bya ba nyid dang /
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba la spang bar mi bya ba nyid dang / byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid dag go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong ltung ba byung ba la lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa de spang bar mi bya ba nyid dang /
translated: One should understand that a fallen monk should neither discard nor consecrate a related alms bowl.

original: byin gyi brlab par mi bya ba nyid dag go bar bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyi brlab par mi bya ba nyid dag go bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that a fallen monk should neither discard nor consecrate a related alms bowl.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gang gi tshe lhung bzed bsnyigs nas ltung ba byung ba'i dge slong de la sbyin par byed pa na de'i tshe dge slong bskos pa des de la 'og ma 'di gnyis go bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lhung bzed bsnyigs nas ltung ba byung ba'i dge slong de la sbyin par byed pa na de'i tshe dge slong bskos pa des de la 'og ma 'di gnyis go bar bya ste /
translated: When a monk who has fallen from his status gives his alms bowl to another, at that time the appointed monk should make him understand the following two things.

original: lhung bzed 'di khyod kyis byin gyis brlab par yang mi bya la yongs su spang bar yang mi bya @245a * //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'di khyod kyis byin gyis brlab par yang mi bya la yongs su spang bar yang mi bya @245a * //
translated: This alms bowl should neither be consecrated nor discarded by you.

original: ste ; lhung bzed 'di ni byin gyis brlab pas bdag nyid kyis spyad pa dang 'brel ba dang yongs su spang ba'i dus na rang dbang nyid du bstan pa'i 'brel ba med pa yin pas khyod kyis deng phyin chad nas nam ma chag gi bar du chong shig ces kyang
analyzed: ste ; lhung bzed 'di ni byin gyis brlab pas bdag nyid kyis spyad pa dang 'brel ba dang yongs su spang ba'i dus na rang dbang nyid du bstan pa'i 'brel ba med pa yin pas khyod kyis deng phyin chad nas nam ma chag gi bar du chong shig ces kyang
translated: Since this begging bowl is consecrated, it is not related to your use of it, and when it is time to give it up, it is not related to your display of independence. Therefore, from now on until the end of time, you should keep it.🔽🔽

original: bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: And, This alms bowl is consecrated, so you should not use it yourself, nor should you give it away. Since it is not to be used, you should keep it from now until it breaks.

original: nye bar spyod pa la ma chag gi bar du dal bu dal bus spyod cig ces so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa la ma chag gi bar du dal bu dal bus spyod cig ces so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And, You should use the requisites until they break.

original: lhung bzed de nye bar spyod pa ltung ba 'byung ba'i dge slong la dge slong bskos pa des 'di skad ces lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'di ma chag gi bar du dal bu dal bus spyod cig ces kyang bsgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed de nye bar spyod pa ltung ba 'byung ba'i dge slong la dge slong bskos pa des 'di skad ces lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'di ma chag gi bar du dal bu dal bus spyod cig ces kyang bsgo bar bya ste /
translated: The monk who has been appointed to deal with the monk who has incurred the downfall of using the alms bowl should tell him, You should not use this alms bowl that is not to be used until it breaks.

original: khad kyis dal bu dal bus spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khad kyis dal bu dal bus spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he should use it gradually, little by little.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nam chag pa'i mthar thug gi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nam chag pa'i mthar thug gi bar du'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, until it breaks.

original: des gnyi gas kun du spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des gnyi gas kun du spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Both of them should use it” means

original: lhung ba byung ba'i dge slong des lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gnyi gas kun du spyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhung ba byung ba'i dge slong des lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa dang / lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa gnyi gas kun du spyad par bya ba'o //
translated: that the monk who has the offense should consecrate the alms bowl, and both of them should use the alms bowl that is not connected.

original: de la yod byad ches bzang po nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yod byad ches bzang po nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should definitely apply the best articles to it” means

original: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa de la lhung bzed kyi snod dang / kha g-yogs la sogs yo byad ches bzang po ches mdzes pa nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa de la lhung bzed kyi snod dang / kha g-yogs la sogs yo byad ches bzang po ches mdzes pa nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: that he should definitely apply the best articles, the best looking articles such as a bowl for the alms bowl and a cover for the alms bowl, to the alms bowl that is not connected.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa de la lhung bzed kyi snod la sogs pa yo byad ches bzang po shos nges par sbyar bar bya zhing lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa de la lhung bzed kyi snod la sogs pa yo byad ches bzang po shos nges par sbyar bar bya zhing lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: He should definitely apply the best articles to the alms bowl that is not connected, but not to the consecrated alms bowl.

original: spyad pa na ches yang ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms blang ba la sogs pa spyad pa na phye la sogs pa'i don ches yang ba lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa der nges par sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: spyad pa na ches yang ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms blang ba la sogs pa spyad pa na phye la sogs pa'i don ches yang ba lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa der nges par sbyar bar bya /
translated: When using it, the lighter one is used first.🔽When using it, when collecting alms and so on, the lighter one, such as flour, is definitely used first in the bowl that is not consecrated.

original: blugs par bya zhing ches lci ba lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa shos su nges par sbyar bar bya blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: blugs par bya zhing ches lci ba lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa shos su nges par sbyar bar bya blugs par bya'o //
translated: The heavier one is definitely used later in the consecrated bowl.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'i dus zas la sogs pa nye bar gnas par gyur pa na lhung bzed 'brel pa med pas /
analyzed: bya ba la nges par sbyar ba'i dus zas la sogs pa nye bar gnas par gyur pa na lhung bzed 'brel pa med pas /
translated: When the time for using it has arrived, such as for eating, the bowl that is not consecrated is used first.

original: las ches yang ba zhes bya zhing cig shos kyis las ches lci ba bya'o //🔽zas kyi bya ba nyid la ni mi bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni zas bza' ba'i bya ba bsgrub pa nyid la ni lhung bzed 'brel pa med pas /
analyzed: las ches yang ba zhes bya zhing cig shos kyis las ches lci ba bya'o // zas kyi bya ba nyid la ni mi bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni zas bza' ba'i bya ba bsgrub pa nyid la ni lhung bzed 'brel pa med pas /
translated: The other one is used later for the heavier action.🔽But when the action of eating is being done, the bowl that is not consecrated should not be used at all.

original: nges par sbyar bar mi bya ba kho na ste /
analyzed: nges par sbyar bar mi bya ba kho na ste /
translated: It should not be used at all for the action of eating.

original: de'i nang nas zas bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i nang nas zas bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: one should not eat food from that.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: lhung @245b bzed 'brel pa med par zas bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhung @245b bzed 'brel pa med par zas bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat food with a bowl that is not joined.

original: byi dor yang dang por bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha zas 'bags pa'i dril phyi la sogs pa'i byi dor yang dang por lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa la nges par sbyar bar bya zhing phyis byin gyis brlabs pa shos la bya ba'o //
analyzed: byi dor yang dang por bya'o zhes bya ba ni kha zas 'bags pa'i dril phyi la sogs pa'i byi dor yang dang por lhung bzed 'brel ba med pa la nges par sbyar bar bya zhing phyis byin gyis brlabs pa shos la bya ba'o //
translated: First, one should clean it: first, one should apply oneself to cleaning a bowl that is not joined, such as a bowl that is stained with the smell of food, and then one should do it to the one that has been consecrated.

original: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The prohibition against seeking a bowl has been explained.

original: // / ji zhig lhag par spyad na 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ji zhig lhag par spyad na 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the excess that is to be practiced that would become a prohibition against having it woven?

original: de'i phyir rin med par bsko bas sam gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu 'jug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rin med par bsko bas sam gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu 'jug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “If one has it woven without pay, or if another has it woven,”

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa zhes sngar bstan pa de gnyis kyi rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa zhes sngar bstan pa de gnyis kyi rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: and the two that were previously taught, “a householder who is not a relative,” are to be applied after that.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words here is as follows.

original: tha ga ba khyim pa nye du ma yin pa la rin med par ngag gi bsgo pas sam pho nya la sogs pa gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu bcug na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha ga ba khyim pa nye du ma yin pa la rin med par ngag gi bsgo pas sam pho nya la sogs pa gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu bcug na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a householder weaver who is not a relative is caused to weave cloth without wages, either by the monk himself or by another such as a messenger, then a downfall is incurred.

original: 'di ltar so so thar pa'i mdo las rang gis bslangs pa'i dog pa zhes gsungs mod kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar so so thar pa'i mdo las rang gis bslangs pa'i dog pa zhes gsungs mod kyis /
translated: Although the Sūtra of Individual Liberation states, “Cloth that one has requested,”

original: 'dir ni rang gis bslangs pa nyid khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni rang gis bslangs pa nyid khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: here one should not accept that it is cloth that one has requested.

original: der gsungs pa ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: der gsungs pa ni gleng gzhi'i dbang gis so //
translated: That is stated in the Sūtra of Individual Liberation from the perspective of the nidāna introduction.🔽Also, other sūtras state:

original: gzhan las kyang dge slong gis nye du las dog pa bslangs nas thag pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug na slong ba de la ni ltung ba med la /
analyzed: gzhan las kyang dge slong gis nye du las dog pa bslangs nas thag pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug na slong ba de la ni ltung ba med la /
translated: If a monk requests cloth from a relative and causes a nonrelative weaver to weave it, then there is no downfall for the one who requests it.

original: tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu 'jug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir 'dir dog pa slong ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu 'jug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir 'dir dog pa slong ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi'i rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If one asks a non-relative weaver to weave cloth, one commits a downfall.🔽Therefore, in this case, asking for cloth is not the basis of a root downfall.

original: 'di ltar 'thag tu 'jug pa ni de'i rgyu yin no //🔽'thag tu 'jug pa de yang lan 'ga' tha ga pa khyim pa nye du ma yin pas 'grub pa yang yod ;
analyzed: 'di ltar 'thag tu 'jug pa ni de'i rgyu yin no // 'thag tu 'jug pa de yang lan 'ga' tha ga pa khyim pa nye du ma yin pas 'grub pa yang yod ;
translated: The basis of a root downfall is asking a weaver to weave cloth.🔽Sometimes, a non-relative weaver completes the weaving.

original: lan 'ga' nye du dang nye du ma yin pa gnyi gas cig char 'grub pa yang yod /
analyzed: lan 'ga' nye du dang nye du ma yin pa gnyi gas cig char 'grub pa yang yod /
translated: Sometimes, both a relative and a non-relative weaver complete the weaving.🔽Sometimes, both a lay person and a monastic complete the weaving.
