original: lan 'ga' khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba gnyi gas cig car 'grub pa yang yod pas 'di ltar de dag thams cad dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lan 'ga' khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba gnyi gas cig car 'grub pa yang yod pas 'di ltar de dag thams cad dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that all of these are the basis of a root downfall,

original: gzhan nyid dang bcas pa la ni de ma byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang bcas pa la ni de ma byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that if the weaver is not a relative, the downfall is not averted.

original: 'di ltar nye du dang nye du ma yin pa gzhan nyid bcas pa la 'thag tu bcug na de lta na yang 'thag tu bcug pa de tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa des ma byas pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye du dang nye du ma yin pa gzhan nyid bcas pa la 'thag tu bcug na de lta na yang 'thag tu bcug pa de tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa des ma byas pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Thus, if one has a relative or a non-relative spin wool, then even though one has had it spun, it is not the case that the non-relative who spun it did not do it.

original: 'di ltar byas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de lta bas na nye du @246a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de lta bas na nye du @246a * //
translated: It is just that it was done.

original: dang nye du ma yin pa gnyi ga la 'thag tu bcug na yang nye du'i phyir na ltung ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: dang nye du ma yin pa gnyi ga la 'thag tu bcug na yang nye du'i phyir na ltung ba med mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, even if one has both a relative and a non-relative spin, there is no offense due to the relative.

original: nye du ma yin pa'i dbang gis nye du ma yin pa spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa'i dbang gis nye du ma yin pa spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: But due to the non-relative, there is an offense of abandoning the non-relative.

original: bdag nyid dang nye du ma yin par bcas pas 'thag na yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid dang nye du ma yin par bcas pas 'thag na yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: If one has both oneself and a non-relative spin, it is the same.

original: bdag nyid kyis 'thag pas nyes byas su gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bzo mi bya ba'i spyir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis 'thag pas nyes byas su gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bzo mi bya ba'i spyir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is said to be a minor offense for spinning oneself is a general statement about not doing crafts.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bzo rjes su bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bzo rjes su bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here the text says, “One should not practice crafts.”

original: de ni spang ba dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni spang ba dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not related to the abandonment.

original: de bzhin du rin byin pa dang ma byin pa gnyi ga la 'thag tu bcug na yang rin byin pa'i phyir ni ltung ba med kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rin byin pa dang ma byin pa gnyi ga la 'thag tu bcug na yang rin byin pa'i phyir ni ltung ba med kyi /
translated: Similarly, if one causes weaving to be done for both those who have paid the price and those who have not, there is no offense because the price has been paid.

original: rin ma byin pa'i dbang gis spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rin ma byin pa'i dbang gis spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: But because the price has not been paid, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhan nyid dang bcas pas byas pa nyid yin du zin kyang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang bcas pas byas pa nyid yin du zin kyang der 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it is done by another person, it is still so.

original: 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The abandonment of causing weaving to be done has been explained.

original: // / da ni 'thag pa bskyed pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: // / da ni 'thag pa bskyed pa'i spang ba brjod par bya ste ;
translated: Now the abandonment of causing weaving to be set up should be stated.

original: de la yang yan lag gang dag byed pa por 'gyur ba de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang yan lag gang dag byed pa por 'gyur ba de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And in that regard, in order to show which factors become the agent,

original: de'i phyir btag par bya ba bsam pa las byung ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btag par bya ba bsam pa las byung ba nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “The thought of what is to be woven arises for that reason.”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dge slong de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dge slong de'i phyir ro //
translated: “For that reason” means for the monk who commits the offense.

original: btag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gos so //
analyzed: btag par bya ba zhes bya ba ni gos so //
translated: “What is to be woven” means cloth.

original: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni gos 'di de la sbyin no snyam pa'i bsam pa ste /

translated: “Oh, if I were to go there, then that cloth would be very beautiful for me.”

original: 'on kyang gos la tha dad par dbye ba'i phyir dang / sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir 'tshol bar mi byed na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba ste /🔽de yang sbyor ba @248a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang gos la tha dad par dbye ba'i phyir dang / sna tshogs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / shin tu mdzes pa nyid kyi phyir 'tshol bar mi byed na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba ste / de yang sbyor ba @248a * //
translated: Even though he goes there with that thought, if he does not make it his own by dividing it into parts, or by making it variegated, or by making it very beautiful, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: las byung ba'i nyes byas yin no //
analyzed: las byung ba'i nyes byas yin no //
translated: This is an offense that arises from preparation.

original: 'thag pa bskyed pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'thag pa bskyed pa'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The prohibition of spinning thread has been explained.

original: // /'phrog pa'i spang ba la yan lag gang dag byed pa po dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: // /'phrog pa'i spang ba la yan lag gang dag byed pa po dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the branches of the prohibition of stealing?

original: de'i phyir dbral bar bya ba dge slong nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbral bar bya ba dge slong nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The monk who is to be robbed is the basis.”

original: dbral bar bya ba gang las gos 'phrog par bya ba de dge slong nyid yin na yan lag yin no //
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba gang las gos 'phrog par bya ba de dge slong nyid yin na yan lag yin no //
translated: If the monk from whom the robe is to be stolen is a monk, he is a basis.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gang las gos 'phrog par bya ba de gal te dge slong yin te /
analyzed: gang las gos 'phrog par bya ba de gal te dge slong yin te /
translated: If the monk from whom the robe is to be stolen is a monk,

original: gal te gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ci bdag nyid kyi kho na phrogs na kha na ma tho 'di nyid du 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ci bdag nyid kyi kho na phrogs na kha na ma tho 'di nyid du 'gyur ram /
translated: if he is fully ordained by the rite of the four requests, that is the meaning.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi zhe na /
translated: Does this offense apply only when one steals for oneself, or also when one steals for another?

original: de'i phyir dbrog par bya ba rang gi nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbrog par bya ba rang gi nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The one to be robbed is not oneself.”

original: dbrog par bya ba'i gos rang gi nyid ma yin na ltung ba'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: dbrog par bya ba'i gos rang gi nyid ma yin na ltung ba'i yan lag yin no //
translated: If the robe to be stolen is not his own, it is a branch of a downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gos gang yang rung ba dbrog par bya ba de gal te gzhan gyis byin pa yin nam rang gis ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis byin pa yin la /
analyzed: gos gang yang rung ba dbrog par bya ba de gal te gzhan gyis byin pa yin nam rang gis ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis byin pa yin la /
translated: If the robe to be stolen is given by another or given by oneself without regard,

original: de phrogs na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phrogs na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: then stealing it is a downfall.

original: 'o na gtsug lag las rang gis byin pa kho na yan lag tu gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na gtsug lag las rang gis byin pa kho na yan lag tu gsungs te /
translated: But the scriptures state that only that given by oneself is a branch of a downfall.

original: yang dge slong gang gis dge slong la gos byin nas zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang gis dge slong la gos byin nas zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: The scriptures state, “If a bhikṣu gives a robe to a bhikṣu. ”

original: bden mod kyi /
analyzed: bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true,

original: 'on kyang gleng gzhi'i dbang gis de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gleng gzhi'i dbang gis de skad gsungs te /
translated: but it is stated in that way because of the context.

original: 'di ltar rang gis byin pa phrogs na nyes par 'gyur ba las na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gis byin pa phrogs na nyes par 'gyur ba las na /
translated: Since stealing what is given by oneself is a downfall,

original: gzhan gyis byin pa phrogs na lta ches nyes par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin pa phrogs na lta ches nyes par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that stealing what is given by another is a much worse downfall.

original: de ltar yang dge slong gang dge slong la gos byin nas de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngams par gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong gang dge slong la gos byin nas de'i 'og tu khros 'khrugs rngams par gyur te /
translated: So too, if a monk gives a robe to a monk and then, angry and displeased,

original: yi ma rangs nas 'phrog gam 'phrog tu bcug cing /
analyzed: yi ma rangs nas 'phrog gam 'phrog tu bcug cing /
translated: takes it back or has it taken back,

original: ji tsam du gos kyi grva lus las bral bar byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam du gos kyi grva lus las bral bar byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: then for as long as he keeps the edge of the robe away from his body, he commits a minor offense.

original: kha na ma tho ba 'di rku sems med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba 'di rku sems med pa yin gyi /
translated: This offense is not due to a thought to steal.

original: rku sems yod na ni ma byin par len par gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku sems yod na ni ma byin par len par gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were due to a thought to steal, it would be included in the offense of taking what is not given.

original: de gos nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gos nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is a robe.

original: dbrog par bya ba de gos nyid yin na ltung ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbrog par bya ba de gos nyid yin na ltung ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the thing to be taken is a robe, it becomes a branch of a downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: gal te dbrog par bya ba'i dngos po de gos nyid yin na ltung ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbrog par bya ba'i dngos po de gos nyid yin na ltung ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If the thing to be taken is a robe, it becomes a branch of a downfall.

original: 'dir gos zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir gos zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: Here, the word “robe” is a synecdoche.

original: dge slong gi yo byad gzhan yang phrogs na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma @248b tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi yo byad gzhan yang phrogs na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma @248b tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one steals other articles of a fully ordained monk, one commits a root downfall.

original: de'i 'am des bsgos pa'i lus dang ngag bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: de'i 'am des bsgos pa'i lus dang ngag bsdus pa'am /
translated: The body and speech of that person or of another person who is directed by him🔽are included or are separate.

original: tha dad pa dag gis dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag gis dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who engage in the act of stealing are the agents.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i 'o //
translated: That person refers to the one who causes the downfall.

original: des bskos pa'i zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa des bskos pa'i'o //
analyzed: des bskos pa'i zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa des bskos pa'i'o //
translated: Directed by him refers to the one who is directed by the one who causes the downfall.

original: lus dang ngag bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang ngag bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The body and speech are included.

original: lus dang ngag gnyi ga bsdus pas dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gnyi ga bsdus pas dbrog pa'i don du zhugs pa'o //
translated: The body and speech are included in the act of stealing.

original: tha dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni /🔽lus kyang tha dad par zhugs la /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni / lus kyang tha dad par zhugs la /
translated: Separate refers to

original: ngag kyang tha dad par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: ngag kyang tha dad par zhugs pa ste /
translated: the body and speech being separate.

original: 'on kyang ltung ba ni gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang ltung ba ni gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the downfall is the same.

original: lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lta bu ni byed pa po dag yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who engage in the act of stealing are the agents.

original: yan lag de lta bu dag ni byed pa po dag yin no //
analyzed: yan lag de lta bu dag ni byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: These members are the agents.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i lus dang ngag dag gis cig car dbrog pa'i phyir bya ba byed dam rim gyis byed du bcug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gal te ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i lus dang ngag dag gis cig car dbrog pa'i phyir bya ba byed dam rim gyis byed du bcug kyang rung ste /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: ltung ba gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one causes a downfall to occur simultaneously by means of body and speech, or if one causes it to occur gradually, there is only one downfall.

original: gzhan la bcol bas kyang de dang 'dra'o //🔽gang gi phyir rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa la bye brag med pa de'i phyir rang gi lus dang ngag bsdus pas byas sam /
analyzed: gzhan la bcol bas kyang de dang 'dra'o // gang gi phyir rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan byed du bcug pa la bye brag med pa de'i phyir rang gi lus dang ngag bsdus pas byas sam /
translated: The same is true if one orders another to do it.🔽Since there is no distinction between doing it oneself and ordering another to do it, the members are included in body and speech.

original: gzhan byed du bcug na yang yan lag nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan byed du bcug na yang yan lag nyid yin te /
translated: Whether one does it oneself or orders another to do it, it is a member.

original: de'i phyir yan lag de dag ni byed pa po dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag de dag ni byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: Therefore, these members are the agents.

original: gnas skabs gang la yan lag de dag kha na ma tho ba gang gi byed pa po dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la yan lag de dag kha na ma tho ba gang gi byed pa po dag yin zhe na /
translated: In what state are these members the agents of a downfall?

original: de'i phyir lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa mthar thug pa na mtha'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa mthar thug pa na mtha'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The final state is the ultimate.”

original: 'dir dbral bar bya ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de'i lus las chos gos la sogs pa rang gi nyid ma yin pa tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa zhes bya ba tha dad par byas par gyur pa'i mthar thug pa na zhes bya ba mthar thug par
analyzed: 'dir dbral bar bya ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de'i lus las chos gos la sogs pa rang gi nyid ma yin pa tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa zhes bya ba tha dad par byas par gyur pa'i mthar thug pa na zhes bya ba mthar thug par
translated: Here, when the monk who is to be separated from his robes and so on has made them into a separate thing called “a different entity” from his body, at the end of making them separate,

original: gyur pa'i dus na mtha'i zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po dag yin no //
analyzed: gyur pa'i dus na mtha'i zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: at the time of the end, the end is the agent of the basic downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te dge slong gis dge slong las gzhan gyis byin pa'i gos rang ngam /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gal te dge slong gis dge slong las gzhan gyis byin pa'i gos rang ngam /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dag gis cig car ram rim gyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dag gis cig car ram rim gyis kyang rung ste /
translated: If a monk steals robes given by someone other than a monk, either for himself or for someone else, either simultaneously or sequentially,

original: 'phrog par byed cing lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i mthar thug pa'i dus na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phrog par byed cing lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa'i mthar thug pa'i dus na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and at the time of the end when they become a different entity from his body, it is a basic downfall.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the preparation, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yan lag de dag sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la ni nyes byas kyi byed pa po dag @249a * //
analyzed: yan lag de dag sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la ni nyes byas kyi byed pa po dag @249a * //
translated: The agents of the misdeed are those who are engaged in the process of applying the limbs.

original: yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the above passage.

original: de ni phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is to be returned to the owner.

original: gos phrogs pa de ni bdag po de la phyir sbyin bar bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: gos phrogs pa de ni bdag po de la phyir sbyin bar bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The stolen robe is to be returned to the owner.

original: de skad bstan te /
analyzed: de skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: phrogs pa'i gos gang yin pa de yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phrogs pa'i gos gang yin pa de yongs su longs spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: The robe that was stolen should not be used.

original: ji ste yongs su spyad par gyur na yang de'i lhag ma yod pa gang yin pa de la phyir sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ste yongs su spyad par gyur na yang de'i lhag ma yod pa gang yin pa de la phyir sbyin par bya ste /
translated: But if it has been used, then whatever remains of it should be returned.

original: ji srid du mi sbyin pa de srid du ltung ba bshags su mi rung po //
analyzed: ji srid du mi sbyin pa de srid du ltung ba bshags su mi rung po //
translated: As long as it is not returned, the downfall is not confessed.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des gos de'i lhag ma yod pa phyir sbyin bar bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des gos de'i lhag ma yod pa phyir sbyin bar bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the text here states that the monk should return whatever remains of the robe.

original: 'di la rang gi don nyid ni yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la rang gi don nyid ni yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the purpose is not a limb.

original: gzhan la 'phrog pa 'di la rang gi don nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la 'phrog pa 'di la rang gi don nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
translated: In this, stealing from others, one's own aim is not a branch.

original: byed rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a causal process.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gos 'phrog pa 'di la dge slong gis rang gi don nyid du ltung ba'i byed rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gos 'phrog pa 'di la dge slong gis rang gi don nyid du ltung ba'i byed rgyu ma yin te /
translated: In this stealing of robes, for a monk, one's own aim is not a causal process for a downfall.

original: des na gzhan gyi don gyi phyir tshig gis kyang 'phrog na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don gyi phyir tshig gis kyang 'phrog na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one steals by word even for the sake of another, it becomes a root downfall.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ni skrod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽dper na gtsug lag khang nas dge slong ma la sogs pa dge slong ngam /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ni skrod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni / dper na gtsug lag khang nas dge slong ma la sogs pa dge slong ngam /
translated: In regard to one who is not fully ordained, it is like expulsion.

original: dge slong ma 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'am /
translated: For example, if a fully ordained monk or nun expels a nun or a novice monk from a monastery,🔽or if a fully ordained nun expels a novice nun from a monastery,

original: dge slob ma la sogs pas skrong par byed pa nyes byas su gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du dge slong dang dge slong ma dag dge slob ma la sogs bas skrod par byed pa yang nyes byas su gsungs pa dang 'dra bar 'phrog pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ni nyes byas su rnam par gzhag par🔽rig par bya'o //🔽de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni dge tshul la sogs pa'i 'phrog pa nyid la gzhung ni dge slob ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul mas ni nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slob ma la sogs pas skrong par byed pa nyes byas su gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du dge slong dang dge slong ma dag dge slob ma la sogs bas skrod par byed pa yang nyes byas su gsungs pa dang 'dra bar 'phrog pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la yang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ni nyes byas su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o // de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni dge tshul la sogs pa'i 'phrog pa nyid la gzhung ni dge slob ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul mas ni nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, it should be understood that if a probationary nun and so on expels a fully ordained monk, it is a minor offense.🔽Thus, the text states:🔽If a novice and so on steals, it is a minor offense.

original: khyim pa dang khyim pa mos ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa dang khyim pa mos ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a layperson or layperson steals, it is a great offense.

original: 'phrog pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'phrog pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Stealing is of three types:

original: rang gi nyid sel bar 'gyur ba dang / blo gros ngan pas byas pa dang / rigs pa'i don gyi dbang gis byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi nyid sel bar 'gyur ba dang / blo gros ngan pas byas pa dang / rigs pa'i don gyi dbang gis byas pa'o //
translated: It is done by one’s own self, it is done by a bad mind, and it is done by the power of the meaning of reasoning.

original: de la rang gi nyid sel bar gyur ba kho na 'phrog pa'i ltung ba'i byed pa po yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rang gi nyid sel bar gyur ba kho na 'phrog pa'i ltung ba'i byed pa po yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the one who commits the downfall of stealing is only one’s own self,

original: rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa'i 'phrog pa 'dir bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa'i 'phrog pa 'dir bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said that “this stealing by one’s own self is included here.”

original: rang gi nyid kyi sel ba 'dir rang gi nyid sel ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi nyid kyi sel ba 'dir rang gi nyid sel ba'o //
translated: Stealing by one’s own self is stealing by oneself.

original: @249b der gyur pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur ba'i 'phrog pa ste /
analyzed: @249b der gyur pa ni de'i ngo bo nyid du gyur ba'i 'phrog pa ste /
translated: Stealing that is so is stealing that has that nature.

original: de bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: That should be known as included in this training precept,

original: gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin no //
translated: but not others.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: 'phrog pa rnam pa gsum las rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i 'phrog pa gcig bu kho na las kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'phrog pa rnam pa gsum las rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i 'phrog pa gcig bu kho na las kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur la /
translated: From among the three types of stealing, only one type of stealing, called “by one’s own self,” is the basis for this downfall.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so //
translated: For the preparatory stage, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong khyod la gos mi sbyin gyi phyir byin cig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong khyod la gos mi sbyin gyi phyir byin cig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, “Monks, you should not give away your robes, so do not give them away.”

original: 'phrog pa lhag ma gnyis po dag gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'phrog pa lhag ma gnyis po dag gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The nature of the remaining two types of theft is taught.

original: de la re zhig blo gros ngan pas byas pa'i 'phrog pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig blo gros ngan pas byas pa'i 'phrog pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: With regard to that, in order to teach the nature of theft that is done by someone with an evil mind,

original: blo gros ngan pas byas pa ni rjes su 'phrog pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /🔽blo gros ngan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blo gros ngan pas byas pa ni rjes su 'phrog pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te / blo gros ngan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it says, “Theft that is done by someone with an evil mind is the act of stealing.”

original: blo gros bzang po ma yin pa blo gros mi mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros bzang po ma yin pa blo gros mi mdzes pa ste /
translated: Someone with an evil mind is someone who does not have a good mind, someone who has an ugly mind.

original: des byas pa'i 'phrog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des byas pa'i 'phrog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The theft that is done by someone with an evil mind is like this:🔽“May he be disappointed! May he be ridiculed! May he be harmed! May his power be revealed!”

original: yi chad par gyur cig / co dris par gyur cig / gnod par gyur cig / mthu bstan par gyur cig / ces de lta bus dbrog par byas nas phyir sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yi chad par gyur cig / co dris par gyur cig / gnod par gyur cig / mthu bstan par gyur cig / ces de lta bus dbrog par byas nas phyir sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Having stolen in this way, he will give it back.

original: blo gros ngan pa des dbrog par byed pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su 'phrog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: blo gros ngan pa des dbrog par byed pa gang yin pa de ni rjes su 'phrog pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which is taken by one of evil mind is only a theft.

original: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi nyes byas yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi nyes byas yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a misdeed that is compatible with the root downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what it teaches.

original: gal te rgod pa'i bsam pas dus cung zad tsam zhig sems gdung bar bya'o snyam nas chos gos la sogs pa 'phrog par byed na 'phrog pa de yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rgod pa'i bsam pas dus cung zad tsam zhig sems gdung bar bya'o snyam nas chos gos la sogs pa 'phrog par byed na 'phrog pa de yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If one thinks, “I will torment my mind for a little while with the thought of agitation,” and then takes the robes, etc., that theft is a misdeed that is not complete.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one is in the process of preparing to steal, it is a minor offense.

original: rigs pa'i don gyi dbang gis byas pa'i 'phrog pa la ni nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pa'i don gyi dbang gis byas pa'i 'phrog pa la ni nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that there is no offense if one takes by the power of reasoning,

original: gnod pa dang mi phan par byed pa la 'jug pa'i bgegs bya ba'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnod pa dang mi phan par byed pa la 'jug pa'i bgegs bya ba'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it says, “There is no offense if one does it in order to stop harm and injury.”

original: gnod pa byed pa'i phyir gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i phyir gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: “Harm” is that which causes harm.

original: gnod pa ni tshe 'di'i lus la gnod bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa ni tshe 'di'i lus la gnod bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Harm is the harm to the body in this life.

original: mi phan pa byed pa'i phyir mi phan pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi phan pa byed pa'i phyir mi phan pa byed pa ste /
translated: Because of doing what is not beneficial, there is doing what is not beneficial.

original: mi phan pa ni 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'byin pa'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: mi phan pa ni 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'byin pa'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: What is not beneficial is the afflicted mind that produces an undesirable result in the next world.

original: de ltar gnod pa byed pa dang / mi phan pa byed pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa'i 'jug pa de'i bgegs bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba bar chad bya ba'i phyir chos gos la sogs pa 'phrog pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar gnod pa byed pa dang / mi phan pa byed pa la 'jug pa gang yin pa'i 'jug pa de'i bgegs bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba bar chad bya ba'i phyir chos gos la sogs pa 'phrog pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Thus, in order to obstruct the engagement of that engagement which is the engagement in doing harm and doing what is not beneficial, there is no offense in taking away the Dharma robes and so on in order to create an obstacle.

original: @250a * // 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: @250a * // 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: rkun po dang / chu klung dang / stag gi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa'i nang du 'jug pa dang / sdig pa dang sten cing 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'byin pa la sogs pa mi phan pa byed pa la 'jug pa'i bgegs bya zhing bar chad bya ba'i phyir chos gos la sogs pa 'phrog par byed na de la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rkun po dang / chu klung dang / stag gi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gnod pa byed pa'i nang du 'jug pa dang / sdig pa dang sten cing 'bras bu mi 'dod pa 'byin pa la sogs pa mi phan pa byed pa la 'jug pa'i bgegs bya zhing bar chad bya ba'i phyir chos gos la sogs pa 'phrog par byed na de la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If one enters a place where there is danger from thieves, rivers, tigers, and so on, or if one enters to help someone who is committing negative actions and producing unwanted results, then there is no offense in stealing the Dharma robes and so on in order to obstruct and interrupt that.🔽Thus, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni don gzhan dang 'dul ba'i yo byad kyi phyir ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni don gzhan dang 'dul ba'i yo byad kyi phyir ni ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no offense if one steals in order to give to the Sangha or to benefit others.

original: ji ltar don gzhan gyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan gyis she na /
translated: How is it for another purpose?

original: 'di lta ste slob dpon dang mkhan po'i lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su dus ma yin pa dang / chu klung gi kha'am yur bo che'i khar 'gro ba de dag la slob dpon dang mkhan pos chom rkun dang g-yon can dag gis gos 'phrog par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste slob dpon dang mkhan po'i lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su dus ma yin pa dang / chu klung gi kha'am yur bo che'i khar 'gro ba de dag la slob dpon dang mkhan pos chom rkun dang g-yon can dag gis gos 'phrog par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug ba lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, when the disciples and students of a master or preceptor go to an uninhabited place, or to a riverbank or a canal bank at the wrong time, the master or preceptor thinks, “It is not right for thieves or rogues to steal their clothes,” and either steals them or has them stolen.

original: ji ltar 'dul ba'i yo byad kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul ba'i yo byad kyis she na /
translated: How is it by means of the requisites of training?

original: 'di lta ste dge slong rnams kyis lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag sdig pa'i grogs po dang / sdig pa'i zla bo dang / sdig pa'i bsten grogs dang / lhan cag sdig pa bsten cing lam du 'gro bar gyur na de dag la mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis 'di dag sdig pa'i grogs po dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge slong rnams kyis lhan cig gnas pa dang / nye gnas dag sdig pa'i grogs po dang / sdig pa'i zla bo dang / sdig pa'i bsten grogs dang / lhan cag sdig pa bsten cing lam du 'gro bar gyur na de dag la mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis 'di dag sdig pa'i grogs po dang /
translated: For example, when the disciples and students of a master or preceptor go to an uninhabited place, or to a riverbank or a canal bank at the wrong time, the master or preceptor thinks, “It is not right for them to go with evil friends,

original: sdig ba'i zla po dang / sdig pa'i bsten grogs la bsnyen par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas gos dag 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug ba lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig ba'i zla po dang / sdig pa'i bsten grogs la bsnyen par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas gos dag 'phrog gam 'phrog tu 'jug ba lta bu'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that it is not suitable to rely on a companion in negative actions or a friend who encourages negative actions, and thus one seizes or causes another to seize their clothing.

original: 'phrog ba'i spang pa'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'phrog ba'i spang pa'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The term “abandonment through seizure” has already been explained.🔽Thus the separation of the discipline of individual liberation states:

original: // /'di ltar so sor thar pa dang rnam par 'byed pa las 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i 'og tu brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba 'byung mod kye /
analyzed: // /'di ltar so sor thar pa dang rnam par 'byed pa las 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i 'og tu brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba 'byung mod kye /
translated: “Abandonment through seizure is followed by abandonment through demand.”

original: zhu ba las 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i 'og tu zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba 'byung bas zhu ba'i gzhung bas blangs te /
analyzed: zhu ba las 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i 'og tu zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba 'byung bas zhu ba'i gzhung bas blangs te /
translated: Abandonment through seizure is followed by abandonment through separation after seven days.

original: go rims kyi gnas ma yin par zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba nyid nye bar gzhag nas dus gzhan gyi rgyu las byung ba'i ltung ba dag skabs gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: go rims kyi gnas ma yin par zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba nyid nye bar gzhag nas dus gzhan gyi rgyu las byung ba'i ltung ba dag skabs gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the order of the topics is not correct because abandonment through separation is presented after abandonment through seizure, and then the downfalls that arise from other causes are presented in one section.

original: dgon pa ba'i chos gos gcig la ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na grong yang rang gi gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgon pa ba'i chos gos gcig la ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na grong yang rang gi gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If a monk in the wilderness has only one robe, and his dwelling place is dangerous, then the village is also like his dwelling place.

original: dge slong dgon pa ba'i chos gos gcig la ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa ba'i chos gos gcig la ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a monk in the wilderness has only one robe means

original: chos gos gsum @250b las gang yang rung ba cig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gos gsum @250b las gang yang rung ba cig gi phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of any one of the three robes.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is dangerous means

original: dge slong dgon pa pa'i rang gi gnas dgon pa de rkun po la sogs pa dag gi 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na'o //🔽grong yang zhes bya ba dgon pa de'i spyod yul du gyur ba'i grong gang yin pa yang ngo ;
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pa'i rang gi gnas dgon pa de rkun po la sogs pa dag gi 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na'o // grong yang zhes bya ba dgon pa de'i spyod yul du gyur ba'i grong gang yin pa yang ngo ;
translated: if the wilderness dwelling place of the monk in the wilderness is dangerous due to thieves and so on.🔽The village is also like his dwelling place means

original: / rang gi gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / rang gi gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the village that is the domain of that wilderness is also like that.

original: dge slong dgon pa pa rang gi gnas dgon pa ba dang 'dra bar shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pa rang gi gnas dgon pa ba dang 'dra bar shes par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be understood that the monk in the wilderness is like his own dwelling place in the wilderness.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: ji ltar dge slong dgon pa ba'i rang gi gnas na 'dug pa'i chos gos las 'bral ba'i nyes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyal po dang rkun pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong dgon pa ba'i rang gi gnas na 'dug pa'i chos gos las 'bral ba'i nyes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rgyal po dang rkun pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: Just as a monk in the wilderness does not incur the offense of being separated from his robes while staying in his own dwelling, so too, if he is in a place with fear,

original: chos gos gcig dgon pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i grong du bzhag ste /
analyzed: chos gos gcig dgon pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i grong du bzhag ste /
translated: he may leave one robe in the village within the boundary of his monastery,

original: chos gos gcig po de dang gnas tha dad pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: chos gos gcig po de dang gnas tha dad pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: and even though he is separated from that robe and stays in a different place,

original: zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral ba'i nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: he does not incur the offense of being separated from his robes for up to six nights.

original: 'dir gzhung ni chos gos gsum las chos gos gang yang rung ba cig khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽'di ltar der ni dbyar phyi ma zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni chos gos gsum las chos gos gang yang rung ba cig khyim gzhan du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // 'di ltar der ni dbyar phyi ma zhes smos te /
translated: Here the text says, “He should leave one of his three robes in another house.”

original: dbyar phyi mar gyur pa zhes gsungs mod gyi /
analyzed: dbyar phyi mar gyur pa zhes gsungs mod gyi /
translated: In that text, the phrase “in the latter rainy season” is stated.

original: 'dir ni de khas mi blang ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni de khas mi blang ste /
translated: But here we do not accept that statement,

original: ltung ba bstan pa las de la mi brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltung ba bstan pa las de la mi brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not supported by the teaching on downfalls.

original: dge slong dgon pa ba des zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa ba des zhag drug gi mtha' tshun chad du chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'bral bar bya'o //
translated: That monk in the wilderness should be separated from that robe outside the boundary for six days at most.

original: de las 'das bar bral na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'das bar bral na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If he is separated from it for more than that, there is a pāyattika offense.”

original: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis ni so sor thar pa'i mdo la sogs pa dbyar phyi sma zhes smos pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis ni so sor thar pa'i mdo la sogs pa dbyar phyi sma zhes smos pa mdzad do //
translated: Because of the introduction, the Prātimokṣa Sūtra and so on say “in the latter rainy season.”

original: 'bral ba'i dus kyi mtshams brjod par 'dod nas des don gyi dbang gis grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i dus kyi mtshams brjod par 'dod nas des don gyi dbang gis grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du 'bral bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Desiring to state the boundary for the time of separation, he says, “For six days at most he should be separated from it because of the purpose.”

original: des zhes bya ba ni dge slong dgon pa bas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni dge slong dgon pa bas so //
translated: “He” refers to the monk in the wilderness.

original: don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Because of the purpose” means

original: chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: because of the necessity of a Dharma-related purpose.

original: grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grong gzhan na 'dug pa de las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “From that which is in another village” means

original: chos gos gcig dgon pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i grong gzhan du gzhag cing 'dug pa de las so //
analyzed: chos gos gcig dgon pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i grong gzhan du gzhag cing 'dug pa de las so //
translated: One of the three robes is left in a village that is within the boundary of the monastery.

original: gal te spyod yul du gyur ba'i grong yang 'jigs pa dang bcas par gyur na /🔽de'i tshe grong gzhan du yang gzhag par bya'o zhes bsdus ba'i phyir grong @251a * //
analyzed: gal te spyod yul du gyur ba'i grong yang 'jigs pa dang bcas par gyur na / de'i tshe grong gzhan du yang gzhag par bya'o zhes bsdus ba'i phyir grong @251a * //
translated: If the village that is within the boundary becomes dangerous,🔽then it should be left in another village.

original: gzhan zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase “in another village” is stated to include this.🔽In that isolated place, the robe is worn within a distance of one fathom, etc.

original: gnas dgon pa de na chos gos 'chang ba de'i nyen kor 'dom gang la sogs pa gang yin pa de las phyi rol du skya rengs shar ba ni 'dir 'bral ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dgon pa de na chos gos 'chang ba de'i nyen kor 'dom gang la sogs pa gang yin pa de las phyi rol du skya rengs shar ba ni 'dir 'bral ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Beyond that, at dawn, it should be understood that one is separated from the robe.

original: dus ji srid cig tu dgos pa'i dbang gis 'bral du gnang zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu dgos pa'i dbang gis 'bral du gnang zhe na /
translated: For how long is separation permitted due to necessity?

original: de'i phyir zhag drug tshun chad du zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhag drug tshun chad du zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “up to six days.”

original: zhag drug pa'i mthar thug cing zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs ma shar ba tshun chad du'o //
analyzed: zhag drug pa'i mthar thug cing zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs ma shar ba tshun chad du'o //
translated: Up to the end of the sixth day, before dawn of the seventh day.

original: 'bral bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos kyi gnas mtshams dag las gzhan du yang ste /
analyzed: 'bral bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos kyi gnas mtshams dag las gzhan du yang ste /
translated: “One should be separated” means that one should be separated from the boundaries of the robes.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “outside the boundaries.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽dge slong dgon pa pas chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis na chos gos grong gzhan na 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / dge slong dgon pa pas chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis na chos gos grong gzhan na 'dug pa'am /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: rang gi gnas na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du gzhan du 'bral bar bya'i /
analyzed: rang gi gnas na 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du gzhan du 'bral bar bya'i /
translated: If a monk in the wilderness has a need for the Dharma, then he may be separated from his robes for up to six days, whether they are in another village or in his own dwelling.

original: de las lhag par ni mi bya'o //🔽lhag pa la ni bag yangs med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las lhag par ni mi bya'o // lhag pa la ni bag yangs med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But he should not do it for more than that.

original: zhag drug pa las lhag pa zhag bdun pa la ni 'bral bar gnang ba'i bag yangs med de ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhag drug pa las lhag pa zhag bdun pa la ni 'bral bar gnang ba'i bag yangs med de ltung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “There is no relaxation for more than that” means that there is no relaxation of the rule allowing separation for the seventh day and beyond. It becomes a downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar na ni 'bral ba zhes bya ba'i ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i skya rengs shar na ni 'bral ba zhes bya ba'i ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “When the dawn of the seventh day has risen, the downfall called ‘separation’ occurs.”

original: bar chad kyi dbang gis ma 'ongs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bar chad kyi dbang gis ma 'ongs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if there is an obstruction.

original: dgon pa pa gzhan du song ba rkun po la sogs pa bar chad kyi dbang gis zhag drug las lhag par phyir ma 'ongs shing zhag bdun pa la sogs par thal ba la ni nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa pa gzhan du song ba rkun po la sogs pa bar chad kyi dbang gis zhag drug las lhag par phyir ma 'ongs shing zhag bdun pa la sogs par thal ba la ni nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if a forest-dwelling monk goes elsewhere and does not return within six days because of an obstruction such as thieves.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gal te dge slong dgon ba pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ba rkun po la sogs ba gnod pa byed pa'i 'jigs pas zhag drug las lhag par phyir ma 'khor na de lta na yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur bar bag yangs su gnang ngo //
analyzed: gal te dge slong dgon ba pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ba rkun po la sogs ba gnod pa byed pa'i 'jigs pas zhag drug las lhag par phyir ma 'khor na de lta na yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur bar bag yangs su gnang ngo //
translated: If a forest-dwelling monk goes outside the boundary and does not return within six days because of the danger of being harmed by thieves, etc., then he is not separated from his robes.🔽The text here is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong dgon pa bas grong gzhan du chos gos bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong dgon pa bas grong gzhan du chos gos bzhag ste /
translated: “Venerables, a forest-dwelling monk may leave his robes in another village

original: bgyi ba 'ga' zhig gi slad du mtshams kyi slang rol du mchi zhing /
analyzed: bgyi ba 'ga' zhig gi slad du mtshams kyi slang rol du mchi zhing /
translated: and go outside the boundary for some reason.

original: de nyid du slar log par bgyi'o snyam pa las gal te de la bar chad 'ga' zhig byung nas slar mchi bar rngo ma thogs na chos gos de dang bral zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: de nyid du slar log par bgyi'o snyam pa las gal te de la bar chad 'ga' zhig byung nas slar mchi bar rngo ma thogs na chos gos de dang bral zhes bgyi'am /
translated: If some obstacle arises and he is unable to return, should he be considered separated from his robe?

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upagupta, he should not be considered separated from his robe.

original: kha cig 'di ltar rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: kha cig 'di ltar rnam par rtog ste /
translated: Some imagine it this way:

original: gal te dge slong gis bdag gis zhag drug phyi rol du 'gro bar bya'o snyam @251b du brnag pa sngon du byas te /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis bdag gis zhag drug phyi rol du 'gro bar bya'o snyam @251b du brnag pa sngon du byas te /
translated: If a monk first resolves, “I will go outside for six days,”

original: 'gro zhing zhag drug pa las 'das pa la ni 'bral ba'i nyes pa 'di med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gro zhing zhag drug pa las 'das pa la ni 'bral ba'i nyes pa 'di med pa yin gyi /

original: gal te de ltar brnag pa ma byas par nyin gcig gam mtshan gcig 'gro bar brnags te song ba las zhag drug 'das pa de la ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du rtog pa dag yod pas de bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar brnag pa ma byas par nyin gcig gam mtshan gcig 'gro bar brnags te song ba las zhag drug 'das pa de la ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du rtog pa dag yod pas de bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: But if he does not make such a resolution, but goes out for one day or one night, and then stays out longer than six days, he is guilty of a downfall.🔽To dispel such ideas, the text says:

original: 'dir zhag drug tu 'gro ba ha cang thal ba nyid la ni brnag ba yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir zhag drug tu 'gro ba ha cang thal ba nyid la ni brnag ba yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here, the assertion that it is too long to go for six days is not a branch of the downfall.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir brnag pa ni yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir brnag pa ni yan lag ma yin te /
translated: Here, the assertion is not a branch of the downfall because

original: 'di ltar zhag drug tu 'gro ba'i dus de las ha cang thal bar bya'o snyam pa'i brnag pa de ni nyes par 'gyur ba'i yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhag drug tu 'gro ba'i dus de las ha cang thal bar bya'o snyam pa'i brnag pa de ni nyes par 'gyur ba'i yan lag ma yin te /
translated: the assertion that it is too long to go for six days is not a branch of the downfall.

original: brnag pa med par ji ltar song yang rung ste /
analyzed: brnag pa med par ji ltar song yang rung ste /
translated: It is permissible to go without an assertion, however it is done.

original: nyin mtshan gcig tu brnags te song ba las zhag drug las 'das par gyur la nyid pa yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gcig tu brnags te song ba las zhag drug las 'das par gyur la nyid pa yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if one goes for more than six days, having asserted to go for one day and night.

original: zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: zhag bdun na 'bral ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The seventh day is the separation downfall.

original: // / da ni dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / da ni dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: Now, in order to explain the downfall of the rainy season practice,🔽it is said:

original: bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun chad nas dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun chad nas dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The monk who seeks the rainy season robe should say, I will seek the rainy season robe from the first day of the previous month of the moon in which I will stay.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen 'di tshol ba'i dge slong gis bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen 'di tshol ba'i dge slong gis bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The monk who seeks the rainy season robe should say, I will seek the rainy season robe from the first day of the moon in which I will stay.

original: dge slong de bdag nyid dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyi ma gang yin pa de'i nyin mo ste /
analyzed: dge slong de bdag nyid dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyi ma gang yin pa de'i nyin mo ste /
translated: The first day of the moon in which the monk will stay is the day on which he accepts to stay for the rainy season.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i nyin mo ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug go //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma'i nyin mo ni dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug go //
translated: The first day of the rainy season is the sixteenth day of the middle month of summer.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma'i nyin mo ni dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug go //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma'i nyin mo ni dbyar zla tha chungs tshes bcu drug go //
translated: The last day of the rainy season is the sixteenth day of the last month of summer.

original: de ni bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo ste ;
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pa'i nyin mo ste ;
translated: That is the first day of the moon in which he will stay.

original: de'i zla ba snga ma ni dbyar zlar ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar ram /
analyzed: de'i zla ba snga ma ni dbyar zlar ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar ram /
translated: The previous month of that moon is from the full moon of the middle month of summer until the full moon of the last month of summer.

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar ro //
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i nya nas dbyar zla tha chungs nya'i bar ro //
translated: from the full moon of the middle summer month up to the full moon of the last summer month.

original: de ni bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs ba'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs ba'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma ste /
translated: That is the former month of the day on which he has accepted to stay.

original: de'i nyi ma'i dang po ni dbyar zla ra ba tshes bcu drug gam dbyar zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug go //
analyzed: de'i nyi ma'i dang po ni dbyar zla ra ba tshes bcu drug gam dbyar zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug go //
translated: The first day of that is the sixteenth day of the first summer month or the sixteenth day of the middle summer month.

original: tshun chad nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshun chad nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From then on means

original: nyi ma dang po de gnyis dang por byas nas de tshun chad nas so //🔽dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyi ma dang po de gnyis dang por byas nas de tshun chad nas so // dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: from those two first days, having made them first, from then on.🔽One should seek the rainy season cloth means

original: dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: a monk should seek the rainy season cloth.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: gal te dge slong dbyar @252a * //
analyzed: gal te dge slong dbyar @252a * //
translated: If a monk

original: gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed na gang gi tshe dbyar snga mar gnas par khas len na ni de'i tshe dbyar zla ra ba tshes bcu drug nas brtsams nas dge slong des ji srid dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang bar gnang ba'i dus kyi mtha' tshun chad🔽kyi bar du dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o//
analyzed: gyi gos ras chen tshol bar byed na gang gi tshe dbyar snga mar gnas par khas len na ni de'i tshe dbyar zla ra ba tshes bcu drug nas brtsams nas dge slong des ji srid dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang bar gnang ba'i dus kyi mtha' tshun chad kyi bar du dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya'o//
translated: If he seeks a great cloth for the rainy season, then if he accepts the earlier rainy season, then from the sixteenth day of the first month of the rainy season, that monk should seek a rainy season cloth until the end of the period when he is permitted to keep the rainy season cloth.

original: gal te gang gi tshe dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas len na ni de'i tshe dbyar zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug nas brtsams nas dge slong des ji srid du dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang bar gnang ba'i dus kyi mtha' tshun chad du dbyar gyi ras chen🔽btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas len na ni de'i tshe dbyar zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug nas brtsams nas dge slong des ji srid du dbyar gyi gos ras chen 'chang bar gnang ba'i dus kyi mtha' tshun chad du dbyar gyi ras chen btsal bar bya ste /
translated: If he accepts the later rainy season, then from the sixteenth day of the middle month of the rainy season, that monk should seek a rainy season cloth until the end of the period when he is permitted to keep the rainy season cloth.

original: mdo 'dis ni dbyar gyi ras chen dang po btsal ba'i dus bstan to /
analyzed: mdo 'dis ni dbyar gyi ras chen dang po btsal ba'i dus bstan to /
translated: This sutra teaches the time for seeking the first rainy season cloth.

original: // / da ni bcang ba'i dus brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / da ni bcang ba'i dus brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the time for keeping it, he says:

original: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha'i bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dge slong de'i dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dbang gis bdag nyid kyi dbyar snga ma'am phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i 'og mar gyur pa dus phyis 'byung ba'i zla ba phyed gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla ba phyed kyi mtha'i bar du bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / dge slong de'i dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dbang gis bdag nyid kyi dbyar snga ma'am phyi ma rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de'i 'og mar gyur pa dus phyis 'byung ba'i zla ba phyed gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyi dbyar gyi 'og gi zla
translated: I will keep the rainy season robe for the latter half of the last month of the rainy season.

original: ba phyed yin no //
analyzed: ba phyed yin no //
translated: The latter half of the last month of the rainy season is the latter half of the last month of the rainy season that occurs after the earlier or later rainy season that is determined by the monk’s promise to remain in retreat for the rainy season.

original: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug par gyur ba ste /
translated: The end of that is the final limit.

original: dus de srid kyi bar du dbyar gyi gos ras chen bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus de srid kyi bar du dbyar gyi gos ras chen bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The rainy season robe should be kept for that period of time.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te dge slong des dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga mar khas len par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te dge slong des dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga mar khas len par 'dod na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe dbyar zla ra ba tshes bcu drug nas brtsams nas ston zla tha chungs tshes kyi bar du zla ba phyed dang lngar dbyar gyi gos ras chen de bcang ba'i dus yin no //
translated: At that time, the period for keeping the rainy season robe is five and a half months, from the sixteenth day of the first autumn month until the end of the last autumn month.

original: gal te dge slong des dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi mar khas len par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: gal te dge slong des dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi mar khas len par 'dod na ni /
translated: If that monk wishes to accept the rainy season retreat in the following year,

original: de'i tshe dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug nas brtsams nas dgun zla rab tshes kyi bar du zla ba phyed dang lngar dbyar gyi gos ras chen de bcang ba'i dus yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug nas brtsams nas dgun zla rab tshes kyi bar du zla ba phyed dang lngar dbyar gyi gos ras chen de bcang ba'i dus yin te /
translated: at that time, the period for keeping the rainy season robe is five and a half months, from the sixteenth day of the middle autumn month until the end of the last winter month.

original: de las thal bar 'chang du ni mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: de las thal bar 'chang du ni mi gnang ngo //
translated: It is not permitted to keep it beyond that.

original: de lta bas na 'dir ston zla tha chungs tshes gcig gam /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir ston zla tha chungs tshes gcig gam /
translated: Therefore, if the first dawn of the first day of the last autumn month or

analyzed: dgun zla ra ba tshes gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: the first day of the first winter month has risen, it becomes a downfall that requires confession.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dbyar gyi ras chen rung ba ma lags pa dgun zla phyed dang lnga las 'das par 'chang na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dbyar gyi ras chen rung ba ma lags pa dgun zla phyed dang lnga las 'das par 'chang na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Venerable Upāli, if a fully ordained monk keeps a rainy season robe that is unsuitable for more than five and a half months in winter, what is the offense?

original: nye ba 'khor nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang la @252b dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la @252b dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense for keeping a rainy season robe?

original: de'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma gnyis las de ma yin pa'i dus gnyis ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma gnyis las de ma yin pa'i dus gnyis ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the two times other than the first and last are the agent of the offense.

original: btsal ba'i dus bstan pa bas sngon rol gyi dus gang yin pa dang / bcang ba'i dus bstan pa pas phyi ma'i dus gang yin pa'i dus snga ma dang phyi ma de gnyis ni 'dir ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: btsal ba'i dus bstan pa bas sngon rol gyi dus gang yin pa dang / bcang ba'i dus bstan pa pas phyi ma'i dus gang yin pa'i dus snga ma dang phyi ma de gnyis ni 'dir ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The two times other than the first and last are the agent of the offense here.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar zhes bya ba'i zla bas sngon rol gyi dus gang yin pa dang / ston zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs tshes zhes bya ba'i bar gyi zla ba phyed kya 'og ma'i dus de gnyis ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbyar zla ra ba nya nas dbyar zla 'bring po nya'i bar zhes bya ba'i zla bas sngon rol gyi dus gang yin pa dang / ston zla 'bring po nya nas ston zla tha chungs tshes zhes bya ba'i bar gyi zla ba phyed kya 'og ma'i dus de gnyis ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The time prior to the month from the full moon of the first summer month to the full moon of the middle summer month and the time from the full moon of the middle autumn month to the fifteenth of the last autumn month are the two times when one is the agent of a downfall.

original: yul gang la de gnyis byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang la de gnyis byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to what objects are they agents?

original: de'i phyir re zhig 'chang ba la ni gzhan du 'chang ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig 'chang ba la ni gzhan du 'chang ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, first, it is said, “One is an agent of keeping when one keeps at another time.”

original: 'chang ba'i dus sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa'i dus su 'chang na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'chang ba'i dus sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa'i dus su 'chang na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: One is an agent of the actual basis of a downfall when one keeps at a time other than the time for keeping previously explained.

original: sngar btsal ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni btsal ba'i dus sngar bstan pa bas sngon rol gyi dus gang yin pa'i dus der btsal na btsal ba tsam la sbyor ba zhes bya ba nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: sngar btsal ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni btsal ba'i dus sngar bstan pa bas sngon rol gyi dus gang yin pa'i dus der btsal na btsal ba tsam la sbyor ba zhes bya ba nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If one searches for it earlier than the time of teaching the time of searching, then at the time of merely searching, one is the agent of the misdeed called mere preparation.

original: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i yul gang la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i yul gang la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to the basis of the actual offense, what is the agent?

original: de'i phyir grub na mtha'i'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽btsal ba'i dus bstan pa bas sngon rol gyi dus su dbyar gyi ras chen de grub na sngon rol gyi dus de mtha'i zhes bya ba dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir grub na mtha'i'o zhes bya ba smras te / btsal ba'i dus bstan pa bas sngon rol gyi dus su dbyar gyi ras chen de grub na sngon rol gyi dus de mtha'i zhes bya ba dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said, if it is completed, it is the final.🔽If the rainy season robe is completed prior to the time of teaching the time of searching, then at the time of mere searching, one is the agent of the actual offense.

original: dus snga zhig tu gang tshol ba rtsom par byed cing rigs pa'i dus su thob par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dus snga zhig tu gang tshol ba rtsom par byed cing rigs pa'i dus su thob par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: If one begins to search for it earlier and obtains it at the proper time, then one is not the agent of the actual offense.

original: sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin gyi dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It would be a fault of preparation, but not a fault of the actual basis.

original: rnyang rnying la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyang rnying la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: An old patched robe is just blameworthy.

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnyang rnying du gyur cing dengs pa zhig btsal ba'i dus ma yin par btsal ba dang thob nas dus las yol bar 'chang bar byed pa la ni na smad pa nyid de nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnyang rnying du gyur cing dengs pa zhig btsal ba'i dus ma yin par btsal ba dang thob nas dus las yol bar 'chang bar byed pa la ni na smad pa nyid de nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one seeks an old patched robe, a rainy season robe, at a time when it is not the proper time to seek it, and having obtained it, one keeps it beyond the proper time, it is just blameworthy, meaning it is a misdeed.🔽Here the text of the questions and answers states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnyang rnying du gyur pa zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga las lhag par 'chang na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnyang rnying du gyur pa zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga las lhag par 'chang na nyes byas so //
translated: If one keeps an old patched robe, a rainy season robe, for more than five and a half months, it is a misdeed.

original: de bzhin du dbyar gyi gos ras chen bug rdol du gyur pa ha cang tshogs te tshol bar byed na yang nyes @253a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyar gyi gos ras chen bug rdol du gyur pa ha cang tshogs te tshol bar byed na yang nyes @253a * //
translated: Similarly, if one seeks a patched robe, a rainy season robe, that has a hole and is very worn, it is a misdeed.

original: byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blang ba dang 'brel ba'i bya ba dag ni mang du snang na ci bya ba gang dag dbyar gnas par khas blang ba snga ma dang 'brel ba de dag nyid dbyar gnas par khas blang ba phyi ma dang 'brel ba dag kyang yin nam🔽zhe na / de'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni khas blang ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blang ba dang 'brel ba'i bya ba dag ni mang du snang na ci bya ba gang dag dbyar gnas par khas blang ba snga ma dang 'brel ba de dag nyid dbyar gnas par khas blang ba phyi ma dang 'brel ba dag kyang yin nam zhe na / de'i phyir de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni khas blang ba ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If many actions are related to the prior acceptance of the rains residence, are those actions also related to the subsequent acceptance of the rains residence?🔽Therefore, it is said, “The subsequent is just as the prior acceptance.”

original: gang dag gis de sped pa'i dge slong ma bskos pa de dag ni de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams te /
analyzed: gang dag gis de sped pa'i dge slong ma bskos pa de dag ni de sped pa ma bskos pa rnams te /
translated: Those who have not been appointed to distribute it are the monks who have not been appointed to distribute the robes.

original: de dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la'o //
translated: To them.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: dge slong gang dag gis gos sped pa'i dge slong ma bskos pa de dag gis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par gal te dbyar gyi rnyed pa 'god par mi byed na de'i tshe de dag la spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gang dag gis gos sped pa'i dge slong ma bskos pa de dag gis dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par gal te dbyar gyi rnyed pa 'god par mi byed na de'i tshe de dag la spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If those monks who have not been appointed to distribute the robes do not distribute the gains of the rains residence on the next day of the invitation ceremony, then at that time there is an offense of wrongdoing for them.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar ba'i mdo las gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar ba'i mdo las gos sbyin pa'i dus kyi bar du bcang bar bya'o //
translated: “One should keep the robe until the time of giving the robe.

original: de las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: de las 'das par 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: If one keeps it beyond that time, one commits an offense of wrongdoing.”🔽Similarly, its commentary also states:

original: / de bzhin du de'i rnam par 'byed pa las kyang dge slong gis gos sbyin pa'i dus dang skabs ma yin pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: / de bzhin du de'i rnam par 'byed pa las kyang dge slong gis gos sbyin pa'i dus dang skabs ma yin pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: “What is the time and occasion for giving a robe to a fully ordained monk?

original: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad do //
analyzed: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad do //
translated: If the rainy season retreat has not been performed, it is until the full moon of the last month of autumn.

original: sra brkyang ba ting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya phan chad nas dpyid zla 'bring po nya'i bar te /
analyzed: sra brkyang ba ting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya phan chad nas dpyid zla 'bring po nya'i bar te /
translated: If the rainy season retreat has been performed, it is from the full moon of the last month of autumn until the full moon of the middle month of spring.

original: de ni dge slong gi chos gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin la lhag ma rnams ni dus yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge slong gi chos gos sbyin pa'i dus ma yin la lhag ma rnams ni dus yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the time for giving a robe to a fully ordained monk. The remaining months are not the time.”

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos nges par byas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa phyi ma shos nges par byas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya tshun chad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one definitely makes the latter promise to remain in the rainy season, then it is up to the full moon of the last autumn month.

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma la ni ston zla 'bring po nya tshun chad dus ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa snga ma la ni ston zla 'bring po nya tshun chad dus ma yin no //
translated: For the former promise to remain in the rainy season, it is not the proper time up to the full moon of the middle autumn month.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ji srid du sra brkyang 'ding bar mi byed kyi bar du ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug kho na gos sbyin pa'i dus yin no //
analyzed: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ji srid du sra brkyang 'ding bar mi byed kyi bar du ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug kho na gos sbyin pa'i dus yin no //
translated: In a place where the rainy season robe is not spread out, it is the time to give the robe on the sixteenth day of the middle autumn month, as long as the rainy season robe is not spread out.

original: de ni mi bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni mi bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That should not be done without appointing someone.

original: gos sped pa'i dge slong de mi bsko bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gos sped pa'i dge slong de mi bsko bar mi bya ste /
translated: That monk who is saving the robe should not be done without appointing him.

original: @255a * // bsko ba kho nar bya ba'o //
analyzed: @255a * // bsko ba kho nar bya ba'o //
translated: He should be appointed.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gos brtad pa las byung ba dang / dus su byung ba dang / gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gos brtad pa las byung ba dang / dus su byung ba dang / gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: The robe that arises from the robe distribution, that arises in time, and that which is suitable for another,

original: de dag spa ba'i phyir dge slong bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spa ba'i phyir dge slong bsko bar bya'o //
translated: those should be saved by appointing a monk.

original: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i 'og tu brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par 'byed pa las 'phrog pa'i spang ba'i 'og tu brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Thus, the topic of the forfeiture of what is stolen is followed by the topic of the forfeiture of what is obtained through begging.
