original: 'on kyang zhu ba las gsungs pa'i gzhung khas blangs nas rim pa 'di ltar bstan te /
analyzed: 'on kyang zhu ba las gsungs pa'i gzhung khas blangs nas rim pa 'di ltar bstan te /
translated: However, the text is presented in this order, accepting the order of the questions.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen dang brtad pa las byung ba gnyis kyis bcang ba spyir 'dra ba la brten par byas so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen dang brtad pa las byung ba gnyis kyis bcang ba spyir 'dra ba la brten par byas so //
translated: The general rule is that both the rainy season practice cloth and what is obtained through begging are to be used.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The forfeiture of what is obtained through begging has been explained.

original: // / da ni bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the forfeiture of what is dedicated should be mentioned.

original: ci zhig byas na bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas na bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the act that causes the forfeiture of what is dedicated?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis gang zag gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis gang zag gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says: “If, knowing that cloth has been dedicated to another person or to the Saṅgha, one takes it for oneself.”

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni yon bdag gis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni yon bdag gis so //
translated: “Another” means a donor.

original: gang zag gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni gang zag gzhan la ltos pa'i gos so //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni gang zag gzhan la ltos pa'i gos so //
translated: The phrase to another person means to another person who is dependent on the robe.

original: gzhan zhes dmigs kyis smos pa ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa las gzhan pa'i gang zag la bsngos pa yin gyi ltung ba 'byin par byed pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes dmigs kyis smos pa ni ltung ba 'byin par byed pa las gzhan pa'i gang zag la bsngos pa yin gyi ltung ba 'byin par byed pa la ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase to another is mentioned in order to indicate that the robe is dedicated to a person other than the one who is committing the downfall, and not to the one who is causing the downfall.

original: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase to the community means

original: dge 'dun spyil bsngos pa'i gos so //
analyzed: dge 'dun spyil bsngos pa'i gos so //
translated: to the community in general.

original: bsngos ba'i zhes bya ba ni yid kyis phul ba'i 'o //
analyzed: bsngos ba'i zhes bya ba ni yid kyis phul ba'i 'o //
translated: The phrase dedicated means offered mentally.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase to the robe means to the acquisition of a robe.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not mean to the acquisition of food, etc.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the text of the Vinaya that states the acquisition of a robe is the authoritative source here.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase knowingly means

original: gal te dge slong gis 'di ltar gos 'di sbyin bdag 'dis gang zag gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos shing yid kyis phul bar shes bzhin du'o bdag nyid la bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis 'di ltar gos 'di sbyin bdag 'dis gang zag gzhan nam dge 'dun la bsngos shing yid kyis phul bar shes bzhin du'o bdag nyid la bsgyur te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a monk, knowing that this robe was dedicated to another person or to the Saṅgha by the donor, and knowing that it was mentally offered to himself,

original: ltung ba 'byin par byed pas de ltar shes bzhin du gos de bdag nyid kyi yul la bsgyur du bcug ste'o //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin par byed pas de ltar shes bzhin du gos de bdag nyid kyi yul la bsgyur du bcug ste'o //
translated: he should cause it to be dedicated to his own place, since he is the one who commits the downfall.🔽If he obtains it,

original: thob na'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa de dag gis gos de thob na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thob na'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa de dag gis gos de thob na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: if he obtains that robe by the means described, then he has a root downfall.🔽In the Sūtra on the Foundation of Mindfulness, it says:

original: 'di ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la bsngor 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes dge 'dun gyi @255b 'ba' zhig smos mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa shes bzhin du gang zag bdag la bsngor 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes dge 'dun gyi @255b 'ba' zhig smos mod kyi /
translated: If a monk, knowing that an object has been dedicated to the Saṅgha, causes it to be dedicated to himself, that is a downfall.

original: 'on kyang ltung ba bstan pa las gang zag kyang smos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang ltung ba bstan pa las gang zag kyang smos pa'i phyir /
translated: Although only the Saṅgha is mentioned,🔽in the teaching on downfalls, both the Saṅgha and an individual are mentioned.

original: 'dir gang zag gzhan nam zhes gang zag kyang smos te /
analyzed: 'dir gang zag gzhan nam zhes gang zag kyang smos te /
translated: Here, the term “another person” refers to a person.

original: dge slong gis gang zag gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed na sgyur bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis gang zag gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed na sgyur bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk converts to himself the property that was dedicated to another person, then he commits an offense for the conversion.

original: thob na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he obtains it, he commits a downfall of abandoning it.

original: de ltar 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /🔽gal te yon bdag gzhan 'ga' zhig gis dge 'dun gyi phyir ram /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste / gal te yon bdag gzhan 'ga' zhig gis dge 'dun gyi phyir ram /
translated: Here, this is the meaning of the words.🔽If a certain other donor gives a piece of cloth to the Saṅgha or to another person, saying, “I give this to him,” and if the monk, knowing this, converts it to himself, then he commits an offense for the conversion.

original: gang zag gzhan gyi phyir gos shig de la sbyin no zhes bsngos pa las dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes bzhin du 'on kyang bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed na sgyur bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur la thob na ni spang ba'i ltung byed🔽du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan gyi phyir gos shig de la sbyin no zhes bsngos pa las dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes bzhin du 'on kyang bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed na sgyur bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur la thob na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he obtains it, he commits a downfall of abandoning it.

original: gal te thob na dngos gzhir 'gyur na bsgyur ba la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thob na dngos gzhir 'gyur na bsgyur ba la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If he commits an offense when he obtains it, then what is the sin of converting it?

original: de'i phyir bsgyur ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgyur ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is a minor offense to exchange it.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa las gzhan pa gos kyi rnyed pa la ni /
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa las gzhan pa gos kyi rnyed pa la ni /
translated: It is a minor offense to exchange it for a robe, which is a different type of acquisition than food.

original: bsgyur ba la sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsgyur ba la sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense to prepare to exchange it.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa la ni sbyor ba la yang nyes byas la dngos gzhi la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa la ni sbyor ba la yang nyes byas la dngos gzhi la yang nyes byas so //
translated: It is a minor offense to prepare to exchange it for food and it is a minor offense to do so.

original: 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid ni yan lag ma yin te /
translated: Here, not being a relative is not a branch.

original: 'di ltar zhu ba las btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nye du ma lags pa las gos len na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhu ba las btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nye du ma lags pa las gos len na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na /
translated: Thus, the venerable one asked, “If one receives a robe from one who is not a relative, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong gis ma las gos len par bgyid cing de yang spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis ma las gos len par bgyid cing de yang spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: Is it the case that a monk receives a robe from his mother and it becomes an offense entailing relinquishment?”

original: yod de gal te des dge 'dun gyi phyir nye bar gzhag pa yin la /🔽de dge slong gis bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod de gal te des dge 'dun gyi phyir nye bar gzhag pa yin la /🔽de dge slong gis bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Yes, if he exchanges it for himself, even though it was set aside for the Saṅgha.”

original: ji ltar 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid yan lag ma yin pa bzhin du tshig nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid yan lag ma yin pa bzhin du tshig nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as non-kinship is not a limb here, so also the words are like that.

original: gal te 'bral bar bya ba dge slong yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'bral bar bya ba dge slong yin na /
translated: If the one who is to be separated is a bhikṣu,

original: de ni yan lag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni yan lag nyid yin no //
translated: then he is a limb.

original: 'dir gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /🔽'dir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba la / 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, also for another.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i skabs 'dir ro //🔽gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i skabs 'dir ro // gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here means in this context of changing what has been dedicated.

original: gang zag gzhan la bsngos pa gang zag gzhan la sgyur bar byed na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan la bsngos pa gang zag gzhan la sgyur bar byed na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Also for another means that if what has been dedicated to another person is changed to another person, then there is an offense.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word also is a continuation of the word offense.

original: de'i 'bras bu la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also for its result.

original: bsgyur pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste /🔽thob pa zhes bya ba dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de la yang nyes @256a * //
analyzed: bsgyur pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ste / thob pa zhes bya ba dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de la yang nyes @256a * //
translated: The result of changing is obtained.

original: byas kho na'o //
analyzed: byas kho na'o //
translated: That which is called obtained becomes the actual basis, and for that also there is only an offense.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: bdag nyid las gzhan pa la sgyur bar byed na dngos gzhi la yang nyes byas yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid las gzhan pa la sgyur bar byed na dngos gzhi la yang nyes byas yin la /
translated: If one causes it to be transferred to another person, then there is an offense of wrong conduct in the actual basis.

original: sbyor ba la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba la yang nyes byas so //
translated: And there is an offense of wrong conduct in the preparation.

original: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: And also to another.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa ni thas kyi rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa sngar bstan pa las gzhan pa ni thas kyi rnyed pa ste /
translated: Other than the previously explained acquisition of robes is the acquisition of food.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa de yang gzhan la sgyur bar byed na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi gnyi ga la nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa de yang gzhan la sgyur bar byed na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi gnyi ga la nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: And if one causes that acquisition of food to be transferred to another, then there is only an offense of wrong conduct in both the preparation and the actual basis.

original: dper na mu to ba cig la bsngos pa'i zas mu tob gzhan la sgyur bar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mu to ba cig la bsngos pa'i zas mu tob gzhan la sgyur bar byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if one causes food that has been dedicated to one monk to be transferred to another monk, then there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la ;
translated: And also if one causes it to be transferred to that which is not counted as a sentient being, both the separation and the connection.

original: dbral ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbral ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Separation is

original: rnyed pa gang las bsngos pa las dbrog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa gang las bsngos pa las dbrog par bya ba'o //
translated: taking it away from that to which it has been dedicated.

original: sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Connection is

original: gang la sbyin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la sbyin par bya ba'o //
translated: that to which it is given.

original: dbral ba dang sbyar ba de gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbral ba dang sbyar ba de gnyi ga sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Both the removal and the application are not counted as sentient beings.🔽Here, the dwelling place, etc. are the two.

original: 'dir gnas khang la sogs pa dag go de gnyis gcig la bsngos pa gcig la sgyur bar byed pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gnas khang la sogs pa dag go de gnyis gcig la bsngos pa gcig la sgyur bar byed pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: It is also a fault to dedicate one to another.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gnas khang gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong gi khri la sogs pa gzhan la sgyur par byed na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi gnyi ga la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas khang gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa dge slong gi khri la sogs pa gzhan la sgyur par byed na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi gnyi ga la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one dedicates the acquisition of another dwelling place, etc. to another, such as a monk's seat, then both the preparation and the actual basis are faults.

original: phyogs gcig nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs gcig nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, in just one direction.

original: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig nyid la yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyis kyi phyogs gcig nyid la yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In just one direction of both the removal and the application, there is only a fault.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: them skas kyi rim pa thams cad them skas gcig gi sgrar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: them skas kyi rim pa thams cad them skas gcig gi sgrar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: all the steps of a staircase are included in the sound of one step.

original: 'on kyang them skas gcig gi phyogs su gyur pa'i them skas kyi rim pa gcig la yon bdag gis bsngos pa dge slong gis them skas kyi rim pa gzhan du sgyur bar byed na gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang them skas gcig gi phyogs su gyur pa'i them skas kyi rim pa gcig la yon bdag gis bsngos pa dge slong gis them skas kyi rim pa gzhan du sgyur bar byed na gnas skabs gnyi ga la yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: However, if a monk changes the step of a staircase dedicated by a patron to another step of the same staircase, then there is an offense in both cases.

original: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa btsal te ma rnyed pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa btsal te ma rnyed pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if one searches for the remainder, such as an animal, but does not find it.

original: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa gang la bsngos pa de btsal te /
analyzed: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa gang la bsngos pa de btsal te /
translated: If one searches for the remainder, such as an animal, to which it was dedicated,

original: ma rnyed na gzhan la bsgyur na yang ltung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma rnyed na gzhan la bsgyur na yang ltung ba med pa'o //
translated: but does not find it, then there is no offense if one changes it to another.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa gang la bsngos pa de btsal te /
analyzed: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa gang la bsngos pa de btsal te /
translated: If one searches for the remainder, such as an animal, to which it was dedicated,

original: ma rnyed na de las gzhan pa las bsgyur na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma rnyed na de las gzhan pa las bsgyur na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: but does not find it, then there is no offense if one changes it to another.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs gzhan la ni g-yar por sbyin du rung ngo @256b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs gzhan la ni g-yar por sbyin du rung ngo @256b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is suitable to lend the image of the Sugata to another.

original: bde bar gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs sku'i gzugs brnyan gzhan gyi rgyan la sogs pa sku gzugs gzhan la g-yar por re zhig g-yar po'i tshul gyis sbyin du rung ba'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs sku'i gzugs brnyan gzhan gyi rgyan la sogs pa sku gzugs gzhan la g-yar por re zhig g-yar po'i tshul gyis sbyin du rung ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One, the Sugata, the Buddha, the Lord, has given permission to lend out for a while, on loan, the images of his body, such as other images, ornaments, etc., and other representations of his body.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs gzhan mnga' ba'i rgyan la sogs pa dag gal te sku gzugs gzhan la mchod pa'i phyir g-yar por sbyin par byed na de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs gzhan mnga' ba'i rgyan la sogs pa dag gal te sku gzugs gzhan la mchod pa'i phyir g-yar por sbyin par byed na de la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one lends out on loan, for the purpose of worshipping other representations of the body, such as ornaments belonging to other representations of the body of the Blessed One, there is no offense.

original: bsngos pa mi sbyin na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsngos pa mi sbyin na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not give what has been dedicated, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: che ge mo zhig la sbyin no zhes bsngos pa de de'i 'og tu de la sbyin par mi byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig la sbyin no zhes bsngos pa de de'i 'og tu de la sbyin par mi byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa /
translated: If one does not give to that person after dedicating it to them, saying, “I give this to so-and-so,” there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
translated: If one goes outside the monastery zone

original: dge 'dun gyis byin gyis rlob par byed na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis byin gyis rlob par byed na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the Saṅgha consecrates it.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
translated: If one goes outside the monastery zone🔽and the Saṅgha consecrates it,

original: dge 'dun gyis shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If the Saṅgha blesses the property of the deceased, and so on, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa dge slong gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa dge slong gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
translated: If a monk, having gone outside the boundary, blesses the property dedicated to the Saṅgha,

original: byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma tshogs pa dag gis 'god na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma tshogs pa dag gis 'god na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not the full assembly that distributes it.

original: dge slong ji snyed cig gis de las skal pa mnod par bya ba de dag tshogs par ma gyur par rnyed pa 'god par byed na /
analyzed: dge slong ji snyed cig gis de las skal pa mnod par bya ba de dag tshogs par ma gyur par rnyed pa 'god par byed na /
translated: If the property is distributed by the monks who have not gathered the full number of monks who should receive their share,

original: de'i tshe ma tshogs par 'god pa'i dge slong rnams la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma tshogs par 'god pa'i dge slong rnams la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time it is an offense of wrong conduct for the monks who distribute it when the full assembly is not present.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not consecrated.

original: shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis ma brlabs par de 'god na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa'i rnyed pa byin gyis ma brlabs par de 'god na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If the property of the deceased, and so on, is distributed without being consecrated, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa dge 'dun las gcig gam gnyis sam gsum gyis len na'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa dge 'dun las gcig gam gnyis sam gsum gyis len na'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one or two or three take the property of the Saṅgha that belongs to all.

original: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The property of the Saṅgha that belongs to all is

original: dbyar gyi rnyed pa la sogs pa spyir dbang ba ste /
analyzed: dbyar gyi rnyed pa la sogs pa spyir dbang ba ste /
translated: property that belongs to the Saṅgha in general, such as property for the rainy season.

original: de dge 'dun las dge slong gcig gam gnyis sam gsum gyis len na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de dge 'dun las dge slong gcig gam gnyis sam gsum gyis len na nyes byas so //
translated: If one or two or three monks take it from the Saṅgha, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te dge 'dun spyir mnga' ba'i rnyed pa gang zag gcig gis len tam ;
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun spyir mnga' ba'i rnyed pa gang zag gcig gis len tam ;
translated: If the property of the Saṅgha that belongs to all is taken by one person,

original: gnyis sam gsum gyis len par byed na len pa po de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum gyis len par byed na len pa po de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: or if it is taken by two or three, it is an offense of wrong conduct for those who take it.

original: gzhan yang dbang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the ones who have control over it.

original: gal te rnyed pa de len pa po de dag kyang dbang ba nyid yin na ci'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnyed pa de len pa po de dag kyang dbang ba nyid yin na ci'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If those who take the property are the ones who have control over it, why is it an offense of wrong conduct?

original: de'i phyir de la gzhan dag gi shas nyid ma bral lo zhes bya ba @257a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gzhan dag gi shas nyid ma bral lo zhes bya ba @257a * //
translated: Therefore it says, “Because they are not free from the portion of others.”

original: smras te / gang dag gis rnyed pa blangs pa de las gzhan pa'i dge slong dag kyang rnyed pa de la spyir dbang ba yin pas de dag gi shas nyid ma bral bar de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras te / gang dag gis rnyed pa blangs pa de las gzhan pa'i dge slong dag kyang rnyed pa de la spyir dbang ba yin pas de dag gi shas nyid ma bral bar de na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who take the gift are not the only ones who have a right to the gift, since all the other monks also have a right to the gift in general.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The point is this:

original: 'di ltar rnyed pa blang ba 'di la gzhan dag gi shas nyid bral ba med pas de'i phyir rnyed pa len pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnyed pa blang ba 'di la gzhan dag gi shas nyid bral ba med pas de'i phyir rnyed pa len pa de dag la nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no loss of the share of others in the taking of a gift, the taking of a gift is a misdeed for those who take it.

original: rku sems med pa la 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi rku sems yod pa la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rku sems med pa la 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi rku sems yod pa la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: This is established for one who is without a thieving mind. But what is the sin for one who has a thieving mind?

original: de'i phyir rku sems kyis na brkus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rku sems kyis na brkus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “It is theft if there is a thieving mind.”

original: rku sems kyis sgyur bar byed na thams cad brkus pa nyid yin te ;
analyzed: rku sems kyis sgyur bar byed na thams cad brkus pa nyid yin te ;
translated: If one appropriates with a thieving mind, it is all theft.

original: gzhi ji lta bu las brkus pa'i kha na ma thob nyid du 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi ji lta bu las brkus pa'i kha na ma thob nyid du 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is a sin of theft according to the basis of the theft.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las dge slong gang yang rung ba gcig pu zhig gnas na 'dug pa der mi dag gis dge 'dun gyi gos bgo bsha' bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i dge 'dun la gse bar bya ba zhig sbyin🔽par byed na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las dge slong gang yang rung ba gcig pu zhig gnas na 'dug pa der mi dag gis dge 'dun gyi gos bgo bsha' bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i dge 'dun la gse bar bya ba zhig sbyin par byed na /
translated: If a monk is staying alone in a place and people give him a gift of cloth to be distributed to the saṅgha,

original: dge slong des gos de blang ba na 'di ltar gnas 'di na bdag gcig pu gnas te /
analyzed: dge slong des gos de blang ba na 'di ltar gnas 'di na bdag gcig pu gnas te /
translated: when that monk receives that cloth, he should think and say, “I am staying alone in this place.

original: dge 'dun gyi gos bgo bsha' bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i dge 'dun la gse bar bya ba 'di byung na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gos bgo bsha' bya ba mngon sum du gyur pa'i dge 'dun la gse bar bya ba 'di byung na /
translated: This gift of cloth to be distributed to the saṅgha has arisen.

original: bdag gis gos gse bar bya ba 'di byi dor bya'o ;🔽/ sba brtul bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis gos gse bar bya ba 'di byi dor bya'o ; / sba brtul bya'o //
translated: I will wash this cloth to be distributed to the saṅgha.🔽I will dye it.

original: byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: I will consecrate it.

original: gos byi dor byas pa sba brtul byas pa byin gyis brlabs pa 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes sems bskyed par bya tshig tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gos byi dor byas pa sba brtul byas pa byin gyis brlabs pa 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes sems bskyed par bya tshig tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: This washed, dyed, and consecrated cloth is mine.”

original: gal te de ltar mi byed na dge slong des gos de gcig pus bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi byed na dge slong des gos de gcig pus bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: If he does not do so, that monk should not make it his own.

original: bdag gir byas na nyes byas te /
analyzed: bdag gir byas na nyes byas te /
translated: If he makes it his own, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de dag las dge slong gzhan yang spyir dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag las dge slong gzhan yang spyir dbang ba yin no //
translated: In addition to those, other monks are also entitled to it.

original: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gcig gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gcig gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk goes outside the boundary with the intention of making his own a single piece of cloth that has been dedicated to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'on te de dag rku sems kyis rku zhing bdag gir byed na ni 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de dag rku sems kyis rku zhing bdag gir byed na ni 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he makes it his own with the intention of stealing it, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: gnyis dang rab tu mang po dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis dang rab tu mang po dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The same applies to two or more.”

original: rab tu mang po zhes smos pa ni gsum yan chad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu mang po zhes smos pa ni gsum yan chad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “More” means three or more.

original: gtsug lag khang du gnas par mi byed pa'i tshe der dbang ba'i rdzas gtsug lag khang gzhan du gzhag par bye zhing bsngo bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa @257b de'i zhar la 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du gnas par mi byed pa'i tshe der dbang ba'i rdzas gtsug lag khang gzhan du gzhag par bye zhing bsngo bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa @257b de'i zhar la 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: When one does not dwell in a monastery, one should deposit the substances belonging to the monastery in another monastery, but one should not dedicate them.

original: gya tshom du gtsug lag khang dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gya tshom du gtsug lag khang dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not abandon a monastery thoughtlessly.

original: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa med par gya tshom du ma brtags par gtsug lag khang stong par dor bar mi bya'o //🔽rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa der srung mar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa med par gya tshom du ma brtags par gtsug lag khang stong par dor bar mi bya'o // rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa der srung mar gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not abandon a monastery thoughtlessly, without examining whether there is danger from enemies, armies, thieves, and so on.🔽One should appoint a monk who has great attachment to that monastery as the guardian.

original: dge slong gang gtsug lag khang de la rjes su chags pa shas chen po yod pa'i rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa de gtsug lag khang bsrung ba'i ched du der srung ma gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang gtsug lag khang de la rjes su chags pa shas chen po yod pa'i rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa de gtsug lag khang bsrung ba'i ched du der srung ma gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should appoint a monk who has great attachment to that monastery as the guardian of the monastery.

original: ma lhags na lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma lhags na lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not come, one may pass ten years there.

original: dge 'dun ma lhags shing ma byon na dge slong gtsug lag khang der bzhag pa des gtsug lag khang de nyid du lo bcu 'da' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun ma lhags shing ma byon na dge slong gtsug lag khang der bzhag pa des gtsug lag khang de nyid du lo bcu 'da' bar bya ba'o //
translated: If the Saṅgha does not come and the monk does not leave, he may stay in that temple for ten years.

original: ji ltar 'da' bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'da' bar bya zhe na /
translated: How may he stay there?

original: de'i phyir lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “Five years by alms-food.”

original: dge slong des gtsug lag khang der lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des gtsug lag khang der lo lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: That monk may stay in that temple for five years by alms-food.

original: der dus su sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der dus su sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If no patron appears at that time, for another five years he may stay in that temple together with the neighboring temple.

original: gtsug lag khang der lo lnga po dag 'das pa'i dus su gal te sbyin bdag btson ra la sogs pa dag nas byung bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang der lo lnga po dag 'das pa'i dus su gal te sbyin bdag btson ra la sogs pa dag nas byung bar ma gyur na /
translated: If, after the five years in that temple have passed, a patron does not appear from prison or elsewhere,

original: de'i tshe lo gzhan lnga po dag ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang 'tsho ba lhan cig thun mong du bya bas 'da' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe lo gzhan lnga po dag ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang 'tsho ba lhan cig thun mong du bya bas 'da' bar bya ba'o //
translated: then for another five years he may stay there together with the neighboring temple, sharing the livelihood.

original: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las lnga ni bsod nams kyis so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las lnga ni bsod nams kyis so //
translated: Some texts say, “The five are based on the merit field.

original: lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang la brten pas te /
analyzed: lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang la brten pas te /
translated: The five are based on the temple of the vicinity.

original: de ltar na lo bcur 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lo bcur 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is for ten years.”

original: gso sbyong tha dad pa dang rnyed pa thun mong ba'i las bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gso sbyong tha dad pa dang rnyed pa thun mong ba'i las bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The confession ceremony is separate and the rite is performed for the common acquisition of property.

original: gtsug lag khang de dang nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang der rnyed pa ni thun mong la /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de dang nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang der rnyed pa ni thun mong la /
translated: The acquisition of property in that temple and in the temple of the vicinity is common.🔽The confession ceremony is separate.

original: gso sbyong ni tha dad pa'i las bya ba ste /
analyzed: gso sbyong ni tha dad pa'i las bya ba ste /
translated: The rite is performed as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Virtuous monks, please listen.

original: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam gum mam spyugs na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam gum mam spyugs na /
translated: If the owner of this temple has been killed, bound, killed and exiled,🔽if the time has come for the saṅgha and the saṅgha approves, then may the saṅgha allow it.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad pa mdzad do //
translated: The saṅgha will perform the confession ceremony separately for this temple and that temple for five years, but the acquisition of property is common.”

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: dge 'dun btsun ba rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun ba rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag @258a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di'i gtsug lag @258a * //
translated: The owner of this monastery

original: khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam gum mam /
analyzed: khang gi bdag po bcom mam bcings sam gum mam /
translated: has been killed, imprisoned, or exiled,

original: spyugs te de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad kyi /
analyzed: spyugs te de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad kyi /
translated: or has gone away. For that reason, the saṅgha will make this monastery and that monastery common for five years, but the observance-day ceremony will be separate.🔽Those venerable ones who can accept that this monastery and that monastery will be common for five years, but the observance-day ceremony will be separate, should remain silent.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad par bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun
translated: Those who cannot accept it should speak.🔽The saṅgha has accepted and agreed

original: gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la /
analyzed: gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis gtsug lag khang 'di dang pha bi lo lngar rnyed pa ni thun mong la /
translated: that this monastery and that monastery will be common for five years,

original: gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad pa mdzad lags te /
analyzed: gso sbyong ni tha dad du mdzad pa mdzad lags te /
translated: but the observance-day ceremony will be separate.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis so //
translated: Thus, by remaining silent, they accept it.

original: gal te srung ma yang 'gro na de'i tshe des ji zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srung ma yang 'gro na de'i tshe des ji zhig bya zhe na /
translated: If the protector also goes away, then what should be done?

original: de'i phyir 'gro na dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu gdams par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro na dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu gdams par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “If he goes, the things should be entrusted to the temples in the vicinity.”

original: dge slong gang la gtsug lag khang gtad pa'i dge slong de yang gal te gtsug lag khang de nas 'gro bar 'dod na de 'gro ba'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: dge slong gang la gtsug lag khang gtad pa'i dge slong de yang gal te gtsug lag khang de nas 'gro bar 'dod na de 'gro ba'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: If the monk to whom the temple is entrusted also wishes to leave that temple, then at the time of his departure,

original: gtsug lag khang de'i mal stan dang snod la sogs pa dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu gdams par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de'i mal stan dang snod la sogs pa dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dag tu gdams par bya ba'o //
translated: the things such as bedding and utensils in that temple should be entrusted to the temples in the vicinity.

original: gnyug mar gnas na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a resident monk arrives, it should be given to him.

original: gtsug lag khang por ba der dge slong dag lhags te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang por ba der dge slong dag lhags te /
translated: If monks arrive at the empty temple,

original: gnyug mar gnas na nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang gzhan na gnas pa'i dge slong de dag gis mal stan dang snod la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag gtsug lag khang de nyid du phyir sbyin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas na nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang gzhan na gnas pa'i dge slong de dag gis mal stan dang snod la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag gtsug lag khang de nyid du phyir sbyin par bya ba'o //
translated: If it is a permanent residence, then the monks who live in the other monasteries in the vicinity should return those things, such as bedding and vessels, to that monastery.

original: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gzhan du mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gzhan du mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The text states, “The property of one monastery should not be given to another.”

original: dge 'dun du 'gyur ba'i dge slong de dag gis kyang gnas gzhan gyi rdzas mal stan dang snod la sogs pa dag gnas gzhan du mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun du 'gyur ba'i dge slong de dag gis kyang gnas gzhan gyi rdzas mal stan dang snod la sogs pa dag gnas gzhan du mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The monks who belong to the saṅgha should not give the property of one monastery, such as bedding and vessels, to another monastery.

original: 'di ni mdo 'og ma rnams kyi yul bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo 'og ma rnams kyi yul bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This is stated in order to indicate the scope of the following sūtras.

original: 'og gi mdo las rnyed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji ltar nges par byas pa yin no zhes 'byung ba de rjes su bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'og gi mdo las rnyed pa rnam par gzhag pa ni ji ltar nges par byas pa yin no zhes 'byung ba de rjes su bzlas pa yin no //
translated: The text repeats what is stated in the sūtras, “The distribution of the property should be determined in accordance with the rules.”

original: mi ster na de dag gis sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi ster na de dag gis sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The text states, “If they do not give it, it should be given by them.”

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdams pa'i rdzas de dag gtsug lag khang de'i nye 'khor na mi snang zhing phyir mi ster na dge slong gang dag gis rdzas de dag dang po gnas gzhan der gzhag pa'i dge slong de dag gis rma zhing phyir sbyin par bya ba
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdams pa'i rdzas de dag gtsug lag khang de'i nye 'khor na mi snang zhing phyir mi ster na dge slong gang dag gis rdzas de dag dang po gnas gzhan der gzhag pa'i dge slong de dag gis rma zhing phyir sbyin par bya ba
translated: If the articles that were entrusted to another temple are not returned to the vicinity of that temple, the monks who originally placed the articles in that other temple should return them.🔽

original: nyid yin @258b no ;
analyzed: nyid yin @258b no ;
translated: If the articles deposited in another temple do not appear in the vicinity of that temple and are not returned, then the monks who first deposited the articles in that other place should demand and take them back.

original: /'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: /'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gal te gtsug lag khang gzhan na gnas pa'i dge slong la sogs pas rdzas gtams pa de dag brnogs shing phyir mi ster na de'i tshe dang po 'doms pa'i dge slong rnams kyis khungs su rma zhing phyir dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gtsug lag khang gzhan na gnas pa'i dge slong la sogs pas rdzas gtams pa de dag brnogs shing phyir mi ster na de'i tshe dang po 'doms pa'i dge slong rnams kyis khungs su rma zhing phyir dgug par bya'o //
translated: If the articles deposited by monks and so on who reside in another temple are lost and not returned, then at that time the monks who first deposited them should demand and take them back.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe gtsug lag khang gi bdag po de nyid kyis rang gis byas pa'i gtsug lag khang de nas rdzas dag gtsug lag khang gzhan du sbyin par byed na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe gtsug lag khang gi bdag po de nyid kyis rang gis byas pa'i gtsug lag khang de nas rdzas dag gtsug lag khang gzhan du sbyin par byed na /
translated: But if the owner of the temple himself donates the articles from that temple that he built to another temple,

original: de'i tshe dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: then at that time how should the monks act?

original: de'i phyir khyim bdag de nyid yin yang nges pa la gzhig pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyim bdag de nyid yin yang nges pa la gzhig pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, even though he is the very same householder, the certainty of his previous action is not destroyed.

original: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po'i khyim bdag de gnas gzhan gyi sbyin bdag de nyid yin yang sngar byas pa'i nges pa la gzhig pa med do //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi bdag po'i khyim bdag de gnas gzhan gyi sbyin bdag de nyid yin yang sngar byas pa'i nges pa la gzhig pa med do //
translated: Even though the householder who is the owner of the monastery is the very same donor of the other place, the certainty of his previous action is not destroyed.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'di ltar khyim bdag de nyid gnas gzhan gyi sbyin bdag tu gyur cing des dngos po de dag gnas gzhan du phul zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim bdag de nyid gnas gzhan gyi sbyin bdag tu gyur cing des dngos po de dag gnas gzhan du phul zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
translated: Even though the very same householder has become the donor of the other place and he has already offered those things to the other place,

original: sngar rdzas de dag gtsug lag khang gang du phul zin pa de nyid du spyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sngar rdzas de dag gtsug lag khang gang du phul zin pa de nyid du spyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: nevertheless, those things should be used in just that monastery where they were previously offered.

original: dang po nyid nas gnas snga ma shos de nyid du byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid nas gnas snga ma shos de nyid du byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they were given to the former place from the very beginning.

original: mi ster na mthus gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi ster na mthus gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not give, he should be taken by force.

original: khyim bdag des rdzas de dag sngar phul ba'i gtsug lag khang der mi ster na /
analyzed: khyim bdag des rdzas de dag sngar phul ba'i gtsug lag khang der mi ster na /
translated: If that householder does not give those things to the monastery where they were previously offered,

original: gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis mthus gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis mthus gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The monks who live in that temple should take it through their power.

original: gal te rdzas de mi snang na ni de'i tshe mdo snga ma las mi ster na de dag gis sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no zhes smos pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i yul yin no //
analyzed: gal te rdzas de mi snang na ni de'i tshe mdo snga ma las mi ster na de dag gis sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no zhes smos pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i yul yin no //
translated: If the object is not seen, then at that time, if it is not given according to the previous sūtra, it should be given by them. This is the object of the statement.

original: 'on te snang na ni mi ster na mthus gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di nyid kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: 'on te snang na ni mi ster na mthus gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di nyid kyi yul yin no //
translated: But if it is seen, then if it is not given, it should be taken through power. This is the object of this very sūtra.

original: g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be given as a loan.

original: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gnas gzhan du g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gnas gzhan du g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The object of another place should be given as a loan in another place.

original: mchod rten gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa ma grub pa la ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: mchod rten gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa ma grub pa la ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in the acquisition dedicated to another stūpa that has not been established.

original: byang chub chen po dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang lha las babs pa rnams kyi de dag las gzhan pa la ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub chen po dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang lha las babs pa rnams kyi de dag las gzhan pa la ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not dedicated to the great enlightenment, the wheel of the Dharma, the great miracles, and the descent from the gods.

original: mchod rten gzhan gang la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa mchod rten de la dbul bar ma grub cing der khyer yang mi nus na mchod rten gzhan la bsgyur ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mchod rten gzhan gang la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa mchod rten de la dbul bar ma grub cing der khyer yang mi nus na mchod rten gzhan la bsgyur ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is not established that the property dedicated to one stūpa is to be offered to that stūpa, and if it is not possible to transfer it there, then there is no fault in dedicating it to another stūpa.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽byang chub chen po dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang cho 'phrul chen po dang lha las babs pa rnams kyi rgyud du mnga' ba'i rnyed pa mchod rten @259a * //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir / byang chub chen po dang chos kyi 'khor lo dang cho 'phrul chen po dang lha las babs pa rnams kyi rgyud du mnga' ba'i rnyed pa mchod rten @259a * //
translated: To show the exception to the above rule,🔽the property belonging to the four great stūpas of the Great Awakening, the Wheel of the Dharma, the Great Miracle, and the Descent from the Gods

original: chen po bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i mchod rten gzhan la sgyur bar byed pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: chen po bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i mchod rten gzhan la sgyur bar byed pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: is not to be dedicated to other stūpas.

original: de ni nyes par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyes par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: That is a fault.

original: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gzhan gsum po gang yang rung ba la bsgyur ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gzhan gsum po gang yang rung ba la bsgyur ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no fault in dedicating the property belonging to one of the four great stūpas to any of the other three.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i mchod rten la bsngos pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ni gal te der bskur ba mi 'grub na dngos po de nyid mchod rten gzhan la bsgyur zhing spyad bar bya'o //
analyzed: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i mchod rten la bsngos pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ni gal te der bskur ba mi 'grub na dngos po de nyid mchod rten gzhan la bsgyur zhing spyad bar bya'o //
translated: If the object dedicated to one of the four great stūpas cannot be delivered there, that object should be dedicated to another stūpa and used.

original: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag la bsngos pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mchod rten chen po bzhi po de dag la bsngos pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni /
translated: But the object dedicated to one of the four great stūpas

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i mchod rten dag las bsgyur zhing spyad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i mchod rten dag las bsgyur zhing spyad par mi bya ste /
translated: should not be dedicated to another stūpa and used.

original: gang la bsngos pa de nyid la dbul bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang la bsngos pa de nyid la dbul bar bya ba'am /
translated: It should be offered to the very stūpa to which it was dedicated.

original: gal te gang la bsngos pa de nyid la dbul bar ma grub na bzhi po de dag nyid las gang nye bar gyur pa gcig la gzhan gsum la bsngos pa yang bsgyur cing spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te gang la bsngos pa de nyid la dbul bar ma grub na bzhi po de dag nyid las gang nye bar gyur pa gcig la gzhan gsum la bsngos pa yang bsgyur cing spyad du rung ngo //
translated: If it cannot be offered to the very stūpa to which it was dedicated, then it is appropriate to dedicate it to another of the four great stūpas and use it, since one of the four is nearby.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the prohibition against dedicating what has been dedicated.

original: // / da ni sog 'jog gi spang ba smra bar 'dod nas de'i zhar la 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sog 'jog gi spang ba smra bar 'dod nas de'i zhar la 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, wanting to explain the offense of storing, this is said as an aside.

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Every day that the seven-day period of consecration has passed, it should be announced to the monk.”

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa 'bru mar la sogs pa rdzas kyi nyi ma 'das shing thal lo cog dge slong la 'di skad ces deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa 'bru mar la sogs pa rdzas kyi nyi ma 'das shing thal lo cog dge slong la 'di skad ces deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Every day that the seven-day period of consecration of substances such as oil has passed, it should be announced to the monk, saying, “From today, the first day has passed. Today is the second day,” and so on.

original: brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: This is what should be announced.

original: ji zhig byas na sog 'jog gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji zhig byas na sog 'jog gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done that becomes the offense of storing?

original: de'i phyir bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If it is kept for the purpose of eating.”

original: zhag bdun pa'i rdzas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i rdzas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with “the substance of the seven-day period.”

original: 'chang ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'chang ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: This downfall is posited for keeping,

original: za ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: za ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: not for eating.

original: 'di ltar sog 'jog byas pa'i zas za ba la ltung ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sog 'jog byas pa'i zas za ba la ltung ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because eating stored food would be a mere downfall.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Thus the scripture here is:

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra of Individual Liberation declares:

original: yang dge slong gang bza' ba dang bca' ba sog 'jog byas pa 'chos sam zos na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang bza' ba dang bca' ba sog 'jog byas pa 'chos sam zos na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a bhikṣu eats stored food, he commits a downfall.

original: zos zin pa'i don la spang bar bya ba med pas des na zos pa ni 'di'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: zos zin pa'i don la spang bar bya ba med pas des na zos pa ni 'di'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Since there is nothing to abandon in the meaning of already eaten, that is not the object of this rule.

original: 'o na so sor thar pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'o na so sor thar pa'i mdo las /
translated: But the Sutra of Individual Liberation declares:

original: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyad par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de las 'das par yongs su longs spyad par byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: If one partakes of more than that, it is a downfall that is abandoned through confession.

original: bden @259b mod kyi 'on kyang 'chang ba de nye bar mtshon pa'i don du der za na zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bden @259b mod kyi 'on kyang 'chang ba de nye bar mtshon pa'i don du der za na zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa yin te /
translated: That is true, but the term “if one eats” is stated in that sutra in order to illustrate the act of storing.

original: 'chang ba med par za ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chang ba med par za ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to eat without storing.

original: ltung ba bstan par yang 'chang ba'i rgyu las kha na ma tho bar gsungs kyi za ba'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /🔽dge slong gis tshes la sman zhig rnyed cing des tshes gnyis la yang gzhan zhig rnyed na dge slong des nyi ma bdun po de nyid kyi nang du sman snga ma shos yongs su longs spyad par bya zhing phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: ltung ba bstan par yang 'chang ba'i rgyu las kha na ma tho bar gsungs kyi za ba'i rgyu las ni ma yin te / dge slong gis tshes la sman zhig rnyed cing des tshes gnyis la yang gzhan zhig rnyed na dge slong des nyi ma bdun po de nyid kyi nang du sman snga ma shos yongs su longs spyad par bya zhing phyi ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am /
translated: A downfall is accrued from possessing it, not from eating it.

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya'o //🔽yang na phyi ma shos yongs su longs spyad par bya zhing snga ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya'o // yang na phyi ma shos yongs su longs spyad par bya zhing snga ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am /
translated: If a fully ordained monk obtains medicine on the first day of the month and on the second day he obtains more, then within those seven days he should either use the medicine obtained first, discard it or give it to others.

original: gzhan la sbyin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin par bya ba'o //
translated: Or he should use the medicine obtained later, discard it or give it to others.

original: yongs su spyod par mi byed dam gtong bar mi byed dam gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na /
analyzed: yongs su spyod par mi byed dam gtong bar mi byed dam gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na /
translated: If he does not use it, discard it or give it to others,

original: nyi ma brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then when the dawn of the eighth day has risen, he commits a downfall that requires confession.

original: ji zhig 'chang na zhe na /
analyzed: ji zhig 'chang na zhe na /
translated: What is it that is to be possessed?

original: de'i phyir de'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is that.

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa de'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa de'o //
translated: It is that which is consecrated for seven days.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs pa ni zhag bdun las 'das par 'chang du zin kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs pa ni zhag bdun las 'das par 'chang du zin kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: If it is not consecrated, there is no offense if one keeps it beyond seven days,

original: rung ba'i phyir gser la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i phyir gser la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: because it is suitable, like gold and so on.

original: nam gyi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When is it abandoned?

original: de'i phyir skya rengs brgyad pa shar na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skya rengs brgyad pa shar na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: at sunrise on the eighth day.

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdzas skya rengs brgyad pa shar bar 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdzas skya rengs brgyad pa shar bar 'chang na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro ;
translated: If one keeps the substance consecrated for seven days until sunrise on the eighth day, it becomes a downfall that requires confession.

original: / zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdzas bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba las kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: / zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdzas bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba las kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: It is not only this downfall that occurs from keeping the substance consecrated for seven days for the purpose of eating.

original: 'di ltar byin len ma byas pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa mi sha la sogs pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang 'dres pa dang / brtag pa gzhan dang 'dres pa 'chang ba la yang kha na ma thob 'dir 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar byin len ma byas pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa mi sha la sogs pa dang / rung ba ma yin pa dang 'dres pa dang / brtag pa gzhan dang 'dres pa 'chang ba la yang kha na ma thob 'dir 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: So too, it is a fault to possess food that is not consecrated, that is not suitable such as human flesh and so on, that is mixed with what is not suitable or that is mixed with other substances.🔽For example, it is a fault to possess food that is mixed with substances suitable for the time period, but not suitable to be eaten after midday, which is the time for eating food suitable for the period of one day and night.

original: dper na dus su rung ba'i rdzas dang 'dres pa'i thun tshod du rung ba bzar mi rung bar gtogs pa'i nyi ma phyed yol phan chad du bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na 'dir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba lta bu dang / de bzhin du nang du btsos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon gyis rung ba ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa bza' ba'i 'chang ba dang /
analyzed: dper na dus su rung ba'i rdzas dang 'dres pa'i thun tshod du rung ba bzar mi rung bar gtogs pa'i nyi ma phyed yol phan chad du bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na 'dir gtogs pa'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba lta bu dang / de bzhin du nang du btsos pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon gyis rung ba ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa bza' ba'i 'chang ba dang /
translated: So too, it is a fault to possess food that is not suitable due to the fault of being cooked by oneself and so on.

original: de bzhin du dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba mi rung ba nyid du gyur pa dag bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba la yang bye brag 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus su rung ba dang / thun tshod du rung ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba mi rung ba nyid du gyur pa dag bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba la yang bye brag 'ga' yang med de /
translated: Similarly, there is no difference in the fault of possessing what is not to be eaten, such as what is suitable for a certain time, what is suitable for a certain occasion, and what is suitable for a certain period, because they are not to be eaten.

original: de lta bas na 'dir zhag bdun pa zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad par @260a * //🔽rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir zhag bdun pa zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad par @260a * // rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the term “seven days” here should be understood as merely an example.

original: 'o na 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall here?

original: de'i phyir bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa nyin mtshan 'das pa ni 'dir zos pa dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /🔽bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa nyin mtshan 'das pa ni zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa nyin mtshan 'das pa ni 'dir zos pa dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smras te / bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa nyin mtshan 'das pa ni zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Therefore, it is said: “Here, that which is not suitable to eat, but has passed a day and night, is posited as similar to that which is eaten.”🔽That which is not suitable to eat, but has passed a day and night, is similar to that which is eaten.

original: zos na kha na ma tho ba ci 'dra ba de bzhin du 'chang ba la yang de dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: zos na kha na ma tho ba ci 'dra ba de bzhin du 'chang ba la yang de dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: If one eats it, it is similar to the offense of eating what is not suitable to eat.🔽If one possesses it, it is similar to the offense of possessing what is not suitable to eat.

original: gal te zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ba ni 'chang na yang spang bar 'gyur ba dang / 'on te zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ba ni 'chang na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ba ni 'chang na yang spang bar 'gyur ba dang / 'on te zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ba ni 'chang na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one eats it, it is a downfall, then it is a downfall if one keeps it, and if one eats it, it is a misdeed, then it is a misdeed if one keeps it.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba la sogs pa sog 'jog byas pa de dag thams cad ni ji ltar zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'chang na yang spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba la sogs pa sog 'jog byas pa de dag thams cad ni ji ltar zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'chang na yang spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: If one eats any of the foods that are to be stored—those suitable for any time, those suitable for a fortnight, those suitable for seven days, those that can be kept until one is done eating, and so on—it is a downfall if one keeps it, just as it is a downfall if one eats it.

original: nyin mtshan 'das pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed dang ltung byed 'ba' zhig dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyin mtshan 'das pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed dang ltung byed 'ba' zhig dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is similar to the downfall of keeping food past the permitted time, and to the minor infraction of eating it.

original: nang du zhag lon ba dang / nang du btsos pa dang / byin len ma byas pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ba bzhin du 'chang na yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nang du zhag lon ba dang / nang du btsos pa dang / byin len ma byas pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar zos na nyes byas su 'gyur ba bzhin du 'chang na yang nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: , which has been kept overnight, cooked overnight, or not received, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct, just as if one were to consume it.

original: de don gang gi phyir brtags pa de'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la /🔽de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de don gang gi phyir brtags pa de'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba la / de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if one examines it for the purpose of that.

original: zhag bdun pa'i 'bru mar la sogs pa'o ;🔽/ don gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i 'bru mar la sogs pa'o ; / don gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That means the seven day oil, etc.

original: rkang pa bsku ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa'i phyir ro //🔽brtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkang pa bsku ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa'i phyir ro // brtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the purpose of that means for the purpose of the need of anointing the feet, etc.

original: rung bar byas pa de nyid de /
analyzed: rung bar byas pa de nyid de /
translated: Examination means making it suitable.

original: de'i phyir 'chang ba la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chang ba la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense in keeping it.

original: blos yongs su ma bcad par 'chang ba la yang kha na ma tho ba 'dra ste /🔽bye brag ni spyi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: blos yongs su ma bcad par 'chang ba la yang kha na ma tho ba 'dra ste / bye brag ni spyi'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ;
translated: There is also no offense if one keeps it without having examined it mentally.🔽Because the specific is included in the general,

original: bza' ba'i phyir yang de'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bza' ba'i phyir yang de'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: it is included in the general.

original: de lta bas na bag med pa dang dran ba nyams pas 'chang ba ni bza' ba'i phyir yid kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir kha na mtho ba 'dra'o //🔽snar blugs pa dang bsku mnye bya ba dag ni sog 'jog byas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na bag med pa dang dran ba nyams pas 'chang ba ni bza' ba'i phyir yid kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir kha na mtho ba 'dra'o // snar blugs pa dang bsku mnye bya ba dag ni sog 'jog byas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is like a downfall that is not collected by the mind for the sake of eating, because it is held by carelessness and the loss of mindfulness.🔽It is suitable to store nose-grease and massage oil.

original: snar blugs pa dang lus kyi bsku mnye bya ba'i 'bru mar la sogs pa dag ni sog 'jog byar rung ba'o //
analyzed: snar blugs pa dang lus kyi bsku mnye bya ba'i 'bru mar la sogs pa dag ni sog 'jog byar rung ba'o //
translated: Nose-grease and massage oil for the body are suitable to be stored.

original: sog 'jog gi spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to //
analyzed: sog 'jog gi spang ba'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to //
translated: The prohibition on storing has been explained.🔽The prohibitions have been completed.

original: spang ba rnams rdzogs so zhes bya ba spang ba'i ltung byed sum cu po dag bshad zin to /
analyzed: spang ba rnams rdzogs so zhes bya ba spang ba'i ltung byed sum cu po dag bshad zin to /
translated: The thirty downfalls that are to be abandoned have been explained.

original: // / spang ba'i ltung byed rnams kyi 'og tu ltung bde 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba rnams @260b brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / spang ba'i ltung byed rnams kyi 'og tu ltung bde 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba rnams @260b brjod par bya ste /
translated: After the downfalls that are to be abandoned, the downfalls that are only downfalls should be mentioned.

original: spang bar bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir des na 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir des na 'ba' zhig ces bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: Because there is no thing to be abandoned, it is called “only.”

original: de dag ni grangs dgu bcur chad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni grangs dgu bcur chad pa yin no //
translated: They are limited to ninety in number.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo las brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed dang po kho nar gsungs pa la 'dul ba las brdzun du smra ba ni rnam pa lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo las brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed dang po kho nar gsungs pa la 'dul ba las brdzun du smra ba ni rnam pa lnga gsungs te /
translated: The Vinaya states that there are five types of lies:

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: those that are a root downfall, those that are a partial defeat, those that are a serious violation, those that are an actual downfall and those that are an offense of wrongdoing.

original: de la pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni de dag nyid kyi skabs su bshad zin to /
analyzed: de la pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni de dag nyid kyi skabs su bshad zin to /
translated: The characteristics of the first two types of lies those that are a root downfall and those that are a partial defeat have already been explained in the section on the vows of individual liberation.

original: // / da ni gsum po dag gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni gsum po dag gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now I will explain the characteristics of the latter three types.

original: de la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni brdzun du smra ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba nyung ba'i phyir 'dir dang por brjod par bya ste /🔽dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su dang chos chos ma yin par ston pa ni nyes ba sbom po'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni brdzun du smra ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba nyung ba'i phyir 'dir dang por brjod par bya ste / dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su dang chos chos ma yin par ston pa ni nyes ba sbom po'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristics of the two types of lying, one that is a serious transgression and one that is an offense of wrong conduct, are stated here first because the context is lying and because the subject matter is brief.🔽Lying to a saṅgha assembly that is in accord about what is Dharma and what is not Dharma is a serious transgression.

original: dge 'dun 'dus pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Lying to a saṅgha assembly that is in accord about what is Dharma and what is not Dharma is a serious transgression.🔽A saṅgha assembly is a saṅgha that is in accord about what is Dharma and what is not Dharma.

original: dge 'dun gyi spyan sngar dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi sbyor bas dbye bar rung gi gzhan du ma yin pas /🔽de'i phyir dge 'dun 'dus pa la dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi spyan sngar dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi sbyor bas dbye bar rung gi gzhan du ma yin pas / de'i phyir dge 'dun 'dus pa la dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is suitable to divide a saṅgha that is in accord about what is Dharma and what is not Dharma, but not one that is not in accord,🔽therefore, lying to a saṅgha assembly that is in accord about what is Dharma and what is not Dharma in order to divide the saṅgha

original: chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa la sogs pa'i brdzun smras pa ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa la sogs pa'i brdzun smras pa ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: is a serious transgression.

original: gzhan du brdzun smras pa ni ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du brdzun smras pa ni ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is only a downfall.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
