analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Intentionally” means

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo shes bzhin du log par ston pas /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo shes bzhin du log par ston pas /
translated: that one teaches falsely, knowing the nature of what is Dharma and what is not Dharma.

original: de'i phyir de ni nyes pa sbom po yin par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni nyes pa sbom po yin par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is established as a serious transgression.

original: chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Not Dharma” means

original: rigs pa ma yin pa bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: that it is not reasonable and should not be done.

original: chos su ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos su ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Teaching Dharma” means

original: chos nyid dang bya ba nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid dang bya ba nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: that it is taught as the nature of Dharma and should be done.

original: chos dang chos ma yin par ston pa zhes bya ba yang de las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin par ston pa zhes bya ba yang de las bzlog pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “ Teaching Dharma and not Dharma” is also to be applied in the same way as the opposite of that.

original: de ni nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: That is a serious transgression.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gang la la zhig dge 'dun gyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bya ba ma yin pa ni bya ba nyid du ston par byed /
analyzed: gang la la zhig dge 'dun gyi dbus su bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bya ba ma yin pa ni bya ba nyid du ston par byed /
translated: If someone in the midst of the Saṅgha teaches that what the Bhagavān said should not be done is in fact what should be done,

original: bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed na /
analyzed: bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ston par byed na /
translated: If one teaches that what is not an action is an action,

original: de'i tshe de la nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time there is a downfall called “grave offense.”

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod nas /🔽gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed @261a * //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba'i mtshan nyid brjod par 'dod nas / gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed @261a * //
translated: Having stated the characteristics of lying that is a minor offense,🔽he said, “In the purification ceremony, if one does not say anything,

original: yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: knowing that the purity has not been announced three times, one commits a minor offense.”

original: gso sbyong la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gso sbyong la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the purification ceremony means

original: dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad pa'i nang du'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad pa'i nang du'o //
translated: in the midst of the purification ceremony of the saṅgha.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni yongs su dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni yongs su dri ba'o //
translated: What means “is it being asked?”

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means

original: gso sbyong la'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong la'o //
translated: in the purification ceremony.

original: khyed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyed ces bya ba ni /
translated: You means

original: khyed cag go //
analyzed: khyed cag go //
translated: you all.

original: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Is it pure? means

original: ltung ba ma byung ngam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ma byung ngam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: has there been any downfall?🔽This means

original: zhes zhes bya ba ni dri ba spyi la snyegs so //
analyzed: zhes zhes bya ba ni dri ba spyi la snyegs so //
translated: the general question.

original: lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Up to three times is asked is as follows.

original: lan gsum kho na dri bar bya dgos pa lan gsum pa rdzogs kyi bar du dris pa las so //
analyzed: lan gsum kho na dri bar bya dgos pa lan gsum pa rdzogs kyi bar du dris pa las so //
translated: One must ask up to three times, up to the completion of the third asking.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: dge 'dun gso sbyong la tshogs pa na so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pas dge 'dun la lan gsum kho nar 'di skad ces ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gso sbyong la tshogs pa na so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pas dge 'dun la lan gsum kho nar 'di skad ces ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya ste /
translated: When the Saṅgha is gathered for the purification-renewal, the Sūtra of Individual Liberation is recited, and the Saṅgha is asked three times, “Is the Saṅgha pure in this matter?”

original: bshags pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa gnyis kyis ltung ba ma bcabs pa sha stag tshogs pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshags pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa gnyis kyis ltung ba ma bcabs pa sha stag tshogs pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means, “Is the Saṅgha gathered without any concealed downfalls?”

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pas de skad dris pa na gang la la zhig ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas bdag nyid yongs su dag par ston cing dri ba gsum pa'i dus 'da' bar byed na de la nyes byas kyi ltung ba 'di
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pas de skad dris pa na gang la la zhig ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas bdag nyid yongs su dag par ston cing dri ba gsum pa'i dus 'da' bar byed na de la nyes byas kyi ltung ba 'di
translated: When the Sūtra of Individual Liberation is recited and this is asked, if someone, knowing that they are impure, remains silent, showing themselves to be pure, and lets the time of the third asking pass, then this offense of wrongdoing

original: 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: arises for them.

original: de ni nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi yid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi yid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: That is a complete offense, but not by intention,

original: kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is indicative form of the body, such as changing the face.

original: da ni ltung byed du gyur pa'i brdzun du smra ba'i mtshan nyid smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: da ni ltung byed du gyur pa'i brdzun du smra ba'i mtshan nyid smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: Now, in order to explain the characteristics of lying that is a serious offense,

original: de gnyis dang pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa gnyis las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis dang pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa gnyis las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o zhes bya ba smras te / de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it is said, “Lying that is other than those two and the two that are grounds for defeat and the two that are serious offenses.”

original: bstan ma thag pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis so //
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis so //
translated: Those two refers to the two types of lying that are serious offenses and lying that is a minor offense that were just explained.

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The two that are grounds for defeat and the two that are serious offenses refers to

original: de gnyis sngar bstan pa las te /
analyzed: de gnyis sngar bstan pa las te /
translated: those two that were previously explained.

original: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa bzhi bo de dag las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba 'du shes bsgyur ba ni /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa bzhi bo de dag las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba 'du shes bsgyur ba ni /
translated: Lying that is other than those four types of lying is lying that is a serious offense.

original: ltung byed du gyur pa'i brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ltung byed du gyur pa'i brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called lying that is a downfall.

original: de las ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: brdzun du smra ba bstan ma thag pa gnyis dang / sngar bstan pa gnyis te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba bstan ma thag pa gnyis dang / sngar bstan pa gnyis te /
translated: The two types of lying that have just been explained and the two types of lying that were explained earlier make four types.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i brdzun @261b du smra ba don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba las ltung byed 'di rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i brdzun @261b du smra ba don shes pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba las ltung byed 'di rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Lying that is different from these four types is established as a downfall when the object understands the meaning and the thought is distorted.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: Lying is established by the power of thought,

original: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: not by the power of the object.🔽If one has the thought to lie to someone who understands the meaning, there is no doubt that this is lying.

original: smra bar 'dod pa la 'du shes gzhan 'byung ba brdzun du smra ba yin pa de la ni the tshom med kyi smra ba'i tshe na 'du shes gzhan 'byung ba ni brdzun du smra bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smra bar 'dod pa la 'du shes gzhan 'byung ba brdzun du smra ba yin pa de la ni the tshom med kyi smra ba'i tshe na 'du shes gzhan 'byung ba ni brdzun du smra bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if the thought changes when one actually speaks, this is not lying.

original: dang po'i 'du shes nyid kyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po'i 'du shes nyid kyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is motivated by the perception that occurred at the outset.🔽To dispel that doubt, he says:

original: smra ba'i tshe nyid na yang 'du shes byung na de kun nas slong ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: smra ba'i tshe nyid na yang 'du shes byung na de kun nas slong ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Even when speaking, if a perception occurs, it motivates that.

original: smra bar byed pa de ni smra ba'i tshe ste /
analyzed: smra bar byed pa de ni smra ba'i tshe ste /
translated: That which speaks is speaking.

original: smra ba'i tshe de'i don gang yin pa'i don de la 'du shes gzhan byung na brdzun du smra ba de kun nas slong ba yin no //
analyzed: smra ba'i tshe de'i don gang yin pa'i don de la 'du shes gzhan byung na brdzun du smra ba de kun nas slong ba yin no //
translated: When speaking, if a perception of a different meaning of the meaning that is being spoken occurs, that lying motivates that.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: tshig brjod pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'di lta bu'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshig brjod pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'di lta bu'i 'du shes 'byung ste /
translated: Even in the context of expressing words, a perception such as this occurs:🔽The meaning that is being spoken is established as one way, but I will speak in a different way.

original: don gang smra ba de gzhan du rnam par gnas la bdag gis ni gzhan du smra bar bya'o snyam na de la yang brdzun du smra par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: don gang smra ba de gzhan du rnam par gnas la bdag gis ni gzhan du smra bar bya'o snyam na de la yang brdzun du smra par 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: Even in that case, it is only lying.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra las ni dang po kho na rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na 'du shes gzhan du 'byung blta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra las ni dang po kho na rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na 'du shes gzhan du 'byung blta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word “also” indicates that it is needless to mention that the other discriminations arise in the state of analysis.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the treatise:

original: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two types of lying?

original: shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra ba ni 'di snyam du brdzun gyi tshig smra'o snyam pa dang / de nas smras pa'i 'og tu 'di snyam du bdag gis brdzun gyi tshig smras so snyam pa ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra ba ni 'di snyam du brdzun gyi tshig smra'o snyam pa dang / de nas smras pa'i 'og tu 'di snyam du bdag gis brdzun gyi tshig smras so snyam pa ste /
translated: Lying with full awareness is when one thinks, “I will speak false words,” and after speaking them, one thinks, “I have spoken false words.”

original: de'i phyir brdzun du smra ba rnam pa gcig ni med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽lan 'ga' ni sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i dngos gzhi yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir brdzun du smra ba rnam pa gcig ni med do zhes gsungs pa yin no // lan 'ga' ni sbyor ba dang bcas pa'i dngos gzhi yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no single type of lying.🔽Sometimes it is the main practice together with the preparation.

original: lan 'ga' ni dngos gzhi mjug dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni dngos gzhi mjug dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes it is the main practice together with the conclusion.

original: brdzun du smra ba mjug nyi tshe la ni med de tshig thal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba mjug nyi tshe la ni med de tshig thal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no lying with only the conclusion, because the words have already been uttered.

original: mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not take an oath.

original: phran tshegs dag las btus pa yin te /
analyzed: phran tshegs dag las btus pa yin te /
translated: This is extracted from the Ksudraka Collection.

original: drug sde dag sangs rgyas kyis mna' 'dor bar byed pa'i gleng gzhi las /
analyzed: drug sde dag sangs rgyas kyis mna' 'dor bar byed pa'i gleng gzhi las /
translated: The group of six monks made the Buddha take an oath.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: “Therefore,

original: dge slong gis mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: monks should not take oaths.”

original: 'di ltar mna' 'dor bar byed pa las ni 'di ltar bsgrags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mna' 'dor bar byed pa las ni 'di ltar bsgrags par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of taking an oath, it would be proclaimed,

original: kho bo don thams cad la bden pas zhugs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo don thams cad la bden pas zhugs pa ma yin te /
translated: “I do not enter into truth for all purposes.

original: gang la mna' 'dor ba de la mna'i dbang gis kho bo bden par zhugs pa yin no zhes bsgrags pa'i skyon du 'gyur @262a * //
analyzed: gang la mna' 'dor ba de la mna'i dbang gis kho bo bden par zhugs pa yin no zhes bsgrags pa'i skyon du 'gyur @262a * //
translated: I enter into truth because of the power of the oath for that which I am taking an oath.”

original: bas de'i phyir dge slong gis mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bas de'i phyir dge slong gis mna' 'dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, monks should not take oaths.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of lying has been explained.🔽The offense of speaking of faults. The text is to be understood as follows:

original: // / skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas dge slong gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: // / skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas dge slong gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one wishes to speak, one should say, “The monk’s.”

original: mdo 'di dang 'og gi mdo las rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras na'o zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di dang 'og gi mdo las rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras na'o zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the statement in the sutra below that “if one speaks of any unsuitable topic, it is a downfall.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras na skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smras na skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: If one speaks of any unsuitable topic, it is a downfall series.

original: de nyid dge slong gi yul kho na la yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid dge slong gi yul kho na la yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood to apply only to the domain of fully ordained monks.

original: dge slong gis dge slong la smra na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la smra na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: If a fully ordained monk speaks to a fully ordained monk, this is a downfall.

original: dge tshul la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dge tshul la sogs pa gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not apply to novices and so on,

original: de la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni nyes byas su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a minor infraction is declared for them.

original: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same applies to the next.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i 'og ma dge slong la phra ma byed pa zhes bya ba la yang dge slong kho na la smras na ste /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i 'og ma dge slong la phra ma byed pa zhes bya ba la yang dge slong kho na la smras na ste /
translated: The next rule is that if a fully ordained monk speaks divisively to a fully ordained monk, it is a downfall.

original: de la yang dge slong gi yul kho na la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gi yul kho na la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: This also applies only to the domain of fully ordained monks.

original: dge tshul la sogs pa gzhan dag la ni nyes byas kho na'o //
analyzed: dge tshul la sogs pa gzhan dag la ni nyes byas kho na'o //
translated: For others, such as novices, it is only a minor offense.

original: de lta bas na skyon nas smra ba dang / dge slong la phra ma byed pa zhes bya ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi gnyi ga yang dge slong gi yul kho na la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na skyon nas smra ba dang / dge slong la phra ma byed pa zhes bya ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi gnyi ga yang dge slong gi yul kho na la rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, both the training precepts “to speak of the faults of others” and “to engage in divisive speech against a monk” should be understood to apply only to monks as the basis.

original: phra ma la sogs pa med par tshig kyal pa 'ba' zhig smra ba la ni nyes byas kho na'o //
analyzed: phra ma la sogs pa med par tshig kyal pa 'ba' zhig smra ba la ni nyes byas kho na'o //
translated: For one who speaks idle chatter without divisive speech, etc., it is only a minor offense.

original: sems yongs su dag pas kyang rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smra ba srid pas de las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pas kyang rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smra ba srid pas de las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is possible that one may speak of any of the three topics with a completely pure mind, but with an improper attitude, this is stated to distinguish that.

original: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One who wishes to speak of faults.

original: 'di'i skyon nyid brjod par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas dge slong gi skyon nas smras na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i skyon nyid brjod par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas dge slong gi skyon nas smras na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one speaks of the faults of a monk with the thought “I will speak of his faults,” this is a downfall.

original: tshig ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: tshig ji lta bus she na /
translated: With what kind of words?

original: de'i phyir 'jam pos kyang rung rtsub mos kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam pos kyang rung rtsub mos kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “whether gentle or harsh.”

original: tshig 'jam pos kyang rung tshig rtsub mos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshig 'jam pos kyang rung tshig rtsub mos kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether with gentle words or harsh words,

original: dge slong gi skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: dge slong gi skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas /
translated: if one wishes to speak about the faults of a fully ordained monk,

original: rung ba ma yin par bsam pas brjod na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin par bsam pas brjod na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: if one speaks with an improper thought, this is a downfall.

original: gang gi phyir skyon nas smra ba dang bcas pa'i tshig rtsub po smras na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyon nas smra ba dang bcas pa'i tshig rtsub po smras na /
translated: Because if one speaks harsh words that are accompanied by speaking about faults,

original: dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de'i phyir tshig rtsub po smra ba yang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos gzhir 'gyur ba de'i phyir tshig rtsub po smra ba yang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
translated: then it becomes the actual basis. Therefore, speaking harsh words is also included in this very training precept.

original: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung bas smra na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung bas smra na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one speaks with any improper thought,

original: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa zhes bya ba dman par bsam pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba lus kyi 'am sems kyi gang yang rung @262b ba smras na /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa zhes bya ba dman par bsam pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba lus kyi 'am sems kyi gang yang rung @262b ba smras na /
translated: means that if one speaks with any improper thought, any inferior thought, any physical or mental thought,

original: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: then one commits the downfall of speaking about faults.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: This is illustrated by the following story.

original: khyod ni mdze can no zhe 'am /
analyzed: khyod ni mdze can no zhe 'am /
translated: You are a leper.

original: zhar ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / khyod ni khro ba'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: zhar ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu dang / khyod ni khro ba'o zhe 'am /
translated: It is like saying, He is a son of so-and-so, or You are angry.

original: 'khrug pa can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, You are angry, or You are quarrelsome, and so on.

original: mi dga' ba nyid du ma gyur na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dga' ba nyid du ma gyur na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if he is not displeased, and so on.

original: mi dga' ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi dga' ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, displeased means

original: khros pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang / yi chad pa dang / skyes pa dang / yul yul por gyur pa zhes bya ba dag dang don gcig go //
analyzed: khros pa dang / 'khrugs pa dang / yi chad pa dang / skyes pa dang / yul yul por gyur pa zhes bya ba dag dang don gcig go //
translated: angry, quarrelsome, disappointed, and dejected.

original: ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is not displeased, means

original: nyan pa po mi dga' ba nyid de dag tu ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: nyan pa po mi dga' ba nyid de dag tu ma gyur na'o //
translated: if the listener is not displeased.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even so, means

original: 'on kyang skyon nas smra ba'i kha na ma tho ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyon nas smra ba'i kha na ma tho ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that there is still the fault of speaking of the faults.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Thus, the text here says,

original: dge slong mi dga' ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong mi dga' ba nyid du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: whether the monk is displeased or not.

original: gzhan rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other, such as being a kṣatriya or a brahmin, is a minor offense, and so on.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “other” means

original: rung pa ma yin par bsam pa las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: rung pa ma yin par bsam pa las gzhan pa ste /
translated: other than what is appropriate.

original: dge slong la rgyal rigs nyid dang / bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i tshig smras na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong la rgyal rigs nyid dang / bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i skyes bu'i tshig smras na nyes byas so //
translated: If one says to a fully ordained monk, “You are a member of the warrior caste,” or “You are a member of the priestly caste,” it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge 'dun la sogs pa la smras na ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun la sogs pa la smras na ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If one says this to a fully ordained nun, it is a minor offense.

original: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of criticizing has been explained.

original: // / phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The offense for divisive speech is incurred when,

original: phra ma byed 'dod pas che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes smras na'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽phra ma byed 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phra ma byed 'dod pas che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes smras na'o zhes bya ba smras te / phra ma byed 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: with the intention to divide, one says to another, “So-and-so says this about you.”🔽The phrase “with the intention to divide”

original: gzhan dbye ba'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dbye ba'i bsam pa ste /
translated: means with the intention to create disharmony.

original: nye ba 'khor nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor nyes byas su 'gyur ro //

original: skyo sngogs byed pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de'i phyir yang las kyi skyo sngogs byed na zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: it shows that discernment is the primary factor.

original: rnam pa de nyid 'di la yang yod par ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid 'di la yang yod par ston to //
translated: That aspect also exists in this case.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: tshig drug pa las lhag pa nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: tshig drug pa las lhag pa nyid kyang yin la /
translated: If there is excess beyond the six words,

original: lhag pa nyid du 'du shes pa yang yod na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: lhag pa nyid du 'du shes pa yang yod na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: and if there is also the discernment of excess, then it is the actual basis.

original: ma lhag pa nyid la lhag par 'du shes shing ston na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma lhag pa nyid la lhag par 'du shes shing ston na nyes byas so //
translated: If one teaches with the discernment of excess in what is not in excess, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yid gnyis zan ni yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o zhes bya bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis zan ni yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o zhes bya bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Doubt is similar to discernment.

original: tshig lnga pa ni rtsom pa lnga pa las so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig lnga pa ni rtsom pa lnga pa las so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five words are from the five compositions.

original: ston pa gang la tshig lnga yod pa de ni tshig lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa gang la tshig lnga yod pa de ni tshig lnga pa'o //
translated: The one who has five words is the one with five words.

original: de rtsom pa ni brtsam pa ste /
analyzed: de rtsom pa ni brtsam pa ste /
translated: The beginning of that is the commencement.

original: tshig lnga pa las lhag par ston na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: tshig lnga pa las lhag par ston na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If one teaches more than five words, it is the actual basis.

original: tshig gcig pa la sogs pa gzhan thams cad kyi rtsom pa la ni tshig drug pa las lhag par ston na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig pa la sogs pa gzhan thams cad kyi rtsom pa la ni tshig drug pa las lhag par ston na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: In the commencement of all the others, such as the one with one word, if one teaches more than six words, it is the actual basis.

original: 'dir tshig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir tshig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, a word

original: smra bar 'dod pa'i don gcig go bar byed pa'i tshig la bya ste /
analyzed: smra bar 'dod pa'i don gcig go bar byed pa'i tshig la bya ste /
translated: is taken to be a word that causes one to understand a single meaning that one wishes to speak.

original: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i dbang gis gzugs mi rtag pa bye brag dang bcas pa ni tshig gcig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na smra bar 'dod pa'i dbang gis gzugs mi rtag pa bye brag dang bcas pa ni tshig gcig ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like saying, Form is impermanent with distinctions is one word.

original: gzugs tsam rjes su bshad @264b pa smra bar 'dod pa la phung po ni lnga ste /
analyzed: gzugs tsam rjes su bshad @264b pa smra bar 'dod pa la phung po ni lnga ste /
translated: For one who wishes to speak an explanation of mere form, The aggregates are five is different.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba dag ni tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba dag ni tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness is different.

original: mdor bstan pa la ni rgyas par bshad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa la ni rgyas par bshad pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the brief presentation is subordinate to the extensive explanation.

original: mdor bstan pa de rgyas par bshad pa las tha mi dad de /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa de rgyas par bshad pa las tha mi dad de /
translated: That brief presentation is not different from the extensive explanation,

original: dper na phung po ni lnga ste zhes bya ba de rgyas par bshad pa las tha mi dad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phung po ni lnga ste zhes bya ba de rgyas par bshad pa las tha mi dad pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the statement “The aggregates are five” is not different from the extensive explanation.

original: mkhas pas gong nas gong du dris pa gtan la dbab pa byas pa dang / slob gnyer gsod pa dang / kha don zhu ba dang / dmigs kyis 'dri ba dang / dus khrims dbog pa dang / yon bshad pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mkhas pas gong nas gong du dris pa gtan la dbab pa byas pa dang / slob gnyer gsod pa dang / kha don zhu ba dang / dmigs kyis 'dri ba dang / dus khrims dbog pa dang / yon bshad pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The learned one should not settle a question by asking a higher authority, nor should he kill a student, nor should he ask for a recitation, nor should he ask a question on a specific point, nor should he give a time limit, nor should he explain the gift.

original: tshig drug pa las lhag na zhes bya ba spyir gtang ba de dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: tshig drug pa las lhag na zhes bya ba spyir gtang ba de dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: The general rule “If it exceeds six words” is excepted by this verse.

original: mkhas pas gong nas gong du dris pa gtan la dbab par byas pa ni lhag par ston pa'i byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pas gong nas gong du dris pa gtan la dbab par byas pa ni lhag par ston pa'i byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
translated: The learned one should not settle a question by asking a higher authority, nor should he kill a student, nor should he ask for a recitation, nor should he ask a question on a specific point, nor should he give a time limit, nor should he explain the gift.

original: de bzhin du slob gnyer gsod pa dang / kha ton zhu ba dang / dmigs kyis 'dri ba dang / dus khrims dbog pa dang / yon bshad pa dag kyang lhag par ston pa'i byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du slob gnyer gsod pa dang / kha ton zhu ba dang / dmigs kyis 'dri ba dang / dus khrims dbog pa dang / yon bshad pa dag kyang lhag par ston pa'i byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is not the case that the teacher is the primary perpetrator of the act of killing a student, giving a recitation, asking a question, setting the time for a ceremony, or explaining a gift.

original: de la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for these.

original: kha ton zhu ba smos pas klog pa yang bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: kha ton zhu ba smos pas klog pa yang bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The recitation of a text is included by the mention of giving a recitation.

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang dbyar tshul ma gnyis kyi klog pa'i phyir 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / 'char ka gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das la ci klag lags so zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lhogs shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang dbyar tshul ma gnyis kyi klog pa'i phyir 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / 'char ka gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das la ci klag lags so zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lhogs shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Noble Śāriputra and Udayi asked the Bhagavān, “What should we recite?” and the Bhagavān said, “Recite the scriptures.”

original: dus khrims dbog pa dang / yon bshad pa gnyis kyi gzhung ni /
analyzed: dus khrims dbog pa dang / yon bshad pa gnyis kyi gzhung ni /
translated: The scriptures on setting the time for a ceremony and explaining a gift state:

original: zhu ba'i gzhung las yon bshad pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zhu ba'i gzhung las yon bshad pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense in explaining a gift.

original: bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa dbog pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa dbog pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no offense in setting the time for the eight-part upavāsa.

original: gnas gzhan du ni snga ma ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du ni snga ma ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In other places, it is not the same as before.

original: khyams la sogs pa gnas gzhan du bstan pa byas pa ni snga ma gnas khang la sogs par byas pa dang / lhan cig ma byas pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyams la sogs pa gnas gzhan du bstan pa byas pa ni snga ma gnas khang la sogs par byas pa dang / lhan cig ma byas pa nyid de /
translated: In other places, such as courtyards, the teaching is not the same as before in places such as the monastery.

original: de la ltung ba rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la ltung ba rnam par gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: There, one should not establish a downfall.

original: ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of teaching has been explained.

original: // /'don pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang cig car ram mjug thogs su ston byed du gyur pa'i chos dang yi ge yang 'don na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: // /'don pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang cig car ram mjug thogs su ston byed du gyur pa'i chos dang yi ge yang 'don na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The downfall of reciting is if, desiring to recite, one recites together with or immediately after a novice, or if one recites the Dharma and the letters that are the means of teaching.🔽A monk recites together with a novice.

original: dge slong gis rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang / cig car zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang / cig car zhes bya ba ni dus gcig tu'o //
translated: Immediately after means at the same time.

original: mjug thogs su zhes bya ba ni /🔽rdzogs par ma bsnyen pas bton pa'i mjug thogs su @265a * //
analyzed: mjug thogs su zhes bya ba ni / rdzogs par ma bsnyen pas bton pa'i mjug thogs su @265a * //
translated: Immediately after means🔽immediately after a novice recites.

original: 'don pa'o // ston byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'don pa'o // ston byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The means of teaching is

original: 'dir mdo sde la sogs pa lung yin par bsams te /
analyzed: 'dir mdo sde la sogs pa lung yin par bsams te /
translated: Here, the scriptures such as the sutras are considered to be the scriptures.

original: 'di ltar lung gi don nyan pa po'i rgyud dag la ston par byed pa gsal bar byed pas na de'i phyir lung ni ston byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar lung gi don nyan pa po'i rgyud dag la ston par byed pa gsal bar byed pas na de'i phyir lung ni ston byed ces bya'o //
translated: Since the meaning of the scriptures is taught to the mindstream of the listener, it is called the teacher because it illuminates.

original: der gyur pa zhes bya ba ni der gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: der gyur pa zhes bya ba ni der gtogs pa ste /
translated: That which is called “that which has become” is that which belongs to that.

original: lung du gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung du gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “that which belongs to the scriptures.”

original: chos dang yi ge yang 'don na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos dang yi ge yang 'don na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One may recite the Dharma and the letters.

original: lung du gtogs pa drang srong gis gsungs pa'i chos dang / yi ge rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang / cir car ram mjug thogs su 'don na /
analyzed: lung du gtogs pa drang srong gis gsungs pa'i chos dang / yi ge rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa dang / cir car ram mjug thogs su 'don na /
translated: If one recites the Dharma and the letters that belong to the scriptures, the words of the sages, without having taken up the preliminary training, or if one recites them immediately or in sequence,

analyzed: 'don pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is the meaning of “one commits a downfall of reciting.”

analyzed: 'o na chos zhes smos pa nyid kyis ston byed kyang thob pa yin na ston byed dang chos zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyi ga ci'i phyir smos she na /

translated: Since the word “teaching” exists in the treatises of the tīrthikas, the word “Dharma” is used to distinguish it from that.

original: 'dir ltar lung las btus pa'i tshig gzhan du sbyar ba yang chos zhes bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ltar lung las btus pa'i tshig gzhan du sbyar ba yang chos zhes bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Here, the words extracted from the scriptures and applied elsewhere are also called “Dharma.”

original: dper na chos thams cad bdag med do //
analyzed: dper na chos thams cad bdag med do //
translated: For example, “All phenomena are selfless,” “All conditioned phenomena are momentary,” and so on.

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu dang / de bzhin du lung gi don las btus shing lung gi yi ge med pa ming dang tshig dan gyi ge gzhan gyi bye brag dang ldan pa yang chos zhes bya ba nyid yin mod kyi de dag ni ston byed du 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /

analyzed: dper na slob dpon dpa' bos byas pa'i skyes pa'i rabs kyi rgyud la sogs pa dag lta bu'o //
